title: Digital Operations Manager / Executive Assistant to CEO
description:
ABOUT US



We are a US-based commerce company, the American arm of an established European e-commerce and trading group operating across 29 countries with 650,000+ products across multiple brands in construction, home improvement, sustainability, and premium bath & kitchen.



We are also a US distributor of a European contactless QR-payment solution for churches, nonprofits, and venues.



Our motto: "Do it with Passion or don't do it at all."



We are building a Commerce 4.0 infrastructure with AI-driven automation, and we need a sharp, resourceful person to become the CEO's digital right hand.





THIS IS NOT A TYPICAL VA ROLE



We are looking for someone who thinks like an entrepreneur, not just an assistant. You will co-build operations across the USA and Southeast Asia, manage teams, drive sales, and grow with us into a leadership position. If you want to be part of building something big - this is your opportunity.





YOUR ROLE - SIX KEY AREAS



1. US FINTECH PRODUCT - Sales & Distribution Support

We distribute a European contactless QR-payment solution for churches, zoos, museums, and nonprofits in the US market. We're building the sales infrastructure from scratch - so tell us what tools you've worked with and we'll set it up together.

- Build and maintain lead lists (churches, zoos, museums, nonprofits across the US)

- Set up and manage a CRM pipeline from zero (you recommend the tool, we d
 together)

- Coordinate
 campaigns and follow-ups with our US Managing Partner

- Prepare sales materials, proposals, and demo scheduling

- Research target markets and verticals

As this grows, you'll hire sales support and manage them - so you need to understand the full sales cycle yourself first.



2. VIETNAM & SOUTHEAST ASIA - Team Building

We are building a remote operations team in Southeast Asia (Vietnam and Philippines). You will help recruit, onboard, and coordinate.

- Post job openings on local platforms (VietnamWorks, TopCV, TopDev, OnlineJobs.ph)

- Screen candidates, conduct initial interviews, coordinate with CEO for final decisions

- Set up daily standups, reporting, and project tracking (Slack, Notion, GitHub)

- Act as the bridge between Austrian HQ and the Southeast Asian team

- Help evaluate EOR providers and manage contractor compliance

You'll eventually hand off daily coordination to a local team lead - but first you need to build the processes and understand what good looks like.



3. E-COMMERCE BACKOFFICE & OPERATIONS

Our European parent company operates multiple brands and marketplaces (Amazon, eBay, ManoMano, own webshops). A core priority from Day 1 is launching (or relaunching) our US marketplace channels - Amazon USA, eBay USA, and later Walmart.

- Build, optimize, and launch product listings on Amazon, eBay, and Walmart US

- Develop pricing strategies, fulfillment setup (FBA/FBM), and shipping logistics for the US market

- Marketplace ticket management and customer communication

- Order processing, supplier coordination, shipping tracking

- EPR compliance tracking across European jurisdictions

- Product data management and listing optimization

Once the channels run smoothly, you'll hire dedicated marketplace managers - but you need to have done it yourself to know what "smooth" looks like.



4. AUTOMATION & DIGITAL TOOLS

We automate everything we can. You should be comfortable with modern tools.

- Help build and maintain workflows in n8n (our automation platform)

- Create reports, dashboards, and data summaries

- Manage content calendars for LinkedIn and social media

- Use AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude) productively for content, research, and analysis

- Document processes and create SOPs for repeatable tasks



5. FINANCE & ACCOUNTING

You take ownership of the financial back office and make sure everything is clean, organized, and transparent.

- Restructure and maintain the bookkeeping system across multiple entities (US and Europe)

- Prepare and track invoices, credit notes, and payment reminders

- Monitor incoming and outgoing payments, reconcile bank accounts

- Coordinate with the external accountant and tax advisor (monthly closings, VAT filings, annual statements)

- Prepare financial summaries and reports for the CEO

- Track expenses, budgets, and profitability per channel and brand

- Ensure compliance with local tax requirements across jurisdictions



6. DIGITAL MARKETING & SOCIAL COMMERCE

Modern e-commerce doesn't work without strong digital presence. You'll build and manage our marketing channels.

- LinkedIn content strategy and posting (for the CEO and company profiles)

- TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube for product marketing and brand building

- AI-generated content creation (using tools like ChatGPT, Claude, Midjourney for posts, videos, and ads)

- Influencer marketing and AI influencer strategies

-
 and Instagram Shopping integration

-
 marketing and newsletter campaigns

- SEO basics and performance tracking

- Paid ads coordination (Google Ads, Meta Ads - working with specialists)

You don't need to be a full-time content creator - but you need to understand what works, set the strategy, and eventually hire specialists (content creators, video editors, ad managers) that you can properly manage and evaluate.





WHO YOU ARE



Your Personality:

You are the kind of person who opens their laptop in the morning and already knows what needs to happen today - without being told. You learn new tools over a weekend, not in a training program. When something breaks, you don't wait for instructions - you find a fix, implement it, and then report what you did. You thrive in fast-paced environments where no two days look the same.



You're comfortable making decisions on your own in day-to-day operations (backoffice, tickets, scheduling), but you also know when to check in with the CEO on strategic calls (hiring decisions, client communication, new processes). You're not looking for a 9-to-5 routine - you want to build something and grow with it.



IMPORTANT: THE COORDINATOR MINDSET



Let's be clear about what this role really is. We don't expect you to be a world-class expert in every single area listed below. What we DO expect is that you've done enough of it yourself to truly understand how it works - the pain points, the shortcuts, the quality standards. Why? Because your real job is to build a team around you that handles the specialist work, and you need to be able to tell the difference between great work and garbage. You can only control what you understand. If you've never run an ad campaign, you can't evaluate someone who does it for you. If you've never reconciled a bank account, you won't catch mistakes. We need someone who has been in the trenches, understands the work, and can then hire, train, and manage the people who do it day-to-day. You don't need to be the best at everything - but you need to have done everything at least once.



The Skills That Matter Most:



1. Fast Learner & Tech-Native (Most Important)

This is non-negotiable. Our stack changes, our tools evolve, and we move fast. You pick up a new platform in hours, not weeks. If someone shows you n8n or a new CRM, you're productive within days.



2. High Capacity & Multitasking Under Pressure

You'll manage sales leads in the morning, screen a developer candidate in Southeast Asia before lunch, handle marketplace tickets in the afternoon, and prepare a report for the CEO by evening. You need to context-switch cleanly and keep quality high across all areas.



3. Professional Communication

You write
s that clients and partners take seriously. Your English is flawless - not just grammatically correct, but professional, clear, and appropriate for business contexts in the US and Europe.



4. Initiative & Problem-Solving

When you see a gap, you flag it - or better, you close it. You don't wait to be micromanaged. You suggest improvements, find better ways to do things, and take ownership of outcomes, not just tasks.





HARD SKILLS BY AREA



US Fintech Product / Sales Support:

- CRM setup and management (tell us what you've used - we're building from scratch together) - Required

-
 campaign setup and coordination - Required

- Lead research and list building - Required

- Sales material preparation (decks, proposals) - Nice to have

- Understanding of payment processing / fintech - Nice to have



Southeast Asia Team Building:

- Experience posting jobs and screening candidates (Upwork, OnlineJobs.ph, VietnamWorks) - Required

- Remote team coordination (Slack, Notion, daily standups) - Required

- Experience managing or leading a remote team of 3+ people - Strongly preferred

- Knowledge of EOR/contractor compliance in Southeast Asia - Nice to have



E-Commerce Backoffice:

- Marketplace operations (Amazon Seller Central, eBay) - Required

- Experience launching or building marketplace channels from scratch - Strongly preferred

- Fulfillment knowledge (FBA, FBM, 3PL) - Strongly preferred

- Order management and customer service - Required

- Product data management and listing optimization - Nice to have



Automation & Digital Tools:

- Google Workspace power user (Sheets, Docs, Drive) - Required

- Experience with at least one automation tool (n8n, Zapier, Make) - Strongly preferred

- Comfortable using AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude) for content and automation - Required

- Marketing automation 
 sequences, social scheduling) - Nice to have



Digital Marketing & Social Commerce:

- Experience managing social media accounts (LinkedIn, Instagram, TikTok, or YouTube) - Required

- Content creation or coordination (posts, short videos, newsletters) - Required

- Understanding of AI content tools (ChatGPT, Midjourney, Canva AI, etc.) - Strongly preferred

- Paid ads experience (Google Ads, Meta Ads) - Nice to have, can hire specialists

- SEO basics and analytics (Google Analytics, Search Console) - Nice to have

- Influencer outreach or partnership management - Nice to have



Finance & Accounting:

- Bookkeeping experience (invoicing, payment tracking, bank reconciliation) - Required

- Experience coordinating with external accountants / tax advisors - Required

- Understanding of multi-entity or multi-country financial structures - Strongly preferred

- Proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets for financial reporting - Required

- Knowledge of US and/or European VAT/sales tax basics - Nice to have





YOUR IDEAL BACKGROUND



You're the right person if you come from one of these paths:

- Senior VA / Executive Assistant who managed operations for an e-commerce founder and is ready for a leadership role

- E-commerce Operations Manager from a marketplace seller or D2C brand

- BPO Team Lead / Project Manager who coordinated multiple clients or workstreams

- Startup Operations Generalist who wore many hats and loved it





NON-NEGOTIABLE REQUIREMENTS

- Excellent English (written and spoken) - C1/C2 level

- 3+ years of relevant professional experience

- Available for 4+ hours daily overlap with Central European Time (CET / UTC+1)

- Reliable high-speed internet and professional home office setup

- Based in the Philippines or Vietnam





YOUR GROWTH PATH



Phase 1 - Build the Foundation (Month 1-3)

You and the CEO launch (or relaunch) the US marketplace channels: Amazon USA and eBay USA go live with optimized listings, pricing, and fulfillment. A major priority in this phase is restructuring the entire bookkeeping and financial operations: cleaning up accounts, establishing clear processes for invoicing, payment tracking, and reporting, and setting up a reliable monthly closing workflow with the external accountant. By the end of month 3, the US channels are generating revenue and the financial back office is fully organized and transparent.



Phase 2 - Delegate & Expand (Month 3-6)

With the core channels running, you hire one or more tea
mbers to take over daily marketplace operations and customer service. You expand into additional channels (Walmart, Shopify US) and oversee the new hires. You and the CEO begin building automation workflows together using AI tools and a dedicated developer.



Phase 3 - Launch, Hand Off, Repeat (Month 6-12)

You operate on a 2-month launch cycle: identify a new project, build it, stabilize it, hand it off to your growing team, and move to the next one. You oversee all tea
mbers, ensure quality, and keep the machine running while pushing into new territory. The company begins offering its proven launch and operations expertise as a service to other brands.



Phase 4 - Leadership (Year 2+)

You've built a team, launched multiple projects, and proven you can run operations independently. The conversation shifts to COO, Country Manager, or equity participation.



WHAT WE OFFER

- Competitive base salary (discussed during interview)

- Performance-based bonus structure tied to company revenue and project success

- Clear growth path from Operations Manager to leadership (COO / Country Manager)

- Direct access to the CEO - no middle management, no bureaucracy

- The opportunity to build something real from the ground up





HOW TO APPLY



Send us:

1. Your CV/Resume (English)

2. A short cover letter (max 1 page): Why this role? What's your superpower?

3. Links to relevant work: LinkedIn profile, portfolio, or references

4. Your earliest start date

5. Bonus: A 2-minute video introducing yourself (not required, but it helps!)



US-European Commerce Group | Tampa, FL

Operating across 29 countries | USA - Europe - Southeast Asia

title: Graphic Artist (Full-Time / Remote)
description:
1. Company Overview



Complete Local Marketing is a premier digital marketing agency based in Puerto Rico. We believe that small and medium-sized enterprises deserve the same high-level branding and creative strategy as global corporations. Our mission is to bridge that gap through world-class visual storytelling, data-driven content, and performance-focused marketing. With a growing portfolio of 10+ active clients across various sectors, we are looking for a creative powerhouse to help us define the visual future of local business.



2. Role Summary



We are looking for a Graphic Designer who lives at the intersection of static design and motion. This is a high-impact, full-time role responsible for the end-to-end creation of visual assets for our entire client roster. You will be the "visual voice" for our clients, translating marketing strategies into high-converting graphics, polished video content, and cohesive brand identities. You will work in lockstep with our marketing strategists, social media managers, and web teams to ensure every pixel serves a purpose.



3. Employment Type & Work Schedule



-Role: Full-Time (40 hours per week).

-Location: 100% Remote.

-Time Zone: Must be available during AST (Atlantic Standard Time) or U.S. Business Hours (EST/PST).

-Time Tracking: Mandatory use of a Time Tracker for all hours worked

Hours logged through the tracker are the official record for billing and payment purposes





4. Compensation



-Hourly Rate: USD $4/hour (including fees of chosen payment platform)

-Invoice: Contractors are mandated to submit invoices that include their preferred payment channel.

-Payment schedule: Bi-weekly payment issued every two (2) weeks upon receipt and approval of an invoice for services rendered.

-Contractor responsible for all applicable taxes and statutory obligations







5. Core Responsibilities



-Omnichannel Design: Produce creative assets for social media, paid ads, websites, and traditional print (menus/flyers).

-Brand Stewardship: Develop and maintain brand-aligned templates for multiple clients simultaneously to ensure consistency.

-Multimedia Content: Edit engaging video content ranging from 15-second Reels to long-form promotional brand stories.

Conceptualization: Participate in creative brainstorming sessions to develop campaign concepts based on client goals.

-Asset Management: Maintain a highly organized library of raw files and final exports.

-Efficiency: Meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced agency environment without compromising quality.



6. Graphic Design Responsibilities



Social & Digital: High-engagement Instagram/Facebook posts, carousels, and stories.

Paid Media: Eye-catching ad creative for Meta, Google Display, and LinkedIn.

Web Visuals: Hero images, icons, and custom graphics for landing pages.

Print: Occasional design for physical collateral including menus, business cards, and event flyers.



7. Video Editing Responsibilities



Social-First Video: Cutting and optimizing content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts.

Post-Production: Color grading, basic sound design, and audio leveling.

Graphic Integration: Adding dynamic captions, transitions, and overlays to increase viewer retention.

Format Optimization: Re-formatting a single video asset for multiple platforms (e.g., 9:16 vs. 4:5 vs. 16:9).



8. Required Skills & Qualifications



-Experience: 2+ years in a professional design/video role (Agency experience is a significant plus).

-Technical Mastery: Advanced proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, After Effects, Canva, CapCut).

-Platform Savvy: Understanding of what makes content go viral or convert on modern social platforms.

-Branding Knowledge: Deep understanding of typography, color theory, and visual hierarchy.

-Multitasking: Proven ability to manage creative deliverables for 10+ clients across different industries.



9. Preferred / Nice-to-Have Qualifications



Motion Graphics: Ability to create custom animations and dynamic logo reveals.

AI Integration: Experience using AI tools (Midjourney, Firefly, etc.) to speed up creative workflows.



10. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)



Content Performance: Engagement rates and ad conversion metrics of designed assets.

Turnaround Time: Adherence to internal production schedules and deadlines.

Brand Accuracy: Minimizing revision rounds through strict adherence to client brand guidelines.

Team Synergy: Success of collaborative projects with the marketing and web teams.



11. Tools & Platforms



Design: Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva (for client-facing templates).

Video: Premiere Pro, After Effects, CapCut (for quick social edits).

Management: ClickUp, WhatsApp, and Google Drive.



12. Technical Requirements (Mandatory)



To ensure a seamless remote workflow, the following hardware and connectivity standards are required:



PC / Laptop Requirements

Specs: High-performance machine capable of rendering 4K video and handling large PSD/AI files smoothly.

Operating System: Windows 10+ or MacOS 11+

RAM: 16-32 GB minimum

GPU: NVIDIA RTX 5080 (or higher)

Storage Space: At least 500GB or 1TB free for video files

Processor: i5 or equivalent (i7+ recommended)

PSU:
W

Audio: Built-in or USB microphone with clear sound

Verification: You must provide a screenshot of system specifications (CPU, RAM, GPU, OS).



Internet Requirements

Speed: Minimum 50 Mbps stable internet (Fiber preferred).

Verification: Must submit a recent speed test result screenshot.

Redundancy: Must have a reliable backup internet source (Secondary ISP or mobile hotspot).



Backup & Power Requirements

Hardware: Access to a backup laptop or secondary workstation.

Power Redundancy: UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supply), generator, or power station to ensure uptime during local power interruptions.



13. Work Environment Expectations



A professional, quiet remote workspace suitable for video calls.

High level of accountability; you are expected to be reachable and active during working hours.

Proactive communication regarding project status and potential bottlenecks.



14. We want to know more about you



These questions are designed to assess the candidate’s creative process, technical skills, and ability to deliver cohesive visual and video content while maintaining brand consistency.

- Tell us your step-by-step process on creating a design or layout, from receiving the brief to final delivery.

- What design and video editing tools do you use most often (e.g., Canva, CapCut, Adobe Photoshop, Davinci Resolve, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, After Effects), and which are you strongest in?

- Can you share examples of projects where you handled both graphic design and video editing, and explain your role in each?

- How do you manage feedback and revisions, especially when working with tight deadlines or multiple stakeholders?

- How do you ensure brand consistency (colors, fonts, tone, motion style) across both static designs and video content?



15. How to apply



To be considered for this role, please submit the following requirements in full:

- Answer the five (5) screening questions listed in the “We Want to Know More About You” section.

- Confirmation of your ability to work 40 hours/week during AST/EST business hours.

- Complete an internet speed test and provide a shareable link to a screenshot of your results that can be viewed by anyone with the link.

- Provide a shareable link to a screenshot of your PC or laptop specifications with viewers’ access enabled.

- Submit a portfolio via a shareable link (including graphic designs, videos, reels, or motion projects) that can be accessed by anyone with the link.

- Include your CV/resume (PDF format) through a shareable link with viewers’ access enabled.

- Record a 2–3 minute self-introduction video via Loom discussing your previous job roles, industries you’ve worked in, key career highlights, why you are the best candidate for this role, and whether you consider yourself more of an artist or a visionary—and why. Provide a shareable Loom link that can be viewed by anyone.



Incomplete applications or submissions without proper shareable links will not be reviewed.

title: SEO Specialist (Part-Time / Remote)
description:
1. Company Overview



Complete Local Marketing is a premier digital marketing agency based in Puerto Rico. Our mission is to provide small and medium-sized enterprises with the sophisticated marketing tools and strategies typically reserved for large corporations. We pride ourselves on being a growth partner for our clients, currently managing a diverse portfolio of 10+ active accounts across various industries, ensuring they are seen, heard, and chosen by their local communities.



2. Role Summary



We are seeking a results-driven SEO Specialist to join our team on a part-time basis. In this role, you will be the primary architect of organic growth for our clients. You won't just be managing keywords; you will be executing comprehensive local SEO strategies that drive real-world foot traffic and leads. You will collaborate closely with our creative designers and marketing strategists to ensure SEO is woven into the fabric of our clients' digital presence. The ideal candidate is a self-starter who excels at managing multiple client accounts without sacrificing attention to detail.



3. Employment Type & Work Schedule



Role: Part-Time

Hours: 20 hours per week

Location: 100% Remote

Time Zone Requirement: Must be available to work during AST (Atlantic Standard Time) or U.S. Business Hours (EST/PST).



4. Compensation



Hourly Rate: USD $4/hour (including fees of chosen payment platform)

Invoice: Contractors are mandated to submit invoices that include their preferred payment channel.

Payment schedule: Bi-weekly payment issued every two (2) weeks upon receipt and approval of an invoice for services rendered.

Contractor responsible for all applicable taxes and statutory obligations



5. Key Responsibilities



- Local SEO Strategy: Develop and execute end-to-end local SEO roadmaps tailored to specific industry needs.

- On-Page Optimization: Execute comprehensive audits and updates to metadata, headers, internal linking, and localized content.

- GBP Management: Daily optimization and management of Google Business Profiles to dominate the "Local Map Pack."

- Keyword Intelligence: Perform deep-dive research into local intent keywords to capture high-converting traffic.

- Technical SEO: Conduct audits focusing on site speed, mobile-friendliness, crawlability, indexing, and basic Schema/Structured Data implementation.

- Reporting: Create and present monthly performance reports that translate data into actionable insights for clients.

- Competitor Analysis: Monitor local competitors to identify gaps and opportunities for our clients.

- Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with the web and content teams to ensure all site updates are SEO-friendly.



6. Required Skills & Qualifications



- Proven Experience: 2+ years of experience as an SEO Specialist (Agency experience preferred).

- Local SEO Mastery: Deep understanding of local citations, proximity factors, and regional search trends.

- Tool Proficiency: Expert-level use of GoHighLevel, Google Search Console, Google Analytics (GA4), and industry tools (Ahrefs, SEMrush, or BrightLocal).

- CMS Familiarity: Proficiency in WordPress (experience with builders like Elementor or Divi is a plus).

- Analytical Prowess: Ability to synthesize data from various sources to provide a clear picture of ROI.

- Communication: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills in English.



7. Preferred / Nice-to-Have Qualifications



Direct experience handling SEO for multiple businesses 

Knowledge of Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) principles.



8. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)



Significant month-over-month organic traffic growth.

Improvement in rankings for targeted local search terms.

Growth in Google Business Profile interactions (calls, directions, website visits).

Timely completion of all client deliverables and monthly reports.



9. Tools & Platforms Used



SEO/Analytics: Google Search Console, GA4, Ahrefs/SEMrush.

Local SEO: BrightLocal, Whitespark, or similar.

Project Management: ClickUp, Asana, or 
.

Communication: Slack and Zoom/Google Meet.



10. Technical Requirements (Mandatory)



To ensure seamless collaboration and high-quality output, candidates must meet the following technical standards:



PC / Laptop Requirements

Operating System: Windows 10+ or MacOS 11+

RAM: 8 GB minimum

Storage Space: At least 250GB or 1TB 

Processor: i5 or equivalent (i7+ recommended)

Backup PC/Laptop in case of an issue

Verification: You must provide a screenshot of system specifications.



Internet Requirements

Speed: Minimum 50 Mbps stable internet (Fiber preferred).

Verification: Must submit a recent speed test result screenshot.

Redundancy: Must have a reliable backup internet source (Secondary ISP or mobile hotspot).



Backup & Power Requirements

Hardware: Access to a backup laptop or secondary workstation.

Power Redundancy: UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supply), generator, or power station to ensure uptime during local power interruptions.

Backup & Power Requirements:

Hardware: Access to a backup laptop or secondary device.

Power: Must have an electricity backup solution (UPS, generator, or power station) to remain online during local power outages.



11. Work Environment Expectations



Professional Setup: A dedicated, quiet workspace free from distractions.

Communication: Proactive updates on task progress via Slack.

Engagement: Ability to attend and participate in virtual tea
etings with camera on.



12. We want to know more about you



These questions are designed to assess the candidate’s abilities, technical skills, and ability to deliver excellent results.

Describe your step-by-step process for conducting an SEO audit on a website, including tools you use and metrics you analyze.

- Can you give an example of a project where your SEO strategy significantly improved organic traffic or rankings? What approach did you take?

- Which SEO tools and platforms are you most proficient in (e.g., Google Analytics, SEMrush, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog), and how do you use them in daily tasks?

- How do you approach on-page and off-page optimization, and what strategies do you use to stay compliant with search engine algorithm updates?

- Explain a situation where you had to solve a complex SEO problem, such as recovering from a traffic drop or resolving technical SEO issues. What was your process and outcome?



13. How to apply



To be considered for this role, please submit the following requirements in full:

- Answer the five (5) screening questions listed in the “We Want to Know More About You” section.

- Confirmation of your ability to work 20 hours/week during AST/EST business hours.

- Complete an internet speed test and provide a shareable link to a screenshot of your results that can be viewed by anyone with the link.

- Provide a shareable link to a screenshot of your PC or laptop specifications with viewers’ access enabled.

- Submit a Portfolio/Case Studies via a shareable link; these may include Links or documents showcasing previous SEO wins (specifically local rankings/growth) that can be accessed by anyone with the link.

- Include your CV/resume (PDF format) through a shareable link with viewers’ access enabled.

- Record a 2–3 minute self-introduction video via Loom discussing your previous job roles, industries you’ve worked in, key career highlights, SEO Innovations, why you are the best candidate for this role, and as an SEO Specialist, do you consider yourself more of a strategist (focusing on long-term SEO planning and overall strategy) or a tactician (executing specific SEO tasks and optimizations)?—and why. Provide a shareable Loom link that can be viewed by anyone.





Incomplete applications or submissions without proper shareable links will not be reviewed.

title: Visual Content Producer
description:
We are seeking a Visual Content Producer to create and publish clear, professional content across our digital channels. This role focuses on producing static posts and carousels, adapting existing video into short-form formats, preparing simple original illustrations when needed, and managing scheduled publishing on LinkedIn and YouTube.



You will work from provided themes and materials, translating them into clean visual assets aligned with our brand. This is an execution-focused role for someone comfortable with Adobe Illustrator, Figma, or similar tools, and familiar with basic social media scheduling and YouTube uploads.



Strong attention to detail and visual consistency is essential. We need to see your portfolio and there is a one-month trial phase, we would like to begin with a small test for an illustration, we will provide guidelines.



Monthly pay is $150 with a clearly defined scope - No need to work every day you just need to provide what we need and schedule content and you can do all of that in 1-2 days, we know how that works and if we trust you we can extend hours and pay, we have had bad experiences hiring here and being careful.

description:

Overview

We are looking for a dedicated WordPress & WooCommerce Developer to lead the build, maintenance, and expansion of our e-commerce sites. We are moving away from other platforms to focus 100% on WooCommerce.



You will be responsible for building new stores from the ground up, managing 
, and ensuring our entire portfolio stays fast, secure, and optimized for conversions. This is a full-time role for someone who wants to grow with a fast-moving team.



Key Responsibilities

New Builds: Develop and launch high-converting WooCommerce stores from scratch (custom themes or high-performance builders).



Ongoing Maintenance: Responsible for the health of

title: Paid Ads Expert — Google + Meta
description:
Type: Full Time, Remote

Hours: ~40 hrs/week

Location: Remote (Philippines-friendly schedule)

Compensation: 23k Php paid weekly plus daily meal stipend and bonuses



**About Us**



HoneyGrid builds AI-powered marketing systems for local businesses. Our goal is not just to run great ad campaigns — it’s to codify what great looks like, so our AI can execute, optimize, and scale campaigns continuously.



We work primarily with local service businesses (dentists, home services, healthcare, etc.) and are building an AI that can manage paid advertising all day, every day, using best-in-class human strategy as its foundation.



**Role Overview**



This is not a traditional “media buyer” role.



We’re looking for a senior Paid Ads Expert who can:

- Run and optimize Google Ads and Meta Ads at a high level today

- And train our AI systems to do this work intelligently, repeatedly, and at scale



You’ll spend part of your time actively managing campaigns — and a growing portion of your time documenting decisions, patterns, frameworks, prompts, and rules so our AI can learn how to think like an elite performance marketer.



If you enjoy systems thinking, teaching, and turning intuition into repeatable logic, this role will be a great fit.



**Core Responsibilities**

1. Paid Ads Strategy & Execution

- Build, manage, and scale Google Ads campaigns (Search, Performance Max, remarketing).

- Build, manage, and optimize Meta Ads campaigns 
 & Instagram).

- Improve CPL, CPA, ROAS, and lead quality through continuous testing.

- Make smart budget allocation decisions across platforms.

- Diagnose underperformance and clearly explain why something is or isn’t working.



2. Training & Improving Our AI

This is the most important part of the role. You will help teach our AI how to analyze campaigns, not just what buttons to click.



Document:

- How you d
 when to scale vs pause

- How you diagnose bad leads vs bad targeting

- How you interpret early-stage vs mature campaign data



Help define:

- Optimization checklists

- Decision trees

- Prompts, rules, and heuristics the AI should follow

- Review AI-generated recommendations and correct them when they’re wrong.

- Continuously improve how the AI thinks, tests, and learns.

- Your success is measured not only by campaign results — but by how much better and more autonomous the AI becomes over time.



3. Tracking, Attribution & Signal Quality

- Ensure accurate conversion tracking (calls, forms, offline conversions).

- Audit and troubleshoot tracking using GA4, Google Tag Manager, Meta Pixel.

- Help the AI understand which signals matter and which ones don’t.



4. Reporting & Insight Translation

- Translate performance data into:

- Clear insights

- Actionable next steps

- AI-readable guidance

- Help define what “good,” “bad,” and “needs attention” actually mean in practice.



**Who This Role Is For**



This role is ideal if you:

- Have real, hands-on experience running Google + Meta Ads profitably

- Think deeply about why campaigns succeed or fail

- Enjoy explaining your thinking and turning instincts into systems

- Are excited about AI replacing repetitive work — including your own

- Want to build something scalable, not just manage accounts forever



Requirements

- Proven experience managing Google Ads and Meta Ads for lead generation

- Strong understanding of funnels, targeting, creative testing, and bidding

- Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

- Clear written and spoken English (you’ll be teaching humans and AI)

- Comfortable working independently and proactively



Bonus (Nice to Have)

- Google Ads or Meta certifications

- Experience documenting SOPs, playbooks, or frameworks

- Interest or experience working with AI tools, prompts, or automation

- Experience with local service or healthcare/dental businesses



**How Success Is Measured**

- Campaign performance improves and stabilizes

- Fewer issues require human intervention

- AI recommendations become more accurate and useful

- Best practices are clearly documented and reusable

- The system gets smarter month over month

title: Content & Social Media Manager
description:
Job Title: Content & Social Media Manager (Short-Form Growth Focus)



Salary: $800–$1,200/month (depending on experience)

Type: Full-Time (Remote)



I’m looking for a proactive and creative Content & Social Media Manager who can take ideas and turn them into consistent, high-performing content across multiple platforms.



This is NOT a basic VA role.

I need someone who understands short-form content, audience growth, and engagement; someone who can help run the content machine, not just follow instructions.



If you understand hooks, retention, and how to turn one idea into multiple pieces of content, this role is for you.



Your Main Responsibilities

1. Content Execution



Turn raw ideas/voice notes into polished posts

Write engaging captions

Format content for Instagram, TikTok, YouTube Shorts, etc.

Schedule posts

Maintain a weekly content calendar



2. Short-Form Video Editing



Edit reels, TikToks, and YouTube Shorts

Add captions and engaging hooks

Optimize for retention

Deliver 3–5 short-form videos per week (minimum)



3. Content Repurposing



Turn long-form videos into multiple short clips

Create carousel posts from videos

Pull quotes for graphics/posts

Maximize content output from one recording



4. Analytics & Optimization



Track engagement, reach, and retention

Provide weekly performance reports

Suggest improvements and content ideas



5. Community Support



Respond to comments

Flag potential leads or opportunities

What I’m Looking For

Strong experience editing short-form videos

Understanding of social media growth strategies

Good written English

Organized and self-motivated

Able to work independently

Has worked with creators, personal brands, or agencies.



If you need step-by-step instructions for everything, this may not be the right fit. I’m looking for someone who can think and contribute ideas.



To Apply



Please include:



Links to 3–5 short-form videos you have edited

A brief explanation of how you would grow a personal brand using short-form content

Your expected monthly salary

The word “Growth” at the top of your application so I know you read this fully

Applications without examples of past work will not be considered.



Looking forward to building something great together.

s

Flag clinical queries for the Founder with clear context and summaries

Create structured invoice summaries (subscriptions, supplier invoices, tax invoices) and ensure items are actioned or forwarded to the accountant

Clean up promotional
s and reduce inbox clutter

Manage Google Calendar appointments, including booking meetings and adding preparation time

Ensure the calendar is efficient, not overloaded, and includes protected “focus time”



Subscriptions & Invoice Oversight:

Track clinical and software subscriptions

Monitor renewals and identify subscriptions that can be cancelled or reviewed

Maintain a simple cost summary (e.g. tracking setup costs for projects like new clinic spaces)



Policies, Procedures & Document Control (Phase 2):

Organise and improve Google Drive filing structure

Audit and update policies and procedures (NDIS and mental health compliance)

Implement version control and structured document indexing

Support internal audits by identifying gaps and outdated documents

Conduct annual compliance research to ensure policies remain current



Systems & Automation:

Suggest and help implement simple automations (e.g. reminders from Google Sheets, task tracking tools)

Assist in setting up a task management tool for clearer visibility and workflow





Must-Have Qualifications (Self-Check)

3+ years’ experience as an Executive Assistant or Virtual Assistant (supporting a business owner)

Strong Gmail and Google Workspace skills (labels, filters, delegation, Calendar)

Experience summarising financial or invoice information clearly

High level of discretion and understanding of confidential information

Available 20 hours per week during AEST business hours

Strong written English and confident communicator

Reliable internet and secure home office setup





Nice-to-Have Skills

Experience supporting healthcare, allied health, or NDIS businesses

Experience with policy documentation or compliance admin

Basic automation knowledge (Zapier, Google Sheets workflows, task management tools)

Experience with Halaxy or similar clinical management systems





Success Outcomes (30/60/90 Days)

30 Days:

Inbox filters refined and daily triage system running smoothly

Clear process for invoice tracking and summaries established

Regular check-ins established with the Founder



60 Days:

Founder reports reduced inbox stress and faster response times

Calendar management operating independently

Subscription tracking document implemented



90 Days:

Inbox consistently maintained at manageable levels

Document control structure for policies and procedures mapped

At least one workflow improvement or automation implemented

title: Head of Real Estate Acquisitions
description:
Are you a deal-maker who thrives on the hunt & loves building out systems/processes?



Hello there! Second Bridge Associates is looking for a Head of Acquisitions to serve as a key player in our company growth. We specialize in two primary asset classes:

1) Short-Term Rentals (STRs)

2) Seattle In-Fill Development Projects



Our perfect fit for this role is a strategic partner who is excited to own our entire acquisitions pipeline. You will be the bridge between data analysis and the purchase of high-yield assets.



Availability & Timezone

- Available to work Monday–Friday during Pacific Time (PST) hours.



What You'll Do

- Own Seattle Development & STR Analysis: Develop deep expertise in STR and Seattle development math. You will have the final say on whether a deal meets our feasibility and ROI benchmarks.

- Master the Deal Pipeline: Take full accountability for our deal flow ecosystem. You are accountable for a steady pipeline of 6-8 qualified deals a year. You’ll source opportunities through off-market outreach, wholesaler networks, and on-market channels.

- Lead & Scale Operations: Own the entire team lifecycle from process creation to performance management. You’ll be responsible for creating robust SOPs, while serving as a mentor to our existing team. We look to you to identify talent gaps and strategically expand our acquisitions department as deal flow accelerates.

- Strategize for Market Shifts: When the market moves, you move faster. You’ll proactively refine our buying criteria and pivot strategies to ensure we stay competitive.

- Seamless Handoffs: Once a deal is inked, you’ll lead the transition to our operations team, ensuring every project starts with a clear roadmap and a shared vision.



Who You Are

- A Seasoned Pro: You have a proven track record in real estate acquisitions. You speak the language of sellers, agents, and wholesalers, and know how to build relationships with them.

- A Systems Thinker: You don't just "do" work; you build systems and processes. You’re comfortable in Notion, CRMs, and data-tracking tools to find the right deals from your network and also track them to offers.

- A Leader of Remote Teams: You know how to get the best out of a virtual team, keeping them motivated and high-performing.

- Analytical & Decisive: You can look at a pro-forma and see the risks and rewards instantly. You make data-driven decisions, but you have the gut instinct of a sales closer.

- High Energy & Growth-Oriented: You tackle challenges with a solutions-focused mindset and a touch of humor. You’re here to win and celebrate the wins with the team.



Ideal Candidate Profile

- 4+ Years in Real Estate Acquisitions: Deep experience in deal sourcing, offer negotiation, and closing - specifically in short-term rentals or in-fill development.

- Proven Closer: You have a track record of hitting (and exceeding) volume targets and managing high-value pipelines.

- Architect of Systems: Expert-level ability to build SOPs, design CRM workflows, and turn "hustle" into a repeatable machine.

- Data-Driven Mindset: You live in spreadsheets; you are comfortable defining KPIs and adjusting strategy based on what the numbers say.

- Tool Mastery: Proficiency across Workspace Tools (e.g., Google Sheets, Slack, Notion, Zillow, Redfin, MLS)

- STR Enthusiast: You understand that Short-Term Rentals are a hybrid of real estate and hospitality. You know how to look at the qualitative factors that impact a property’s performance.

- The "Extreme Ownership" Mindset: You don't wait for permission to fix a leak in the pipeline. You identify the problem, build the solution, and report on the results.



Bonus:

- Existing relationships with Seattle-based wholesalers, brokers, or developers. 

- You have a background in Seattle real estate underwriting already or a deep understanding of urban in-fill development. You understand that a "good deal" in Seattle looks different than anywhere else.



Why Join Us?

At Second Bridge Associates, we value curiosity, independence, and results. We’re looking for someone who is excited to grow at our fast-paced company where they will be empowered to take on ownership from Day 1.



If that sounds like you, we’re excited to hear from you :) Ready to find our next great investment? Apply now.

title: Video Editor (Performance-Focused | Premium Brand | Fast Iteration)
description:
We are building a serious creative engine for two premium professional hair brands operating across multiple countries.



If you care about speed, quality, clean design, and building high-performing Meta creatives, keep reading.



What You’ll Be Working On



1- Short-form paid social ads designed for Meta and Instagram that are built to convert, not just look good.



2 - Talking-head content with industry-recognized barbers and stylists, enhanced with engaging b-roll and tight pacing.



3 - Product-focused edits where accuracy and detail matter. When a specific model is mentioned, the correct product must be shown.



4 - Static creatives and motion ads that feel premium, minimalist, and brand-aligned.



5 - Promotions, launches, and inventory pushes where turnaround time is fast and attention to detail is critical.



What Makes This Role Different



1- Your edits won’t sit in a folder. They will go live, quickly.



2 - You’ll receive direct feedback from operators actively running campaigns.



3 - Speed and iteration matter as much as visual polish.



4 - You’ll be trusted to improve pacing, strengthen hooks, and elevate messaging rather than simply execute instructions.



5 - You’ll help shape a growing creative system rather than just fill tasks.



What We Expect From You



1- Strong instinct for short-form pacing, especially within the first 3–5 seconds.



2 - Clean, accurate captions that run correctly throughout the entire video.



3 - Precise product matching between script, text overlays, and visuals.



4 - Clean typography and disciplined use of brand fonts and colors.



5 - Reliable file organization and properly shared links every time.



6 - Ability to handle revisions quickly when a campaign is launching.



The Creative Direction We’re Moving Toward



1- Sleek, minimal, premium visuals.



2 - Product-led messaging with clear value callouts.



3 - Authentic UGC-style edits that still feel polished and intentional.



4 - Real people talking about real products, supported by sharp supporting visuals.



5 - Clear, confident messaging that supports paid acquisition.



The Type of Editor Who Thrives Here



1- Someone who studies high-performing ads in the Meta Ad Library.



2 - Someone who enjoys tightening pacing and refining a cut after feedback.



3 - Someone who cares about accuracy and understands that product details matter.



4 - Someone who moves quickly without sacrificing precision.



5 - Someone who wants their work to have measurable impact.



Growth Potential



1- Opportunity to expand into concept development and creative strategy.



2 - Direct exposure to paid media strategy and campaign launches.



3 - Ownership over creative systems and asset organization.



4 - Long-term growth as the brand scales across multiple markets.



How To Apply



1- Send 3 examples of short-form ads you’ve edited that were used in paid campaigns.



2 - In a few sentences, explain how you approach editing content specifically for Meta ads.



3 - Share a brand whose ads you think are well done and explain why.

title: GoHighLevel Specialist – Automations, Funnels & Systems (Insurance Industry | Long-Term Role)
description:
Pay: $10–$12/hour (based on proven skill)

Type: Full-time, long-term

Start: ASAP

Primary Tool: GoHighLevel

Secondary: Meta Ads support



ABOUT US



We are a growing U.S.-based insurance agency generating Medicare and health insurance leads. Our team is young, driven, and system-focused. GoHighLevel is the core system that runs our funnels, CRM, automations, and internal processes.



We are hiring ONE GoHighLevel specialist to own our automations, funnel builds, system maintenance, and process improvements long-term.



This is not a freelance or side-gig role.



WHO THIS ROLE IS FOR

You:



- Have strong, hands-on GoHighLevel experience

- Communicate clearly and professionally in English

- Are confident building automations, workflows, pipelines, and funnels

- Can maintain, troubleshoot, and improve existing systems

- Think in processes and systems, not just tasks

- Understand how
 ads connect to funnels

- Learn fast and adapt when new needs come up

- Want stability and long-term growth



WHAT YOU’LL DO



- Build and maintain insurance lead funnels in GoHighLevel

- Create, manage, and optimize workflows and automations

- Maintain pipelines, forms, calendars, and follow-ups

- Troubleshoot broken automations, funnels, or integrations

- Improve internal processes and system efficiency

- Document workflows and SOPs as systems evolve

- Provide support for
 ad funnels

(tracking, funnel connections, landing page updates — not full media buying)



NON-NEGOTIABLES



- Strong GoHighLevel experience (automations + funnels)

- Experience maintaining and optimizing existing GHL systems

- Ability to work independently and solve problems

- Available full-time

- Not working with multiple clients



APPLICATION QUESTIONS



Applications without clear answers will be rejected.

1. What automations and workflows have you personally built or maintained inside GoHighLevel?

(Be specific.)

2. If a GoHighLevel automation stops working, what are the first steps you take to diagnose and fix it?



HOW TO APPLY (IMPORTANT)



To apply, submit:



1. Your answers to the 2 application questions above

2. Start your application with this exact phrase:

“GHL SYSTEMS – READY TO BUILD”



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be reviewed.



NEXT STEPS



Shortlisted candidates will be invited to complete a brief GoHighLevel skills test relevant to the insurance industry.



WHY THIS ROLE IS DIFFERENT



- Long-term, stable position

- Clear ownership of systems and processes

- Opportunity to improve and scale real operations

- Exposure to funnels, automations, and ad-driven systems

- Work directly with decision-makers

title: SOA Production & Client Services Officer
description:
SOA Production & Client Services Officer 



Location: Remote (Philippines) 

Hours: Full-time, 6:00am – 3:00pm Manila Time (aligned with Australian business hours) 

Availability: Must be online and available on Microsoft Teams during work hours 



About Us 



We are an Australian financial advice business specialising in retirement and aged care financial planning. Our work is structured, process-driven, and detail-focused. 



We are seeking a highly organised, detail-oriented tea
mber to support the preparation and quality control of financial advice documents and client records. 



This role is ideal for someone who enjoys working with numbers, following clear processes, and ensuring everything is accurate and complete. 



The Role 



You will be responsible for assembling, checking, and organising financial planning documents using our structured templates and step-by-step processes. 



You will not be giving financial advice. 



You will be executing and quality-checking within a defined system. 



Key Responsibilities 



• Input financial data accurately into templates and internal systems 

• Assist in preparing Statements of Advice and aged care strategy documents 

• Follow structured checklists to ensure accuracy and completeness 

• Review documents carefully to identify inconsistencies or missing information 

• Maintain clean and organised digital client files 

• Draft clear internal notes and summaries 

• Support Centrelink and aged care documentation preparation 

• Ensure version control and proper file naming conventions 

• Raise questions early when information is unclear or incomplete 



What We Are Looking For 



This is a high attention-to-detail role. Accuracy matters. 



You must: 



• Be extremely detail-oriented and methodical 

• Be comfortable working with numbers and financial information 

• Follow processes precisely without shortcuts 

• Have strong written English skills 

• Be organised and structured in your work 

• Be comfortable working independently while remaining responsive on Teams 

• Be reliable, punctual, and focused during work hours 



Previous experience in an Australian financial planning firm, mortgage broking firm, or financial services outsourcing company is highly regarded but not mandatory. 



Data entry, loan processing, financial administration, or document QA experience is advantageous. 



Work Expectations 



• Full-time position 

• 6:00am – 3:00pm Manila Time 

• Must be online and available on Microsoft Teams during working hours 

• Stable internet connection required 

• Quiet and professional work environment 



We will provide structured training in our processes and systems. 



Our Culture 



We value: 



• Precision 

• Accountability 

• Clear communication 

• Professionalism 

• Continuous improvement 



This is not a creative or sales role. It is a structured production role suited to someone who takes pride in accuracy and organisation. 



We offer: 

 

Remote work position 

13th-month pay 

Work schedule from 6 am to 3 pm, Manila time 

Weekends off 

Collaborative and supportive team environment 



Application Process 



To apply: 

 





Submit your resume through the link. 

Complete the FaceCruit video interview. 

Successful candidates from that stage will complete a personality assessment. 



Only applications submitted through the application link will be reviewed. 

We are hiring immediately and encourage prompt applications.

title: Cold Caller/ Virtual assistant
description:

About Us:

Any Home Cincy is a local, family-owned property buying company that helps homeowners sell quickly and without hassle. We have been in business for over two years and are actively growing. We are looking for serious, results-driven tea
mbers who can professionally represent our company and help us find real opportunities.



Position Overview:

We are hiring fluent English-speaking cold callers with real estate experience to contact property owners from company-provided lists. Your primary responsibility is to identify motivated sellers, thoroughly qualify leads, find legitimate deals, and set strong appointments for our acquisitions team.



Key Responsibilities:

 • Cold call property owners using provided lists

 • Identify motivated sellers and uncover real opportunities

 • Thoroughly qualify leads (condition, timeline, motivation, asking price, etc.)

 • Set solid, well-qualified appointments

 • Accurately enter detailed notes and submit leads into our CRM

 • Properly manage and organize leads inside the CRM

 • Represent Any Home Cincy professionally at all times

 • Assist with light social media engagement and posting in
 groups and online platforms to maintain company presence

 • Provide consistent daily performance updates



Requirements:

 • Fluent, professional-level English

 • Proven real estate cold calling experience

 • Strong understanding of real estate terminology and transactions

 • CRM experience (organized and detail-oriented is critical)

 • Strong objection-handling skills

 • Ability to identify real deals — not just book unqualified calls

 • Reliable internet connection and quiet work environment



Compensation:

Competitive base pay + performance-based bonuses tied to qualified appointments and closed deals.



We are looking for someone thorough, disciplined, and hungry to find real deals — not just make calls.





We are setting up interviews this week via zoom/google meet.

title: Senior Financial Operator/ Controller-Level Bookkeeper
description:
Position Summary

We are seeking a highly capable and strategic financial operator to serve as a senior-level bookkeeper/controller for our fast-paced, multi-entity real estate enterprise. This role supports our real estate brokerage team, investment and development projects, and the personal financial operations of the CEO. The ideal candidate combines technical accounting expertise with strategic insight and the ability to manage complex, multi-entity structures in a lean, high-performance environment.



Key Responsibilities

- Maintain full-cycle bookkeeping for brokerage, investment entities, and project-specific LLCs.

- Oversee job cost accounting, project-level reporting, and GAAP-compliant multi-entity financials.

- Lead monthly closes, consolidate reports, and provide variance analysis.

- Perform weekly/monthly reconciliations of all accounts and ensure books are audit-ready.

- Maintain documentation and prepare reports for CPA coordination and tax filings.

- Ensure accurate 1099 issuance and vendor W-9 compliance.

- Build rolling cash flow forecasts and participate in capital allocation decisions.

- Manage the CEO’s personal finances, including financial tracking, reporting, and investment oversight.

- Support quarterly strategy sessions with data and insight, not just numbers.



Qualifications

- Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance; CPA or CMA preferred.

- 5+ years experience in bookkeeping or financial management, ideally in real estate.

- Strong command of US GAAP, project accounting, and inter-entity financial structures.

- Proficiency in QuickBooks, project tracking systems, and financial dashboards.

- Strong analytical thinking, attention to detail, and communication skills.

- Experience managing personal financials for executives a strong plus.



Ideal Candidate Traits

- Strategic thinker who loves both numbers and their meaning.

- Exceptionally organized and accountable.

- Proactive problem-solver who can navigate lean operations.

- Deeply reliable and detail-oriented with a high sense of ownership.

- Comfortable with both the tactical and strategic aspects of finance.



Compensation & Benefits

- Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications.

- Flexible work environment and working remotely.

- Performance-based incentives and potential for expanded leadership role.



In your cover letter, begin with the word "focused" and include a 1 minute introduction video link telling more about yourself and share your qualifications/experiences that makes you a great fit for this role. If you fail to follow this instruction, you'll not be considered for this role.

title: Sales Assistant
description:
About us: 

EMRG is an award-winning Digital Marketing Agency based in Los Angeles. With a team of experienced professionals for each service line, we offer a wide range of digital marketing solutions that are customized to meet the unique needs of each client. We are renowned for our outstanding customer service and ability to deliver exceptional `results. As a leading agency in the industry, we have established ourselves as a reliable partner for businesses looking to grow and expand their online presence.

As our company continues to grow, we are also committed to expanding our philanthropic goals and supporting children in need worldwide.



Job Title: Remote Sales Assistant - Digital Marketing



Job Description:

As a Remote Sales Assistant in the digital marketing industry, you will play a vital role in supporting the sales team and ensuring the smooth operation of the digital marketing sales process. Your primary responsibility will be to assist with various sales tasks, including lead generation, client communication, and sales administration. Working remotely, you will collaborate closely with the sales team and other stakeholders to drive sales growth and meet revenue targets.



Responsibilities:

Lead Generation:  Conduct research and identify potential clients through various online platforms: social media channels, Linked IN, Sales Navigator, and industry databases. Initiating Outbound outreach (outbound calls and sending outbound
). Collect and organize relevant information, such as contact details and company profiles, for further outreach.



Client Communication: Communicate with prospective clients via
, phone, or online messaging platforms. Introduce the company's digital marketing services, answer inquiries, and schedule appointments or product demonstrations.



Sales Support: Assist the sales team in preparing sales presentations, proposals, and contracts. Coordinate with internal teams, such as marketing and creative departments, to gather necessary materials and ensure timely delivery to clients.



CRM Management: Utilize customer relationship management (CRM) software to maintain accurate and up-to-date client records, track sales activities, and generate reports. Monitor and update the sales pipeline to reflect the progress of leads and opportunities.



Relationship Building: Foster positive and long-lasting relationships with clients, acting as a reliable point of contact. Provide exceptional customer service, address concerns, and identify opportunities to upsell or cross-sell additional digital marketing services.



Market Research: Stay informed about industry trends, competitor activities, and emerging digital marketing strategies. Share relevant insights with the sales team to refine sales approaches and stay ahead in the competitive market.



Sales Administration: Perform administrative tasks, such as data entry, document management, and sales performance tracking. Assist with the organization and coordination of sales events, trade shows, and webinars.



Requirements:

Proven experience as a sales assistant or in a similar sales support role.

Legal Marketing Experience is a plus

Able to quickly capture and summarize notes

Highly organized, Can manage tasks, deadlines, and follow-ups efficiently.

Understands client needs and project scope with ease.

Fluent, with a neutral accent preferred (but not required) for clear communication

Experience in digital marketing concepts and practices.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.

Proficiency in using CRM software and other sales-related tools.

Self-motivated and able to work effectively in a remote work environment.

Attention to detail and ability to maintain accurate records.

Knowledge of market research techniques is a plus.



Join our dynamic digital marketing team as a Remote Sales Assistant and contribute to our mission of helping businesses achieve their marketing goals through innovative digital strategies.

title: Senior Account Manager
description:
Job Description: Account Manager (Digital Marketing)



We are a rapidly growing digital marketing agency based in Los Angeles seeking a highly accountable, decisive, and client-focused Account Manager to manage and grow a portfolio of client accounts. This role goes beyond basic client servicing — it requires strong judgment, confident communication, independent problem-solving, and consistent execution.

The ideal candidate is someone who can handle client pressure with composure, make informed decisions without constant escalation, and translate plans into results. You will be responsible for maintaining client trust, resolving issues proactively, and identifying opportunities to grow accounts through strategic upsells.



We prioritize personal and professional growth and offer mentoring, continued education, performance reviews with bonuses, annual raises, and a collaborative team culture.



Key Responsibilities

-Serve as the primary point of contact for assigned client accounts, maintaining clear, confident, and professional communication at all times

-Manage client expectations, address concerns independently, and resolve conflicts in a timely and solutions-oriented manner

-Make informed decisions on client matters and propose clear action plans rather than relying solely on escalation

-Lead client onboarding efficiently and ensure a strong foundation is established early in the relationship

-Coordinate with internal teams to ensure tasks are executed accurately, on time, and aligned with client goals

-Own execution of account plans, ensuring follow-through from strategy to completion

-Identify and initiate account growth opportunities, including upsells, with proper timing and client readiness

-Manage priorities effectively across multiple accounts, demonstrating strong time management and organization

-Maintain accurate task tracking, documentation, and reporting using project management tools

-Collaborate with accounting to ensure accurate billing and time tracking

-Handle special projects and new initiatives as needed





Required Skills & Qualifications

-Proven experience in client or account management (digital marketing experience preferred)

-Strong decision-making and problem-solving skills, with the ability to act independently and confidently

-Excellent written and verbal English communication skills; able to sound natural, human, and professional (not scripted or robotic)

-Ability to remain calm, structured, and solution-driven during client conflicts or high-pressure situations

-Demonstrated ability to execute plans consistently and manage time effectively across competing priorities

-Strong relationship-building skills with clients and internal stakeholders

-Familiarity with digital marketing services and workflows

-Experience using task management tools such as 
, Trello, or ActiveCollab



Ideal Candidate Traits

-High ownership and accountability

-Comfortable making decisions and proposing strategies without constant supervision

-Execution-driven and results-oriented

-Emotionally intelligent and composed under pressure

-Organized, proactive, and disciplined with time management



Important Application Requirement

-As part of our screening process, all applicants are required to submit the results of their 16PF (Sixteen Personality Factor) Assessment prior to applying.

-Applications without a submitted 16PF assessment result will not be entertained.



-16PF link: 

This assessment helps us ensure alignment with the demands of the role and our working environment.



Learn more about us

title: Full-Stack Developer – E-Commerce Platform
description:
ABOUT US



We are a US-based commerce company, the American arm of an established European e-commerce and trading group operating across 29 countries with 650,000+ products across multiple brands in construction, home improvement, sustainability, and premium bath & kitchen.



We are building a modular, AI-powered e-commerce platform and we need a developer who can build it with us.

Our motto: "Do it with Passion or don't do it at all."



THIS IS NOT A TYPICAL DEV ROLE

We don't need someone who waits for tickets. We need a builder who reads a spec and ships a prototype. You work directly with the CEO and his Operations Manager – a tight three-person core team. Fast decisions, no bureaucracy.

WHAT YOU'LL WORK ON



Data Connectors

Product Information Management (PIM)

Pricing Engine

Multi-Channel Feed Management

EDI Middleware (EDIFACT D96A – ORDERS, ORDRSP, DESADV, INVOIC)

Controlling & Finance Dashboards

Workflow Automation & Internal Tooling

React, TypeScript, Python

Supabase (PostgreSQL)

n8n, Docker, Kong

Ollama, Claude API

Hetzner, GitHub Actions



MUST HAVE



3+ years full-stack (React + Python or TypeScript)

Strong PostgreSQL

REST API design and integration

Can set up a full environment from scratch

Excellent English (daily standups with CEO and Ops Manager)



NICE TO HAVE



Supabase, n8n, Polars

E-commerce / marketplace experience

AI/ML integration



YOUR GROWTH PATH

Month 1–3: Infrastructure, first modules live.

Month 3–6: Core platform operational.

Month 6–12: Platform expands. You build your team.

Year 2+: CTO conversation. You built it, you lead it.

WHAT WE OFFER



Competitive salary (full-time, permanent)

Performance bonus

3-person core team – CEO, Ops Manager, and you

No legacy code – build from scratch

Flexible hours (4h CET overlap)

Modern stack, no bloat

Path: Developer #1 ? CTO

Hardware budget



NON-NEGOTIABLE



Excellent English (C1/C2)

3+ years full-stack experience

4+ hours daily CET overlap

Based in Philippines or Vietnam



HOW TO APPLY



CV (PDF)

Short intro: Why this role? What have you built? (3–5 sentences)

GitHub or portfolio links

Salary expectation (monthly, USD)

Earliest start date

Thanks

title: Product Setup & Catalog Specialist (Shopify / RetailOps)
description:
Summary



US retailer is hiring a detail-oriented Product Setup & Catalog Specialist to build and maintain products across Shopify and RetailOps. This role supports new item setup from purchase orders, product launches, catalog maintenance, and the media/bundle workflows that keep product pages accurate and ready to sell.



What You’ll Do 



1) Product Setup & Catalog Management



Create new SKUs from POs/invoices using our Excel templates and upload into RetailOps.



Maintain clean, consistent product data (titles, SKUs, UPCs, pricing, categories, manufacturer info).



Handle ongoing catalog updates as needed (occasional brand-driven changes, Open Box item creation, storefront inventory additions).



2) Launch & Project Support



Prepare new product launches ahead of time by creating items in draft status before go-live dates.



Track deadlines and requests in Asana and stay on top of “My Tasks” to keep work moving.



3) Media & Merchandising (Images, Video, Bundles)



Source and prep product images (portals, manufacturer sites), crop/resize to standards, upload to our image server (FileZilla), and build image URLs.



Add product videos (upload to YouTube Studio and load to Shopify via Matrixify templates).



Build and maintain bundles using Shopify/Matrixify templates, including occasional conversion from legacy bundle formats.



Tools You’ll Use



Excel / Google Sheets, Shopify, RetailOps, Matrixify, FileZilla, Asana, YouTube Studio.



What We’re Looking For



Strong attention to detail (SKUs, UPCs, pricing, naming conventions).



Comfortable working in Excel templates and structured upload workflows.



Experience in e-commerce product setup (Shopify preferred).



Able to source missing product details (UPCs/specs) and communicate with internal teams and brand reps.



Organized file management and ability to juggle multiple deadlines.



Preferred (Nice to Have)



RetailOps experience, Matrixify power-user experience, bundle creation experience, basic image editing background.



Location: [Remote / USA hours]

?

?



Compensation

?

/newsletters

, Instagram, and LinkedIn

Educational homeowner tips

Weekly posts and photo uploads

Track and optimize referral performance



5.
 & Newsletter Marketing

Manage monthly newsletters

Repurpose blog content into
 + social

Set up and optimize local ad campaigns

7. Reporting & Optimization

And most importantly: bring recommendations on what to stop, start, and scale.



Tools We Use

Work Expectations

Required Experience

 marketing platform experience

Personal Traits We Value

Why Join Us?

Growth opportunity as the company scales

Your expected monthly salary (20–30 hrs/week)

title: Content Feedback Manager (Giving Feedback): $1,000–$1,200 USD START RATE
description:
Start rate: $800 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,000–$1,200 a month)



Paid every two weeks via Wise.



ABOUT US







Young Publisher is an international digital marketing company working with content creators and online brands.



BENEFITS

- Full-time position: 8 hours daily, Monday-Friday; 40 hours a week

- Flexible schedule: Choose your own hours, as long as you show up for the daily meeting (MANDATORY)

- Stable income: Long-term role with regular, on-time payments

- Supportive team: Collaborative environment without micromanagement

- Growth path: Opportunities to increase responsibilities and earnings

- 100% remote: Work-from-home setup



TASKS



- Content & Client Feedback

- Review 30-60 short-form client videos (Instagram Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts) per day in our Slack feedback channel -before they are published

- Give constructive, actionable feedback on hooks (verbal/headline/visual), scripting, pacing, editing, and CTA, making sure each client knows exactly how to improve

- Cross-reference each piece of content with client niche, experience, and goals as outlined in their files

- Review previous feedback to ensure consistency and avoid contradictions

- Quality-control content ideas created by our Content Research Experts before delivery to the client, ensuring fit with niche, experience, and likely performance

- Oversee workload balance among Content Research Experts and make sure no one on the team is overloaded or underutilized

- Respond to client questions or tech issues in Slack within 24 hours

- Be tough but fair—only approve content that meets quality standards



Progress Tracking



- Complete daily End-of-Day (EOD) reports

- Attend daily tea
eting (mandatory, 3pm CET)

- Keep internal feedback and client progress records up to date



REQUIREMENTS (MUST-HAVE)

- C1+ English (written), with perfect grammar and clear, professional responses

- Significant experience creating or reviewing short-form content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, or YouTube Shorts

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Reliable internet and a quiet, professional home workspace

- Accountability mindset and deadline commitment

- Long-term commitment, eager to master a workflow and have direct impact on client success



IMPORTANT



- When recording a Loom video as part of your application:

- Camera must show your FACE & SCREEN

- Treat it as a LIVE interview with the Hiring Manager

- Have a professional background

- Have clear audio

- Wear business-casual attire



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)



- Experience supporting creators and social media beginners, especially ages 45+

- Familiarity with AI tools like ChatGPT, CapCut, etc.

- Strong understanding of trends/strategy for Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts



WHY JOIN US?



- Start rate: $800 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,000–$1,200 a month once trained)

Note: Senior CFMs earn $1,500+ after 6–12 months.

- Performance bonuses: Up to $400+ additional monthly based on:

- Quality and clarity of feedback

- Task completion and consistency

- Teamwork and responsibility

- Payments: Twice per month via Wise, direct to your bank

- Tools access: All tools/software fully covered

- Work-life balance: No graveyard shifts

- Professional growth: Frequent feedback and advanced training



HOW TO APPLY



1: Message us on OnlineJobs.ph with "CFM" as the message title



2: Include ONLY the following in your message:



#1: Your CV.

#2: Your years of experience with short-form content.

#3: Your years of experience with content feedback or coaching.

#4: One sentence on why you're a good fit for this role.

#5: Your portfolio (including examples of your feedback or video/content work).



Note: Messages that do not follow this format will NOT be reviewed.



P.S. Young Publisher is the recruitment company. Successful candidates will work under Social Influence Consulting LLC.
