title: Estimator Virtual Assistant
description:
At Cutting Edge Stone & Granite, we are a countertop and remodeling company, but we don't just install surfaces; we redefine spaces. We assist our clients with all aspects of a remodel from the stone counters being our primary service, to flooring, cabinets, and any other part of a remodel project. We are seeking a technically-minded Estimator Virtual Assistant to bridge the gap between architectural blueprints and job execution. If you have a passion for accuracy and the professional touch required for high-end client communication, you'll fit right in at Cutting Edge Stone & Granite.



The Role (Position Overview)

Your primary objective is the conversion of technical drawings into accurate, professional estimates. You will be the analytical engine that ensures our projects are profitable and our clients are informed.



Technical Estimating: Reviewing blueprints and architectural drawings to generate precise estimates.



Blueprint Analysis: Calculating square footage, identifying edge profiles, noting backsplash requirements, and any other relevant questions needed for completing estimate beyond what is representing on drawings. Training will be provided on our (minimal) software and operations.



Administrative roles: Managing job sheets, organizing digital files, and ensuring no project detail falls through the cracks.



Client Engagement: Handling
 follow-ups for estimate clarifications and maintaining a professional presence on our social media channels through occasional engagement.



Qualities & Attributes (The Ideal Candidate)

At least 2 years of experience specifically working with blueprints and estimations or bid preparations.



Educational Background: A Bachelor’s Degree is preferred; experience in Civil Engineering or related construction fields is highly valued.



Software Proficiency: Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel), and CRM/Project Management software.



Communication Mastery: Professional English fluency for client interaction via
 and occasional social media engagement.



Compensation & Benefits

Rate: $3.00 USD per hour.



Professional Environment: Access to communicate with on-site employees between Mon - Fri 9a - 5p MST.



Role Diversity: A blend of high-level technical estimation and essential administrative management.



Growth Potential: Opportunity to become a foundational and full-time member of our virtual operations team.

About Mike Barron & Limelight Media LLC:

My name is Mike Barron and I am the founder of Limelight Media, a leading online coaching and sales training academy. Many of our students are seeking career change and or looking to acquire high-ticket skill sets so as to achieve career advancement and financial freedom. We are leaders in the online coaching industry and have receipts of multiple “Two Comma Club” Awards.



I'm really active on social media (Check out my IG and 
 and "influence" is a cornerstone of our operation. We create daily content, record coaching calls, case studies, short films, etc... The culture is fast-paced, raw, and fun... I was a former school President in my last job in 2013, and let's just say I'm Far (far) removed from that corporate-type environment. You can learn more about our community here: 
.



A CULTURE LIKE NO OTHER!

Limelight Media has a culture like no other! Our mission is to spread positivity and create an uplifting environment for all of our employees. We offer a Disneyland-like experience for everyone we engage with - employees, students, business partners and anyone else we come into contact with. At our facility you will find a fun atmosphere that consists of energetic employees, arcade games, basketball hoops, food and drinks, 85 inch TVs and more! Come be a part of something great!!!



Limelight Media offers many packages that teach personal awareness, sales techniques, skills to become a master closer, and how to become the best version of yourself!

title: AI and Automations Specialist U.S. Hours | $1200-$1800/month
description:
We are looking for a tech-savvy and solutions-driven AI/Automations Specialist to join our growing team. This is a key hire and a critical puzzle piece in our next phase of growth.



In this role, you will design, build, and maintain automations that simplify internal processes, increase efficiency, improve reporting, and help us launch new automation-powered services for our clients. You’ll work cross-functionally with leadership and department heads and play a pivotal role in shaping how Grow Pro operates at scale.



If you’re a system thinker who loves turning messy workflows into clean, automated solutions, we want to hear from you.



Key Responsibilities:

- Design, build, and maintain automations using tools such as Zapier, Make, n8n, or similar platforms.

- Create workflows that integrate Gmail, Google Sheets, Google Drive, Slack, ClickUp, GoHighLevel, and other tools in our tech stack.

- Identify inefficiencies in existing processes and proactively recommend automation solutions.

- Build and maintain reporting dashboards and automation logic to improve internal data visibility.

- Support the productization of new client services powered by automation.

- Troubleshoot, optimize, and scale existing automations for reliability and performance.

- Document all automations in clear SOP format and maintain an internal database of workflows.

- Collaborate with leadership and department heads to identify and implement new automation opportunities.

- (Optional but valuable) Assist with IT security protocols, access control, and system integrity.



Qualifications:

- 2+ years of experience working with automation platforms such as Zapier, Make, n8n, or similar tools.

- Strong understanding of APIs, webhooks, and data mapping.

- Hands-on experience with tools in our stack, including Gmail, Google Sheets, Google Drive, GoHighLevel, ClickUp, and Slack.

- Proven ability to translate unstructured or manual processes into clean, automated workflows.

- Comfortable working in a fast-paced, collaborative, and results-driven environment.



Bonus points if you have experience with:

- IT security or implementing security best practices

- Advanced automation logic and multi-step workflows

- Scaling automation systems for teams and clients



Tools We Use:

- GoHighLevel (CRM & automation platform)

- Zapier / Make / n8n

- Slack (team communication)

- ClickUp (task and project management)

- Google Workspace (Gmail, Sheets, Drive)

- Internal dashboards and reporting tools



Compensation & Benefits:

$1200-$1800 per month

Full-time (40 hours/week)

Paid Philippine holidays

13th-month pay

Performance bonuses

Long-term career growth

Fun, fast-paced, and supportive remote culture



About Grow Pro Agency



Grow Pro is a fast-growing digital marketing agency based in the U.S. (ranked on the Inc. 5000 list) that serves over 600 martial arts schools across North America.



We are specialists in paid ads (Google &
),
 automation, CRM systems, and lead generation campaigns that produce real results.



Founded by martial artist & school owner Cris Rodriguez, our agency understands our niche better than anyone — and our amazing team in the Philippines plays a huge part in that success.

Video: Our Growth Story

title: Amazon Dropshipping Store Manager
description:
About Us:



We are a fast-scaling Amazon dropshipping business operating across multiple categories in the US marketplace. Our mission is to deliver high-quality products, fast fulfillment, and top-tier customer service — all while maintaining compliance with Amazon’s performance standards.



We are looking for an experienced, proactive, and highly organized Amazon Store Manager to oversee the daily operations of our store and team. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, can think strategically, and knows how to manage systems efficiently.





Key Responsibilities:



Operational Management:

- Oversee day-to-day operations of the Amazon store, including order processing, customer service, and performance metrics

- Monitor account health, returns, and Amazon policy compliance

- Track inventory levels and ensure stock accuracy across platforms

- Oversee listing management (accuracy, optimization, pricing, availability)



Oversight:

- Product research, fulfill orders and customer support

- Review and approve product research results before listings go live

- Ensure timely order fulfillment and high customer satisfaction ratings

- Create and update SOP's to improve operational efficiency



Performance & Metrics:

title: Frontend Manager – Shopify Dropshipping (Fashion niche)
description:
Location: Remote





Job Type



Full-time or Part-time

• 4–8 hours per day. Workload may vary depending on daily operations

• Minimum 6 days/week



Commitment: Long-term position (3+ months)





About Us



We are a fast-growing e-commerce company operating fashion dropshipping stores with hundreds of products and frequent product launches.



Our structure is organized with specialized people handling product listing, media buying, creative production, campaign launching, and product research.





Job Description & Responsibilities



We are looking for an experienced Frontend Manager who can fully manage and oversee the entire frontend operations, ensure quality control across all teams, and act as the main coordination point between the teams and me.



This is a high-responsibility position requiring leadership, organization, and strong Shopify fashion dropshipping experience.





You will be responsible for:

* Taking full ownership of frontend operations and day-to-day execution



* Ensuring smooth communication between teams and me



* Managing all people and checking the work of the product lister, media buyer, campaign launcher, creative strategist and maker, product researcher.





You must have hands-on experience in the 5 areas below, even if you won’t execute these tasks daily yourself. Otherwise, you won’t be able to properly manage or improve them.



Product Lister

* Verify product imports and optimization

* Check translations and product descriptions

* Ensure correct pricing and formatting

* Validate collections organization

* Ensure tools like Hextom, Photoroom, and Poky are used correctly



Media Buyer

* Monitor performance and scaling logic

* Ensure proper budget allocation



Campaign Launcher

* Validate campaign setup before launch

* Check campaign structure



Creative Strategist & Creative Maker

* Review ad creatives

* Check angle testing

* Ensure creatives match product positioning



Product Researcher

* Validate product selection quality using the
 Ad Library

* Confirm product meets scaling criteria





Proactivity & Process Optimization (Very Important)



We are not looking for someone who only follows existing SOPs.



You must be proactive and constantly look for ways to optimize, improve, and perfect every SOP and frontend process — down to the smallest details.



What we expect:

* Regularly propose concrete optimizations for existing SOPs to improve speed, accuracy, and profitability

* Identify inefficiencies, errors, and bottlenecks before they become problems

* Suggest better tools, structures, and tracking systems when relevant



If you only execute instructions without questioning or improving them, this role is not for you.



We are looking for someone who thinks like a manager, not an executor.





Requirements



* Minimum 1+ year of experience as a Frontend Manager in a Shopify dropshipping store



Several months of hands-on experience for a Shopify dropshipping store in each area you will supervise, even if you won’t execute these tasks daily yourself:

* Product listing

* Media buying

* Campaign launching

* Creative strategy

* Creative production

* Product research



Proven Experience With:

* Shopify

* Hextom (Bulk Product Edit)

* Photoroom

* Poky (with chat gpt prompts)

* Slack or 

* Google Sheets

* DeepL

* ChatGPT

* Higgsfield (or other AI background tools)

* Meta Ads

* Winning Hunter

* Canva

We will provide free access to all these tools.



* Strong organizational and leadership skills



* Experience managing hundreds of products



* Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal



* Ability to work independently without constant supervision



* Long-term mindset and reliability





Compensation



* Salary based on experience and skills (to be discussed)

* Payment bi-weekly or monthly.





How to Apply



Please send your application before February 19 at 11:59 PM (Philippines time).



To confirm that you carefully read this job post, start your application message with the number “201”. Applications that do not follow this instruction will not be reviewed.

title: Etsy Listing Specialist for 6-Shop Brand (must know Printify, Templett, & Canva)

mber, not a short-term freelancer. The final stage of our hiring process involves a short PAID test task ($10) to verify your Printify/SEO skills. If you are not willing to complete a test, please do not apply.

title: URGENT: CLIENT RECORDS & COMMUNICATIONS ADMINISTRATORS
description:
REPORTING TO: Practice Support Manager

ENGAGEMENT: Full-Time (40 hours per week)

LOCATION: Remote

SALARY: AUD$1,280 - AUD $1,600



ABOUT THE ROLE

We are a remote Australian financial advice firm seeking a detail-oriented Client Records & Communications Administrator to support our team by ensuring client information, onboarding tasks, and communications are accurate, complete, and ready for action.



This role plays a critical part in client onboarding, record management, and internal communications. You will work closely with Associates to support data entry, product research, and implementation tasks, while managing the support inbox. The role operates within a two-administrator support model, with clearly defined ownership and structured backup support during peak periods or absences.



ABOUT LIFE UNSHACKLED

LifeUnshackled is a platform built to help people reclaim the life they once dreamed of, clients and team alike. We exist because “retire comfortably” is not the goal, freedom is. We bring bold financial strategy and strong follow-through so clients can build real wealth and live life on their terms. You will be joining a growth-minded team that cares about ambition, high standards, and doing work that genuinely helps people unshackle their lives.



PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Client records & implementation support

6. Maintain an orderly shared drive with clear naming conventions and up-to-date records.

6. Support Practice Support Manager with conducting file audits for compliance, clarity and process integrity. 



Communications & documentation

1. Prepare client file notes and follow-up
s using Read.ai transcripts and approved prompts.

2. Draft internal meeting minutes with clear actions and accountability.

3. Monitor and triage the shared support inbox.

4. Maintain accurate records of communications for compliance and reference.



SECONDARY SUPPORT

PRIOTISATION ORDER

The following order of prioritisation applies, balanced against PSM direction:

- Preparing post-meeting file notes and
s.

- Supporting onboarding tasks for new clients.

- Updating the Client Support Pack and shared drive with new information.

- Monitoring and routing
s from the support inbox.

- Other administrative support as directed by the PSM or Associates.



IDEAL CANDIDATE

- Australian financial planning administration experience.

- Strong compliance knowledge to support product research, data management, onboarding, and implementation tasks.

- Experience using Google Workspace (Gmail, Google Drive, Docs, and Sheets).

- A stable and secure internet connection suitable for full-time remote work.

- A reliable computer capable of supporting daily use of cloud-based systems and collaboration tools.

- Clear written communication skills and comfort working with structured templates and prompts.

- A proactive, organised approach and the ability to manage competing priorities.



KEY TRAITS

- Methodical and detail-oriented

- Self-managed with strong follow-through

- Clear communicator

- Collaborative and adaptable across tasks and personalities



WE OFFER

- Training and support from a passionate, purpose-driven team

- Opportunities for long-term growth and stability

- A remote, flexible work environment where your contribution is truly valued



APPLICATION PROCESS

- A 2–5 min video introducing yourself and explaining why you’re the best fit for this role

- Your updated resume and LinkedIn profile link

- Names and contact details of three references (2 professional + 1 personal)



Your answers to the following case study:

**Case Study:**

You've just received a revenue statement in .csv format. It's the only data we have available to input into our revenue system. Separate to our accounting system (Xero), we plan to upload this data to our client CRM (Airtable) and ensure it's applied to the relevant client accounts. The data is messy, with formatting inconsistencies and some grouped payments from Stripe representing multiple client transactions.

title: SaaS Pricing & Revenue Analyst (Healthcare Software)
description:
We are hiring an experienced analyst to work on pricing for a healthcare SaaS product serving private clinics. This role starts as a paid trial and converts to a full-time position for the right candidate.



You will build the Excel models that determine how this SaaS product is priced and sold.



What You Will Do



• Build a competitor pricing matrix for healthcare and clinic SaaS platforms

• Create customer segments (solo clinics, small clinics, multi-location groups)

• Develop 2–3 SaaS pricing models

• Select one primary model and one fallback

• Build revenue models by tier, users, and clinic size

• Define upgrade and expansion logic

• Build pricing defense logic for sales



All work is done in Excel.



Experience Required

Do not apply without experience in at least one of the following:



• SaaS pricing or monetization

• Subscription revenue modeling

• Healthcare or clinic software

• B2B SaaS competitive analysis



You must be able to work independently and deliver structured financial models.



Trial Contract

This starts as a paid trial at $50.

Successful candidates will be hired full time.



How to Apply

Send:



A short description of your SaaS or pricing experience



One example of a pricing or revenue model you have built (sanitized is fine)

This is about the "last 20%" - perfecting the typography, tightening the layout, and adding the professional polish that makes a site feel premium.



Working Hours

You must be online and available for real-time collaboration during these hours.



Key Responsibilities:

- Design Elevation: Transform flat/basic Figma drafts into sophisticated, modern designs.

- UI Polish: Refine spacing, visual hierarchy, and iconography.

- Figma Excellence: Build and maintain clean files using Auto Layout and Components.

- Speed: Deliver high-quality "polish" updates across multiple projects weekly.



Requirements

Portfolio: Must show clean, high-end UI/landing page work.

Figma: Expert level. If you don't use Auto Layout, this isn't the role for you.

Communication: Strong English skills for internal team syncs.

Reliability: You must have a stable internet connection and be 100% available during Sydney business hours.



BONUS POINTS: If you work with Wix Studio as well, this would be a preferable candidate.



Comp & Benefits

Rate: $550 USD / Month (Fixed).



Stability: Long-term internal role; you are part of our core agency team.



Growth: Opportunity to work on diverse international client projects.

title: Scheduler/ Customer Service
description:
Position : Scheduler (with Customer Service Cross-Training)

 Department: Operations

 Reports To: Operations Manager / Scheduling Lead

 Employment Type: Full-time

Position Summary

The Scheduler is responsible for coordinating client appointments, maintaining accurate scheduling records, and ensuring seamless communication between clients, cleaners, and the sales team. This role requires strong organizational discipline, attention to detail, and proactive problem-solving to maintain operational continuity. The Scheduler will also be cross-trained in Customer Service functions to provide backup support when needed.



Key Responsibilities

Scheduling & Client Setup

Create and maintain new client profiles in company software.

Create client job records, including initial visits and recurring service frequency.

Verify that all customer information and system links are correctly completed.

Monitor new client intake and complete system setup promptly.

Create one-time job records for existing recurring clients when applicable.

Acquire company service zoning knowledge to support in the scheduling logistics and ensure logistics logic is applied when working on daily schedule routine. 

Schedule Management & Coordination

Maintain and update client scheduling.

Adjust schedules to accommodate time-off requests, last-minute client cancellations, or employee absences.

Analyze weekly schedule capacity and communicate availability to Sales for quoting and lead management.

Perform weekly planning for recurring monthly clients.





Client Communication

Confirm service setup and initial visit details with new clients.

Send visit confirmation messages for upcoming appointments.

Communicate scheduling changes to clients and staff when necessary.









Monitoring & Change Management

Review communications for cancellations or change requests, including:

Monday morning review of weekend change requests

Phone and Text messages from clients

Staff change in schedule 

Reassign or fill canceled appointments when possible.

Update scheduling records accordingly.





Reporting

Prepare and present a weekly scheduling report for operational meetings.

Review upcoming monthly cleanings to ensure readiness.

Create and provide any pertinent reports.





System & Process Maintenance

Maintain accurate records in company software and scheduling tools.

Ensure scheduling data integrity and operational transparency.





Customer Service Backup Responsibilities (Cross-Training)

Provide support for incoming client communications during peak periods or staff absence.

Assist with appointment inquiries, changes, and confirmations.

Maintain professional and solution-focused client interactions.

Escalate issues appropriately while preserving service continuity.





Required Skills & Qualifications

Strong organizational and time-management skills.

Ability to process critical thinking

High attention to detail and data accuracy.

Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

Fluent English (conversational and written)

Professional written and verbal communication skills.

Problem-solving mindset with adaptability to last-minute changes.

Comfort working with scheduling and CRM systems

Customer-focused attitude and teamwork orientation.





Preferred Qualifications

Experience in scheduling, dispatching, or operations coordination.

Familiarity with CRM/scheduling platforms

Background in service-based business operations.

Spanish is a plus





Work Expectations

Consistent collaboration and good relationship with operations and sales teams.

Commitment to maintaining reliable scheduling workflows.

Pro activity in suggesting and initiating process improvements.

s 

• Keep our schedule accurate and avoid booking errors/missed appointments 

• Maintain high client satisfaction (reviews, low complaints / cancellations) 



Daily Responsibilities

*Sales & Customer Communication Duties:

- Answer inbound sales calls quickly and follow our quoting/sales process to book cleans 

- Respond to all inbound inquiries via text, call, and
 using our quoting system 

- Conduct outbound follow?up and simple outreach on
, Instagram, Nextdoor, and provided lead lists using our scripts 

- After each clean, follow up with clients to request reviews, answer questions, resolve simple issues, and invite them to recurring service



*Scheduling & Operations Support:

- Enter bookings into our scheduling software accurately using our scheduling guide 

- Track cleaner availability and coordinate with the office team to assign jobs 

- Communicate clearly with both clients and cleaners about schedules and changes 

- Organize photos, complete work orders, and enter invoices accurately



*Admin & Reporting Duties: 

- Complete your daily admin checklist

- Track basic sales metrics and review notes for accuracy 

- Occasionally assist with simple social media posts or Canva designs



Training & Support

• 1-on-1 training directly with the owners 

• Support from a senior VA during overlapping shift hours 

• Access to our training database and additional professional development resources



Required Soft Skills

• Clear spoken and written English

• Friendly

• Strong communication and problem-solving 

• Organized and detail-oriented 

• Can manage many tasks without losing accuracy 

• Fast learner with a desire to improve



Required Experience & Tools

• Previous sales and customer service experience 

• Comfortable with: basic web research, Google Drive, Gmail, Slack 

• Able to learn new software (CRM, lead & booking management)



Preferred Skills

• Canva 

• Basic admin reporting / billing



Compensation & Schedule

Base salary: $800 USD/month, paid twice monthly 

Bonuses / tiered revenue share: You’ll earn a percentage of company revenue that increases in tiers as we hit higher monthly revenue levels. The bigger we grow, the higher your share (tier structure will be reviewed together). Paid monthly after 60 days of employment. 



Schedule (Mountain Standard Time): 

Tue–Fri: 12:30 PM – 8:30 PM 

Sat: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM



How to Apply

When applying, put “I want to help your cleaning company grow!” in the subject heading.

Please include: 

• Your resume 

• At least 2 professional references 

• A screenshot of your home internet speed test 

• A short note on why you’d be a great fit for this role!

title: High Performance Remote Appointment Setter (Philippines Based)
description:

This is a commission-driven opportunity for someone who wants more than just a salary. 



What You'll Do:

2) Build rapport and qualify leads

Who This Is For:

title: B2B Sales Manager
description:
We’re hiring a commercial leader to own revenue across a portfolio of real estate services, SaaS products, and outsourcing solutions. 



This role is designed for someone who enjoys closing complex B2B deals, is comfortable speaking directly about money and outcomes, and wants meaningful ownership—not just a quota. 



You’ll work closely with the CEO, operate with real autonomy, and play a key role in shaping how we go to market as we scale. 



THE OPPORTUNITY 



This is not a narrow, single-product sales role. 



You will: 



Own the full sales cycle end-to-end 



Represent multiple high-value offerings 



Influence pricing, positioning, and deal structure 



Build long-term commercial relationships, not transactional wins 



If you’re at a point in your career where you want more responsibility, more trust, and more upside, this role is built for that. 



WHAT YOU’LL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR 



Revenue & Pipeline Ownership 



Build and manage your own B2B pipeline through outbound outreach, referrals, and strategic follow-ups 



Engage directly with decision-makers across real estate, SaaS, and professional services Advance opportunities with confidence and commercial judgment 



Sales Execution 



Run effective discovery calls and demos focused on business outcomes 



Lead pricing, negotiation, and close conversations 



Identify and execute upsell, renewal, and cross-sell opportunities across brands 



Commercial Leadership 



Represent the CEO in sales conversations and negotiations 



Own key accounts through close and early lifecycle stability 



Surface new revenue opportunities and market insights proactively 



Accountability & Visibility 



Maintain a clean, accurate CRM (GoHighLevel preferred) 



Report weekly on pipeline value, close rate, deal velocity, and revenue performance Be measured on outcomes, not busywork







Requirements

WHO THRIVES IN THIS ROLE 



This role is a strong fit if you: 



Have 3 or more years closing B2B deals in SaaS, agencies, outsourcing, or real estate services Are comfortable generating opportunities, not just handling inbound leads 



Enjoy consultative selling, negotiation, and problem-solving 



Can operate independently while collaborating with leadership 



Take pride in owning a number and improving it



Experience with GoHighLevel, real estate brokerages, or agency services is a strong advantage. 







Benefits

GROWTH, COMPENSATION & ACCESS 



Base Salary: Competitive and aligned with experience 



Commission: Uncapped, performance-driven, and meaningful 



Growth Path: Clear runway to Director of Sales for the right performer 



Access: Direct line to the CEO and influence over sales strategy 



This is a role where strong performance is visible, rewarded, and expanded. 





OUR HIRING APPROACH 

?

We value real experience over polished resumes. 



Candidates will be asked to: 



Walk through deals they personally closed 



Explain how they handled hesitation or resistance 



Share real metrics including deal size, close rates, and pipeline ownership 



If you’ve carried revenue responsibility before, this process will feel natural.

title: AI Automation Builder  – Marketing Agency Systems
description:
We are looking for an AI Automation Builder to help set up and connect the tools needed to automate our proposal creation and lead generation workflows.

title: GoHighLevel CRM & Automation Specialist
description:

NYFI Dealer Services is seeking a highly experienced GoHighLevel (GHL) CRM expert to build, optimize, and structure our CRM systems for maximum performance.



This is not a basic VA role. We are looking for a technical specialist who understands workflows, automation logic, AI integration, and scalable CRM architecture.



Position Overview



You will be responsible for designing and implementing advanced workflows inside GoHighLevel to ensure our CRM operates efficiently, intelligently, and consistently.



Your goal is to structure the system so it runs smoothly with minimal manual oversight.



Core Responsibilities

Design automation sequences for SMS,
, and pipeline movement



Implement AI-assisted messaging and response systems



Configure triggers, conditional logic, and automation paths



Improve pipeline structure and opportunity management



Audit and troubleshoot existing workflows

Improve response time and automation efficiency



Required Qualifications



Expert-level experience with GoHighLevel CRM



Advanced workflow and automation design skills



Strong understanding of triggers, conditions, and event-based logic



Experience integrating AI tools within CRM systems



Ability to think strategically about system architecture



Strong troubleshooting and debugging ability



Fluent English (spoken and written)



Reliable high-speed internet



Organized, detail-oriented mindset



Preferred Qualifications



Experience building sales or finance pipelines



Experience with dialer integrations



API and webhook familiarity



Zapier or third-party automation experience



What We’re Looking For

Someone who documents what they build



To Apply

A short explanation of how you approach automation design



Your availability and timezone



Only experienced GoHighLevel specialists should apply.

title: Amazon Growth Manager (PPC + Multi-Market Operations)
description:
We manage multiple Amazon brands across Canada, USA and Europe (Germany, France, Italy, Spain, Belgium), including our own brand and several client accounts.



Combined annual revenue exceeds $1.5M CAD and we are growing.



We are hiring an Amazon Growth Manager to take ownership of PPC and account operations across multiple marketplaces.



This is NOT a basic VA role.

We are looking for someone analytical, structured and profit-focused.



You will be responsible for managing and improving performance across multiple accounts while maintaining clarity and control.



PPC (Primary Focus)



• Manage and optimize SP, SB and SD campaigns

• Implement clear research vs performance campaign structure

• Weekly search term mining and negative keyword strategy

• Keyword graduation (research ? exact performance campaigns)

• Separate branded vs non-branded campaigns

• Allocate budgets by country based on performance

• Monitor TACOS and improve overall profitability

• Identify and reduce wasted ad spend

• Protect margin while scaling revenue



Account Operations



• Create and troubleshoot variations (parent/child)

• Upload flat files and manage listing updates

• Monitor listing health and suppressions

• Handle Seller Central cases professionally

• Support keyword optimization and backend search terms

• Set up deals and coupons

• Deliver structured weekly performance reports



What We Optimize For



We do NOT optimize for ACOS alone.



You must understand:



• TACOS vs ACOS

• Break-even ACOS

• Contribution margin

• Keyword intent

• Campaign structure logic

• Multi-market budget allocation

• How PPC strategy impacts return rate and profitability



We want someone who thinks like a business owner, not just someone who adjusts bids.



Compensation & Structure



• 35 hours per week (potentially 40 after 60 days)

• $11 USD/hour

• Performance-based raise after 90 days

• Bonus structure after month 2

• Long-term opportunity to grow into a senior or leadership role



First 30 Days Objective



Your first mission will be to:



• Audit all accounts

• Clean PPC structure

• Identify inefficiencies

• Reduce wasted spend

• Implement consistent weekly reporting

• Bring clarity and control



To Apply (Required)



Applications without these 3 steps will NOT be reviewed.



1) Record a 2–3 minute Loom explaining:



If TACOS is 34%, ACOS is 24%, revenue is stable and return rate is 11% — what could be happening and what would you investigate first?



2) Explain how to calculate break-even ACOS (with example).



3) Describe your weekly PPC optimization process step-by-step.



Be specific. Generic answers will not be considered.

title: Shopify Web Developer - Remote, Part Time
description:
We are seeking a skilled and analytical Shopify Developer to manage, enhance, and optimize our Shopify eCommerce store. This role will be pivotal in ensuring the technical health of our Shopify storefront while also assuring the tracking analytics between platforms is properly maintained and enhanced.



Ideal candidates are both technically savvy and data-driven, with experience in eCommerce, Shopify development, and performance analytics.



Requirements:

-Design, develop, and maintain the company’s Shopify website using Liquid, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

-Set up and manage analytics and tracking tools (Google Analytics, GA4, Meta Pixel, TikTok Pixel, etc.).

-Knowledge of Google Tag Manager and connection between tracking tools is an essential.

-Build, customize, and optimize Shopify themes and third-party app integrations.

-Maintain and troubleshoot the Shopify store to ensure site stability and performance.

-Improve and optimize page speed, checkout flows, mobile responsiveness, and user experience (UI/UX).

-Monitor, analyze, and report on key performance metrics (conversion rate, bounce rate, AOV, customer journey, etc.).

-Collaborate with marketing teams on A/B testing for product pages, landing pages, and campaigns.

-Assist in setting up tracking for affiliate and influencer marketing efforts.

-Implement CRO (conversion rate optimization) best practices based on real-time data and testing.



Qualifications:

-3+ years of experience in Shopify development, theme customization, and app integrations.

-Proven track record of optimizing eCommerce websites for conversion and performance.

-Proven track record of optimizing analytics and tracking tools (Google Analytics, GA4, Meta Pixel, TikTok Pixel, etc.).

-Proficient in Shopify Liquid.

-Strong knowledge of analytics platforms (GA4, Google Tag Manager, Meta Ads Manager, TikTok Ads Manager).

-Experience with A/B testing and CRO strategies.

-Strong attention to detail, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.

-Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced eCommerce environment.

-Excellent communication and teamwork skills.



Know more about us!

Ennovation Brands is dedicated to creating innovative, high-quality beauty and wellness products. We are passionate about connecting with our audience and delivering exceptional value through our content, products, and services.



Visit our websites:


/


/



To move forward, please answer the following questions:

Are you comfortable working on graveyard shift?

What is your current salary?

What is your expected salary (in USD, per hour)?

Are you open to working with a time tracker?

Are you able to provide a contact from your previous employer for character reference?

Are you available to start immediately?



*Shopify Developer Experience

Years of experience as a Shopify Developer:

Additionally, please share a link to your CV and portfolio ensure it is accessible.



Due to the high volume of applications, only qualified candidates will be contacted. We appreciate your time and interest!



Thanks!

Kim A.

title: Marketing Lead
description:
At Yokly, we’re looking for a Marketing Lead who doesn’t just run campaigns — but owns the entire growth engine end to end. This role is for a strategic, data-driven marketer who knows how to turn positioning, funnels, and creative into qualified discovery calls for Sales.



You’ll lead a focused pod, collaborate closely with Design, Sales, and Operations, and run multi-channel campaigns with clear attribution, measurable results, and continuous optimization. If you love building systems, testing ideas, and seeing your work directly influence revenue — this role is built for you.



What You’ll Do

Strategy & Planning

Design and manage multi-channel campaigns: LinkedIn outreach + ads,
 funnels & nurture, landing pages, and partnership campaigns.

Define ICPs, offers, messaging maps, and test hypotheses that shape our go-to-market strategy.



Execution & Systems

Launch and oversee LinkedIn sequences and GoHighLevel automations.

Maintain organized UTMs, campaign taxonomy, and tracking to ensure clean attribution.

Ensure seamless lead handoff into our in-house app/CRM — every lead counts.



Creative Collaboration

Lead creative briefs and SLAs with the Design team (social posts, reels, carousels, landing page blocks).

Review assets to ensure message-market fit, brand consistency, and compliance.

Uphold our brand pillars, style, and voice across all campaigns.



Proposals & Reporting

Build campaign proposals outlining goals, audience, offers, creative briefs, and budgets.

Produce clear performance reports with actionable insights and recommendations for continuous improvement.



Optimization & Learning

Run A/B tests across hooks, offers, landing pages, and sequences.

Capture learnings and build playbooks to elevate future campaigns.



Cross-Team Collaboration

Work closely with Operations, Sales, and Client Success for smooth handoffs, data integrity, and feedback loops.

Be a communicator of wins, challenges, and insights across the team.





???? Who We’re Looking For (Qualifications)

Master’s degree in Marketing, Business Management, or related field.

3+ years in B2B / SaaS / performance marketing roles.

Hands-on experience with LinkedIn outreach,
 funnels, landing pages, and automation (GoHighLevel or similar).

Proven track record running multi-channel campaigns with strong attribution.

Strong skills in brief-writing, creative review, and campaign processes.

Analytical mindset; comfortable working with dashboards, UTMs, and performance data.

Excellent English communication skills.

Collaborative spirit; thrives in fast-paced environments.



Nice to Have

Experience in Fintech, Payments, or SaaS

Deep understanding of funnel optimization and landing-page experimentation

Familiarity with compliance-sensitive marketing



What You Get

Fully remote, full-time role

Weekends off (Saturday & Sunday)

HMO upon regularization

PTO, Sick Leave, Mental Health Leave

PTO conversion to cash

13th Month Pay as our holiday thank-you

title: Connector (Remote | Night Shift |Appointment Setter/Cold Callers)
description:
Connector (Remote | Night Shift | Philippines)



Are you a confident communicator who loves meaningful conversations?

Do you enjoy connecting with people and turning interest into opportunity?

Looking for a stable, people-first, remote career with real growth?



If that’s a YES, Yokly would love to meet you!

About the Role



As a Connector, you’ll be the first voice and first impression of Yokly. You’ll engage prospective clients through thoughtful conversations, guide them through initial questions, and help move them toward meaningful next steps.



This role blends communication, sales, and relationship-building, supported by modern tools like GoHighLevel (GHL) and LinkedIn. You’re not just calling — you’re building connections that drive growth.





What You’ll Do:

Connect with prospective clients and spark meaningful conversations

Schedule discovery calls and consultations for Sales Representatives

Maintain clean, organized call logs and follow-up notes in GoHighLevel (GHL)

Use LinkedIn (Sales Navigator / Helper) to research, engage, and nurture leads

Reconnect with unreachable or cold leads through structured outreach

Support outreach and lead engagement through CRM and automation tools



What Makes You a Great Fit

- 1–2 years of experience in sales, customer service, appointment setting, or similar roles

- Working knowledge of GoHighLevel (GHL) and LinkedIn outreach tools

- Familiarity with CRMs, dialers, or calling tools (Salesforce, 3CX, or similar)

- Experience in sales consulting or outbound outreach is a plus

- Comfortable working night shifts

- Excellent communication skills and professional phone presence

- Confident, persuasive, and goal-oriented mindset





What You Get as Part of Yokly

100% Work-from-Home

 HMO Coverage for your health and peace of mind

 Work-Life Balance & Leave Privileges

Weekends Off (Saturday & Sunday)

PTO Conversion to Cash

13th Month Pay — our way of saying thank you



Apply here:

title: Digital Products VA — Etsy Store Builder & Assistant
description:
About Us:

We are a growing digital products and e-commerce company. We are building something real and we need someone exceptional to grow with us. This is not a temporary gig. This is a long term position for the right person who proves themselves.



The Role:

You will work directly with the founder. You will receive voice memos, rough notes and ideas and your job is to turn them into polished, professional digital products ready to sell. You need to be comfortable working from unstructured input and producing structured, high quality output without hand holding.



Your Responsibilities:



Receive voice memos and rough notes from founder and extract key information

Structure and organize content into thorough professional digital products

Design finished products in Canva to a high standard

Write SEO optimized listings — titles, descriptions, tags

Upload and manage products on Etsy store

Run Pinterest marketing to drive consistent organic traffic

Monitor sales and reviews and suggest improvements

Research market trends and identify new product opportunities

Maintain organized tracking spreadsheets

Send weekly progress reports to founder





Experience We Are Looking For:



Proven Etsy store management experience

Strong Canva skills — you produce beautiful work not just functional work

Etsy SEO knowledge — you understand how people search and buy

Pinterest marketing experience — you know how to drive traffic organically

Research and competitor analysis skills

Strong written English — professional, clear, warm

Spreadsheet and organizational skills

Any e-commerce experience outside of Etsy is a definite asset — Shopify, Amazon, digital marketing, customer service, order management or anything related is highly valued and will be considered seriously





You Are:



Exceptionally organized and detail oriented

A self starter who takes initiative without needing hand holding

Comfortable turning rough unstructured ideas into polished professional output

Someone who takes genuine pride in the quality of their work

Looking for a long term home not just another short term gig

Honest, reliable and communicates proactively





Hours: Part time to start with clear path to full time for the right person

Growth: Responsibilities and compensation grow as you prove yourself. We are building across multiple directions and want someone who wants to grow with us long term. This will be long term position, however there is probation period. 



To Apply:

Tell us one thing you have built, organized, or created that you are proud of. We want to see how you think before we look at your resume.



We may take on full time depending on the experience. Any e-commerce, VA experience is an asset, list your experience and education. Tag your portfolio. 



You will directly working with the owner, Interviews are conducted from 5PM PST-10PM PST.

title: Virtual Assistant – Operations & Workflow Specialist
description:
Role Overview

The Virtual Assistant – Operations & Workflow Specialist is a virtual assistant who takes ownership of operational systems, workflows, and execution across teams. This role goes beyond admin support—this person ensures processes run smoothly, data is accurate, stakeholders are aligned, and operations scale with consistency.



At Yokly, Operators think in systems, outcomes, and accountability. They proactively improve workflows, maintain SOPs, track KPIs, and serve as a reliable operational backbone for growing teams.



???? What You’ll Own (Key Responsibilities)

Operations & Process Ownership

Build, document, and continuously improve SOPs and workflows

Maintain up-to-date process documentation for cross-team use

Identify inefficiencies and recommend operational improvements

Ensure processes are followed and refined as the business scales

Project & Workflow Management

Track recurring tasks, projects, and deliverables across teams

Own timelines, follow-ups, and reporting loops

Coordinate with internal teams, vendors, and external partners

Support i
 management, ticketing, and internal operations

Data, Reporting & Quality Assurance

Maintain dashboards, trackers, and KPI reports

Perform data QA, reconciliation, and back-office checks

Generate operational reports using Google Sheets or Excel

Ensure accuracy of records, budgets, billing, and internal databases

Advanced Admin & Coordination

Calendar management for managers or team leads

Event, travel, and logistics coordination when needed

Act as a point of contact between leadership, teams, and partners

Manage internal documentation and operational records

Proactive Ownership

Anticipate issues before they escalate

Follow up without being prompted

Flag risks, gaps, or delays early

Operate with a “solve, not just do” mindset



What We’re Looking For (Ideal Profile)

Core Traits

Highly process-oriented and detail-driven

Proactive, reliable, and comfortable owning outcomes

Organized, structured, and calm under pressure

Communicates clearly across teams and stakeholders



Technical & Tool Proficiency

Intermediate to advanced Google Sheets / Excel

Formulas, pivot tables, conditional formatting

Experience with tools such as:

CRMs (HubSpot or similar)

Accounting or billing tools (e.g., Xero)

Ticketing systems (Zendesk, Intercom, or equivalent)

title: Senior AI Systems Architect
description:
Senior AI Systems Architect (Contract-Based)



Build a Private AI Brain for a Knowledge-Driven Organization



We are not looking for a prompt engineer.

We are not looking for someone who “uses ChatGPT well.”



We are looking for a senior AI systems architect who can design and implement a structured, private AI assistant trained strictly on our internal knowledge base.



If you have not built real AI systems before, this role is not for you.



THE MISSION



We are a knowledge-intensive organization with extensive proprietary educational, analytical, and operational materials.



We want to build a private AI assistant that:



-Understands our internal frameworks and methodologies

-Synthesizes information across multiple documents

-Assists in research and structured analysis

-Drafts outputs aligned with our internal logic

-Operates within strict guardrails

-Uses only our curated materials unless explicitly instructed



This is not basic document search.

This is building a controlled AI research and analysis system.



WHAT YOU WILL BUILD



-A structured AI knowledge architecture

-A private internal AI research assistant

-A system capable of synthesis, analysis, and structured output

-Proper retrieval and reasoning workflows

-Guardrails to minimize hallucination and knowledge drift

-Clear documentation so our team can use and maintain the system



If your solution is “just upload everything into ChatGPT,” this role is not for you.



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE



You must have real experience with:



-OpenAI API

-Building AI systems for real clients or companies

-Retrieval-based systems (RAG or similar frameworks)

-Working with large structured and unstructured data

-Designing systems, not just writing prompts



Bonus if familiar with:



-Gemini

-NotebookLM

-AI workflow automation

-Knowledge base architecture



We are looking for builders and system thinkers.



WHO SHOULD NOT APPLY



-Prompt engineers without backend experience

-VAs who simply use AI tools

-Applicants without proof of real-world AI systems built



ENGAGEMENT STRUCTURE



-Contract / project-based

-Milestone-driven

-Potential ongoing retainer relationship based on performance



HOW TO APPLY



To be considered, you must complete the application form below: 
 [DO NOT CLICK THE LINK. COPY IT AND PASTE IT IN A NEW TAB.]



Important:

-You must submit a Loom video inside the form presenting an AI system you built.

-Applications without a completed form will not be reviewed.

-Do not send direct messages or attachments through OnlineJobs.

title: Python Developer – GNSS & Survey Data Processing Automation
description:
Overview



We are a professional land surveying firm seeking a technically strong geospatial engineer to design and implement an automated workflow for processing, organizing, and archiving survey field data.



This role focuses on survey-grade data automation, not web mapping, not cartography.



Our field crews use Topcon data collectors (FC-5000) producing proprietary MJF files, along with static GNSS observations and total station datasets. We want to eliminate repetitive manual handling and build a scalable, automated data pipeline.



What You’ll Build



You will design and implement a Python-based automation system that:



Monitors and backs up raw field data



Parses proprietary MJF survey files



Extracts coordinate and observation data



Separates:



Raw WGS84 coordinates



Localized coordinate systems



State Plane data (when applicable)



Processes static GNSS datasets



Extracts residuals and localization fit metrics



Identifies total station occupation/backsite errors



Preserves control point (GCP) history in WGS84



Automatically unzips, renames, and archives field exports



Generates QA/QC summary reports



Organizes everything into a clean, scalable job directory structure



Optionally builds a structured database (SQLite/PostgreSQL)



This is backend engineering for survey data systems.



Required Skills



Strong Python scripting experience



Experience parsing structured or semi-structured files (binary, CSV, database exports)



Solid understanding of coordinate systems:



WGS84



State Plane



Local coordinate systems



Familiarity with GNSS concepts:



Static observations



Base/Rover workflows



Localization



Residuals



Experience with:



pandas



pyproj



geopandas (preferred)



Experience building automated workflows or ETL pipelines



Strongly Preferred Background



Geodetic Engineering



Land Surveying



Geomatics



Geodesy



GNSS data processing



RINEX file handling



Topcon / Trimble / Leica data formats



Survey QA/QC automation



What This Is Not



This is NOT:



A web map developer role



A cartography or visualization job



A CAD drafting position



A general IT support role



We are looking for someone comfortable with:



Coordinate transformations



Data parsing logic



Survey error analysis



Automation architecture



Clean data structuring



Project Scope



Initial engagement will focus on building the core automation pipeline.



There is strong potential for long-term collaboration and expansion into:



Data architecture refinement



QA reporting tools



Survey data analytics



Internal system integrations



To Apply



Please include:



Examples of automation scripts or data pipelines you have built



Any experience working with survey or GNSS datasets



A short explanation of how you would approach parsing a proprietary survey data format



Your experience with coordinate transformations



Your availability and expected hourly rate



Bonus: If you have worked with Topcon, RINEX, or GNSS static data, please describe your experience.

title: Amazon Listing Analytics Manager
description:
We are hiring an Amazon Listing Analytics Manager

 

Job Title

- Full-Time Amazon Listing Analytics Manager



Team Information

- Operations (Cross-functional between Listings Management and Advertising Management)



Reports To

- Directly to the COO



Employment Type

- Full-time / Flexible



Location

- Remote (with minimum 4 hours overlap with US Central timezone preferred)



Compensation

-$48,000–$72,000/year (based on experience and capabilities) with yearly performance bonuses tied to measurable listing improvements



About Us

We are Crown Rights Investing, an e-commerce company that operates two fast-growing premium bedding brands on Amazon and Shopify, with plans for continued growth and expansion. We are building out all aspects of our team to scale operations and reduce dependence on external agencies.

 

Our small team is the reason for our success. With fewer layers, every voice is heard and every action is visible. We operate with core values that guide everything we do:

 

•       Be an Owner: Act with the same care, urgency, professionalism, and creativity you would bring to your own business.

•       Make People Say “Wow!”: Whether they are customers or teammates, we aim to surprise and delight through service that goes beyond expectations.

 

Each of us is quick to lend a hand, share knowledge, and celebrate wins, large or small. We believe the best work happens when talented people serve one another, take full ownership of their craft, and consistently bring their best selves to the table. If you thrive in a collaborative environment where initiative is valued and a single outstanding idea can shape an entire brand, you’ll fit right in.

 

About Your Role

We’re seeking a highly analytical Amazon Listing Analytics Manager who can turn data into actionable insights and measurable results. While Amazon platform knowledge is valuable, we prioritize candidates with strong analytical foundations who excel at data analysis, experiment design, and strategic thinking. We’ll teach you Amazon—you bring the analytical horsepower.

 

As our Listing Analytics Manager, you’ll own the performance of all existing Amazon listings across two premium brands through data-driven experimentation and optimization. You’ll build the reporting infrastructure, design and execute A/B tests, monitor the competitive landscape, and present actionable recommendations to executive leadership.

 

Key Differentiator: This is not a listing copywriter or content creator. This is a performance analyst who uses data to identify opportunities, design experiments, and drive measurable improvement in marketplace effectiveness.

 

Your focus: maximize conversion rates on existing listings, build automated reporting infrastructure, provide competitive intelligence, and create a data-driven optimization system that scales with our growth.

 

Core Responsibilities

•       Build and maintain performance dashboards: Develop comprehensive tracking for conversion rate (CVR), click-through rate (CTR), Total Sessions, and keyword rankings across all mature listings. Transform raw Amazon Business Reports into automated, actionable dashboards for executive leadership.

•       Design and execute listing experiments: Create properly structured A/B tests on titles, bullet points, A+ content, and image positioning. Establish clear hypotheses, controls, sample sizes, and success metrics. Measure statistical significance and extract insights that inform strategy.

•       Perform systematic competitive intelligence: Monitor competitor listings, pricing strategies, keyword positioning, and content approaches on a routine basis. Identify threats and opportunities proactively, enabling strategic responses before revenue impact occurs.

•       Generate weekly performance reports with strategic recommendations: Communicate findings clearly to the COO and CEO with actionable insights—not data dumps. Quantify revenue impact of optimization opportunities and prioritize by estimated return.

•       Automate reporting infrastructure: Eliminate manual data collection overhead. Build scalable systems that provide real-time visibility into listing performance across an expanding product catalog.

•       Stay current with Amazon algorithm changes and marketplace trends: Continuously learn new optimization strategies, platform updates, and emerging best practices to maintain competitive advantage.

 

Qualifications

•       Strong analytical mindset with demonstrated ability to interpret complex datasets and identify actionable patterns

•       Advanced proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, INDEX-MATCH, complex formulas, data visualization)

•       Experience with data analysis, statistical thinking, or business intelligence

•       Proven experience designing and running A/B tests with statistical rigor (hypothesis, controls, sample size, significance testing)

•       Proven track record using metrics and testing to drive measurable improvements

•       Excellent attention to detail with systematic, process-oriented approach

•       Strong written communication skills—reports must be clear, concise, and actionable for executives

 

Desired Experience / Background

•       1–3 years experience in e-commerce analytics, digital marketing, SEO, or data analysis roles

•       Hands-on experience with Amazon Seller Central analytics (listing-level CVR, CTR, Sessions—not just PPC)

•       Background in A/B testing, conversion rate optimization (CRO), or growth marketing

•       Experience building reporting infrastructure and automated dashboards from scratch

•       Familiarity with competitive intelligence monitoring in e-commerce

•       Experience with multi-brand or multi-product portfolio analysis

 

Desired Technical Skills

•       Experience with Amazon-specific analytics tools (Helium 10, SellerBoard, Jungle Scout, Cerebro) or ability to learn quickly

•       Proficiency with data visualization tools (Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI, or similar)

•       Experience with keyword research and SEO analysis platforms

•       Strong data modeling skills with ability to forecast trends and build projections

•       Experience with SQL for data querying and manipulation

•       Comfortable working with APIs and data automation tools

•       Working knowledge of statistical analysis methods (significance testing, confidence intervals, sample size calculation)

 

Desired Interpersonal Skills

•       High attention to detail with commitment to data accuracy

•       Strong written and verbal communication skills for presenting insights to executive leadership

•       Self-motivated with ability to work independently in remote environment

•       Strategic thinker who connects data insights to business outcomes and revenue impact

•       Ownership mindset—proactive in identifying problems, designing experiments, and proposing solutions

•       Collaborative team player who coordinates effectively across departments

•       Comfortable with ambiguity and rapid iteration based on results

•       Process-driven—builds repeatable systems rather than one-off analyses

 

If you are interested in joining our team, please apply using the below link.

title: IT Business Analyst (Philippines Only)
description:
You may apply using this link:  



About Us



Ylopo, LLC is a rapidly growing marketing and technology company providing internet marketing services and proprietary lead generation and engagement software to successful real estate agents across the country. We are seeking an outgoing, tech savvy individual to join our growing team.



 



Why work for Ylopo?



At Ylopo we offer tea
mbers:



a commitment to personal development,



guidance and support at a high level through interfacing with our Executive Team to prioritize goals as a company,



excellent leadership and mentoring for our entry-level to senior staff, and recognition of outstanding efforts,



team building events, team lunches/ happy hours, and other company wide events



a supportive, caring environment dedicated to continuous learning and growth.



Ylopo is seeking a sharp, solutions-driven IT Business Analyst to help transform business needs into clear, actionable requirements. If you're passionate about documentation, testing, and process optimization, and thrive in collaborative, fast-paced environments, this is your chance to make an impact. Work closely with developers and stakeholders to drive clarity, alignment, and continuous improvement across our projects.



Job Description:



Gather, document, and validate business requirements by eliciting, analyzing, and specifying the underlying business needs and compiling them into a Business Requirement Document (BRD).

Closely work with the developers and stakeholders to ensure alignment on requirements.

Tracks and manages the requirements' status across the entire project lifecycle, including necessary enforcement or redefinition.

Write test scripts, execute and document Systems Integration Testing (SIT), log identified defects, and collaborate with developers to implement solutions.

Support User Acceptance Testing (UAT). 

Evaluate business processes, identify areas for improvement and develop and implement effective solutions based on process evaluations.

Assist/Lead ongoing reviews of business processes and develop optimization strategies, identify opportunities for process improvements and automation.

Develop and maintain process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to guide the project team. Effectively communicate complex information through simple, easily understandable visuals.

Conduct end-user training, process walkthroughs and reporting overviews.

Handle spot requests and assist with any other ad hoc duties assigned.

 



Qualifications/Skills:



Must have 2+ years of experience as IT Business Analyst

Excellent documentation skills, coupled with strong communication, presentation, and written abilities. Must also possess a strong team work spirit.

Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.  

Strong analytical, conceptual thinking, and problem-solving skills are essential. Must be meticulous and capable of clearly understanding, de-complicating, and proposing improvements to business requirements for project stakeholders.

Highly self-motivated, directed, can work independently with minimum assistance.

Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure.

Knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle and experience in Agile project delivery will be an advantage.

Proficiency in SQL scripting is a must.

Strong understanding and experience with Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) processes and Business Intelligence/Business Analytics (BI/BA) platforms is a plus.

 



System Requirements:



Processor should be 2 ghz and above, Intel core 5/7 or equal is highly required

MUST have the latest Operating System

      Windows 11 64bit

      Mac Ventura / Sonoma

16GB with 100GB Free disk space

MUST have a back-up Computer with the same specs as the main device

A Headset with noise cancelling feature is a must

20 mbps minimum wired connection for main isp

Back up internet is a must (pocket wifi, prepaid wifi etc. but strictly no USB Sticks allowed)

Back up power source

 



Shift Schedule: 8AM - 4PM Pacific Standard



Rate: depends on experience



MAGIC WORD: Yloper

title: Shopify Website Developer
description:
Creative Partner — Shopify Website Developer Contract • Part-Time • Remote/Hybrid • Project-Based



A fast-growing supplement and wellness brand is seeking a Shopify Website Developer to help build, optimize, and maintain our e?commerce experience across multiple product lines. This is a flexible contract role ideal for a developer who enjoys creative problem?solving, clean design, and the opportunity to shape the digital storefront of a brand focused on health, performance, and lifestyle. If you’re reliable, detail?oriented, and excited about contributing to a rapidly expanding wellness space, this role could be a great fit.



Responsibilities

Build and customize Shopify pages, templates, and sections



Implement UX/UI improvements to enhance conversion and customer experience



Optimize site speed, navigation, and mobile responsiveness



Integrate apps, tools, and automations to support marketing and sales



Troubleshoot technical issues and maintain site functionality



Collaborate directly with leadership to execute brand and design direction



Ensure consistent visual and functional quality across the website



Qualifications

Strong experience with Shopify (Liquid, theme customization, app integrations)



Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript



Understanding of e?commerce best practices and CRO principles



Ability to work independently and deliver projects reliably



Portfolio or examples of Shopify work required

No formal degree necessary



What You’ll Gain

Access to products for testing and content alignment



Portfolio credits on approved work



Early access to new product lines and launches



Opportunity for expanded responsibilities as the brand grows



A collaborative relationship with a founder in a fast-moving, health-focused industry

title: Ads Manager
description:
Creative Partner — Ads Manager  

Contract • Part-Time • Remote/Hybrid • Project-Based



A fast-growing supplement and wellness brand is seeking an Ads Manager to oversee, optimize, and scale paid advertising across multiple platforms. This is a flexible contract role ideal for someone who understands performance marketing, creative strategy, and the unique compliance considerations of the supplement industry. If you’re analytical, creative, and excited about helping a health-focused brand grow, this role could be a strong fit.



Responsibilities

Plan, launch, and manage paid ad campaigns across Meta, TikTok, Google, and other platforms



Collaborate with the creative team to develop high-performing ad concepts and variations



Analyze campaign data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for optimization



Conduct A/B testing on creatives, audiences, and messaging



Ensure all ads follow supplement advertising guidelines and avoid restricted claims



Build and refine audiences for prospecting, retargeting, and retention



Report performance insights to leadership in a clear, actionable format



Stay updated on platform changes, wellness industry trends, and competitive landscape



Qualifications

Proven experience managing paid ads for e?commerce brands



Strong understanding of Meta Ads Manager, TikTok Ads, and Google Ads



Ability to interpret data and make strategic decisions based on performance metrics



Familiarity with supplement/wellness advertising rules is a plus



Comfortable working independently and meeting deadlines



Experience collaborating with creatives to shape ad direction



No formal degree required — skill and results matter most



What You’ll Gain

Opportunity to shape the paid growth strategy of a fast-moving wellness brand



Collaboration with a founder and creative team



Early access to new product launches



Portfolio-building experience in a high-demand industry



Potential for expanded responsibilities as the brand scales



How to Apply

Please submit any of the following:



Examples of ad campaigns you’ve managed



Screenshots or case studies showing performance improvements



A short message about your experience with paid media

Resumes are welcome but not required — we prioritize skill, consistency, and strategic thinking.

title: TCB: Junior Bookkeeper
description:
Position Title: Junior Bookkeeper

Company: Time Capital Bookkeeping

Reporting To: Thomas Chavez

Location: Remote

Hours: Full-time 40 hours per week.

Compensation: Offer starting at  $10/hr depending on experience and ability, with growth potential. Performance review after initial 90 days.

Start Date: March 1st

Application Window: Open until filled.

Please Apply here with this Google Form: 



About Us

Time Capital Bookkeeping provides decision-ready financials for real estate investors so they can move fast, stay focused, and grow profits. We are a client-obsessed, systems-driven firm that values simplicity, clear communication, critical thinking, and ownership.

Founded by Max Emory, a U.S. Marine Corps veteran and real estate investor, Time Capital was built to solve the exact problems he experienced firsthand—unclear numbers, wasted time, and overly complex financials. Today, we support real estate investors with accurate, reliable books they can confidently act on.



We live by our values:



Client-Obsessed

The client experience is the north star for decision-making. We prioritize accuracy, clarity, and responsiveness so clients can confidently act on their financials.



Simplicity

Complexity doesn’t scale. We aim for clear, repeatable systems that reduce friction for both clients and the internal team.



Speed & Communication

Issues are identified and addressed quickly through clear, proactive communication. Silence and delays create problems; clarity prevents them.



Extreme Ownership

We take responsibility for outcomes, even when it’s uncomfortable. Problems are owned, not passed.



Thinker, Not a Box Checker

We value problem-solvers who think critically and use judgment, not people who simply complete tasks without understanding the “why.”



Humility

A willingness to learn, ask questions, accept feedback, and seek understanding over ego.



Key Responsibilities 

Managing day-to-day bookkeeping for real estate investors and franchise/service-based businesses.

Reconciling bank and credit card accounts.

Handling accounts payable/receivable recordings and payroll entries

Building and maintaining a clean chart of accounts.

Producing accurate monthly financial reports (delivered by the 15th/20th).

Collaborating with the manager and team through Slack and Double (Keeper).

Ensuring compliance with deadlines and bookkeeping best practices.

Participating in cleanups, catch-up work, and diagnostics when needed.

Handling Intercompany Loans, Due To/Due From, etc

Managing multiple entities within each QBO account



Client Communication

Maintain consistent, professional communication with clients through Double (Keeper)

Track and follow up on required client documentation and access

Clearly communicate status updates, issues, and next steps internally



Process & Documentation

Follow established bookkeeping workflows

Document issues, edge cases, and process improvements

Support ongoing refinement of bookkeeping SOPs



Ideal Candidate Profile

The ideal candidate:

Has foundational bookkeeping knowledge or training

Has experience with real estate investing bookkeeping

Is comfortable working through historical financial data

Can follow detailed processes while thinking critically when exceptions arise

Communicates clearly and professionally

Is organized, detail-oriented, and accountable for outcomes

Is open to feedback and continuous learning



Preferred Qualifications: 

Basic working knowledge of real estate investing or real estate bookkeeping

1–3 years of bookkeeping experience preferred; candidates with less experience will be considered if they demonstrate strong critical thinking, accuracy, and ownership

Bookkeeper Launch certification or equivalent training preferred (may substitute for experience)

Fluent in English with clear written and verbal communication skills

Detail-oriented with a strong focus on accuracy and follow-through

Generally available Monday–Friday during normal business hours with strong EST overlap

Able to work 100% remotely with a reliable laptop/computer, high-speed internet, smartphone, and a quiet workspace



Required Qualifications

QBO Pro Advisor

Google Workspace (Drive, Gmail, etc).

Preferred: Keeper (now called Double)

Slack 

         

Full-Time Benefits: 

Work from home

Flexible Paid Time Off

Free continued education

Eligible for bonuses

Annual Home Office Stipend  



Our Policy on AI Tools 

We recognize that AI and translation tools are widely used by virtual assistants and remote professionals. We believe in being clear about what is acceptable and what is not for this role and interview process:



? Allowed & Encouraged

Drafting, brainstorming, or improving written communication 
s, SOPs, checklists, documentation).

Checking grammar, spelling, or tone for clarity.

Speeding up repetitive tasks or improving efficiency.

Using captions or transcription tools to follow meetings.



?? Limited / Not a Fit

Relying on translation tools for all real-time communication in English. This role requires strong listening comprehension and verbal English without constant translation.

Submitting AI-generated work without editing or adding your own input.

Hiding the use of AI when asked about your process.



???? What to Expect in Hiring

Written and verbal responses will be analyzed for AI-only content.

Interviews will assess live comprehension (your ability to follow spoken English in real time).

Supportive tools are fine—but we need to know you can communicate clearly and independently when required.



How to Apply

Please apply using the following Google Form: 



Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the role is filled.

title: Video Editor
description:
About Us

We are a fast-paced whiskey company based in the United States of America. We are looking for a creative and talented video editor who wants to be part of our journey and grow with us long-term. If you have a passion for storytelling through video and love bringing raw footage to life, we want to hear from you.



Key Responsibilities

- Edit long-form vlog content from raw footage to a polished final product

Trim, cut, and arrange footage to create engaging and cohesive narratives

Add music, sound effects, voiceovers, and audio mixing as needed

Incorporate graphics, text overlays, transitions, and color grading

Collaborate with the team to ensure the final content aligns with our brand and vision

Manage and organize video files and assets

Meet deadlines consistently while maintaining high-quality output





Requirements



Proven experience editing long-form video content, vlogs, or similar formats

Proficiency in video editing software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve

Strong storytelling instincts — you know how to keep viewers engaged

Strong attention to detail, especially with pacing, audio, and visual consistency

Ability to take creative direction and implement feedback efficiently

Strong organizational skills for managing large video files and projects

Familiarity with AI video and editing tools is a big plus

Fluent in English, both written and verbal (a plus, not required)





What We Offer



A stable, long-term position with room to grow

Fully remote work

Creative freedom within brand guidelines

A collaborative and supportive team environment

The opportunity to be a key part of an exciting, growing company



Think you're the right fit? We'd love to see your work. Send us your portfolio and apply today!
