title: Cold Calling Specialist
description:
Real Estate Cold Calling Specialist



(Sales Role – Not Customer Support)



TYPE: Full-Time

LOCATION: Remote (EST hours)

HOURS: 40 hours/week

START: Immediate (within 7 days)



JOB OVERVIEW



This is a serious outbound SALES role, not call center work and not general VA work.

We are a U.S.-based real estate investment firm hiring full-time cold callers to generate motivated seller leads.



This role is NOT for:



– Call center reps

– Customer service agents

– Part-time callers

– Appointment setters

– Freelancers juggling multiple clients



WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:



– Full-time outbound cold calling experience (real estate is a plus, not required)

– Confident, persuasive, and professional phone skills

– Experience working with multi-line dialer systems and CRM platforms to track leads, notes, and follow-ups

– Strong work ethic and resilience

– Coachable mindset and long-term commitment

– Fluent English (accent OK, must be very clear)

– Quiet professional workspace

– High-quality headset + stable internet

– Full-time availability (Mon–Fri, 40 hrs/week, EST)

– High-volume outbound cold calling to property owners

– Follow proven scripts and objection handling

– Qualify motivated sellers

– Enter accurate notes, tags, and follow-ups into CRM

WHY JOIN US:



– Work directly with U.S. real estate investors (30+ years experience)

description:
We are seeking an experienced Team Lead – Portfolio Operations to oversee and manage a team of 4–5 Portfolio Managers handling a growing portfolio of short- and mid-term rental properties.



This is a leadership role focused on performance, structure, and scalability. You will ensure operational excellence, strong occupancy, and high guest satisfaction across the portfolio while building accountability within your team.



Key Responsibilities



Lead and coach 4–5 Portfolio Managers



Set and monitor KPIs (response time, occupancy, review scores, task completion)



Oversee escalations and complex guest situations



Ensure cleaning and maintenance workflows are planned and executed properly (Breezeway)



Monitor portfolio performance (Hostaway, calendar health)



Improve SOPs, processes, and automation systems



Provide regular performance reporting to leadership



Requirements



4+ years in STR / property management



2+ years in a leadership role



Experience with Hostaway, Breezeway NECESSARY



Experence with Hostbuddy is a plus!++



Strong operational, organizational, and conflict-resolution skills



KPI-driven and comfortable managing multiple buildings

title: Process & Workflow Specialist
description:
At Get Scaled, we’re more than a consulting firm; we’re a catalyst for transformation. Built by business owners for business owners, we empower small businesses to become great companies through consulting, accelerator programs, and accessible education. If you are a T.E.A.M player, we want you.



Who We Are



We are Get Scaled, a boutique consulting firm built by entrepreneurs, for entrepreneurs. Our passion lies in empowering small business owners to build the companies of their dreams.



Our Purpose



We transform small businesses into great companies.



Our Mission



Get Scaled is on a mission to bridge the gap between small businesses and corporate companies.



Our Values



T – Tenacity and Trust



We don’t stop. We will keep looking for the answers and solutions until we crack the problem. And we earn trust through making mistakes, learning from them and educating on them to help others avoid them.



E – Education and Excellence



We keep learning and leave egos at the door. We identify bottlenecks, weaknesses and areas that we want to improve, find the best and upskill. We aim for excellence in our own standards, delivery and results.



A – Ambition and Allegiance



We have big goals, and aren’t afraid to go after them. And our clients are the same. And we remain loyal to our clients, our team and stick it out until we get the result.



M – Management and Meaning



We take full ownership and execute tasks, end to end. Whatever is in our area of responsibility, we make sure it gets seen through to the result. We are building a community of strategists, to equip all business owners with the education, tools and resources to build the companies of their dreams.



Our Business Model



Consulting and Implementation Services (Done For You)

Accelerator Programs (Done With You)

Content and Education (Self-Paced)





Location: Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time | Morning Shift



Position Summary 



We are seeking a detail-oriented and confident Process and Workflow Specialist to join our team. This role is ideal for someone who excels in client-facing environments, has a strong grasp of process documentation, and can collaborate cross-functionally to meet project deadlines. The successful candidate will be instrumental in developing and maintaining clear, actionable Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and process workflows for both internal teams and clients. 



Responsibilities :



Client-Facing Tasks

title: Senior AWS DevOps Engineer – AWS Cost Optimization & Kubernetes
description:
Job Description:

About the Role

We're a blockchain/DeFi company running production infrastructure that's bleeding money unnecessarily. Our AWS bill is sitting at $4,500/month – and we know it shouldn't be anywhere near that. We need someone who can come in, audit the whole setup, and actually fix it. Not just give us a report that sits in a folder.



We've already been through a few candidates who talked a big game but couldn't execute. We're done with that. If you're the type who needs handholding or can't work independently, this isn't for you.





What You'll Actually Do

- Audit our entire AWS infrastructure and identify exactly where we're wasting money (we expect significant savings)

- Optimize our Kubernetes clusters – right-size nodes, fix resource requests/limits, implement autoscaling that actually works

- Implement cost controls: Reserved Instances, Savings Plans, spot instances where appropriate, and cleanup of orphaned resources

- Set up monitoring and alerts so costs don't creep back up without us knowing

- Document everything you do so the team can maintain it





Hard Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

- 3+ years hands-on Kubernetes experience in production environments – EKS specifically preferred

- Deep AWS knowledge: EC2, EKS, RDS, S3, CloudWatch, Cost Explorer, Trusted Advisor

- Proven track record of actually reducing AWS costs (be ready to share numbers/percentages)

- Strong scripting skills (Python, Bash) for automation

- Infrastructure as Code: Terraform or CloudFormation (Terraform preferred)

- Self-starter who can take ownership and execute without constant oversight





!!!!CRITICAL: This Role Requires Surgical Precision

This is production infrastructure running live systems. Think of this like surgery – one wrong move can take everything down.

- NO cowboy moves. You don't delete, modify, or remove anything without a clear plan first.

- Every change must be planned out, documented, and confirmed with the CEO before execution.

- Extreme attention to detail. You double-check and triple-check before touching anything.

- If you're not 100% sure what something does, you ask first. You don't assume.

- Methodical execution only. We value careful and correct over fast and reckless.





Strong Plus

- Experience with blockchain/Web3 infrastructure

- Karpenter, Cluster Autoscaler, or KEDA experience

-  AWS certifications (Solutions Architect, DevOps Engineer)

- Experience with FinOps tools (Kubecost, CloudHealth, 
)





What We Need In Your Application

Don't send a generic application. We will ignore it. Include:

- Specific examples of AWS cost optimization you've done – what was the setup, what did you change, what % did you save?

- Your Kubernetes experience – cluster sizes you've managed, scaling strategies you've implemented

- Your availability and timezone (we need someone who can overlap with US business hours for some calls)





Compensation & Structure

- $20-25/hour based on experience and proven results

- 20 hours/week to start – potential for more hours for the right person

- Fully remote

- Initial project: Comprehensive audit + implementation plan with clear cost reduction targets





If you're someone who can actually deliver results and not just talk about them – we want to hear from you. Show us what you've done.

title: Website Developer
description:
I am seeking a skilled web developer/designer to build a modern, high-performance website for a coaching business. The site must be clean, professional, and easy to use for both clients and administrators, with a strong focus on online scheduling, service presentation, and lead conversion.



The website should operate similarly in structure, flow, and functionality to a reference website I will provide, while maintaining original design and branding tailored to my business.



?



Core Objectives

• Present the coaching business professionally and credibly

• Allow clients to easily view services, book sessions, and manage bookings

• Reduce admin workload through automated scheduling and confirmations

• Be scalable as the business grows (additional services, staff, locations, etc.)



— have some inspiration to follow/be based off of.



?



Key Features & Functionality



1. Scheduling & Bookings

• Integrated booking system (e.g. Calendly, Acuity, Setmore, or custom-built)

• Clients can:

• View availability

• Book sessions (1-on-1, group, programs, PT sessions, etc.)

• make payments via the bookings page 

• Receive automated
 confirmations and reminders

• Admin can:

• Manage availability

• Block out times

• Edit or cancel bookings



2. Services & Programs

• Clear breakdown of coaching services offered

• Ability to list:

• Individual sessions

• Packages / programs

• School or club-based offerings

• Option to add pricing (or “enquire” buttons where appropriate)



3. Lead Generation & Contact

• Contact forms with enquiry routing

• Call-to-action buttons (Book Now / Enquire / Free Consultation)

• Integration with
 (Gmail, Outlook, or CRM if recommended)



4. Inspiration-Based Layout

• Website structure, flow, and UX inspired by a reference site I will supply

• Not a copy — but similar:

• Navigation style

• User journey

• Booking flow

• Open to developer input on best practices and improvements



* Would also like a QR code to direct clients to our booking page, for in person use and functionality. 





Needing this to be fulfilled in the coming fortnight. 



Thanks!

Monetize your network through three massive income streams: guaranteed ETH salary, instant token unlocks, and recurring commissions. We pay you to open doors you’ve already built, while we handle 100% of the closing.



Guaranteed Base Pay: You will receive $10/hour (capped at 10 hours/week),       for simply activating your network. 50% paid in Ethereum (ETH) for immediate cash and 50% in $GMI tokens, which are subject to an 18-month vesting schedule, building a long-term position in the $GMI mutli-chain ecosystem.



Performance Bonus: Every 5 successful partnership you close triggers an immediate unlock of 20% your vested tokens. This allows you to bypass the 18-month vesting period and access your earnings as soon as you deliver results.

Note: A "successful partnership" is defined by the project signing the LP Bonds integration agreement and going live on our marketplace.



Additional Commission:

-
/
 relationships with project founders or marketing heads

- Hunger to earn based on results, not hours





YOU DON’T NEED:

- To close deals (I handle that)

- Previous BD experience (connections matter more)

- Full-time commitment (work your own schedule)





THE ROLE:

Simply introduce me to decision-makers at crypto projects. I close the deals, you collect commissions. Every user from your partnerships who upgrades their bonds puts money in your pocket..

Example: ONE medium-sized launchpad partnership generating 100 L4 bonds = $8,000 for you.

 handle

We need partners who see the opportunity and want to run with it. Start earning within days of your first successful introduction!

title: Financial Controller / Senior Accounting Manager
description:
About Us:?



AbroadWorks is a fast growing global enterprise with established operations in the United States, India, and the Philippines. We specialize in providing both service-based solutions and advanced tech to help North American organizations in finding, onboarding, and managing global talent easily.



Our Offerings:



Global Staffing Services: Currently, the majority of our revenue is generated through our comprehensive global staffing services, which cater to the diverse needs of our clients.



Technology Solutions: Looking ahead, our strategic focus is to expand our footprint in the software sector, leveraging our technology to improve global human capital and talent management processes.



Job Title: Financial Controller / Senior Accounting Manager



Location: Fully Remote, Philippines



Salary: $7.00 - $9.00 per hour based on experience



Schedule: Monday to Friday, Easter Standard Time



Job Type: Full-Time



Job Description:



As a Financial Controller / Senior Accounting Manager, you will be responsible for bookkeeping ownership, monthly close, accounts payable, cash flow oversight, and financial integrity.



Requirements: 



Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance with 7+ years of progressive accounting experience.

Demonstrated ownership of monthly close, balance sheet integrity, accounts payable, and cash flow mechanics.

Strong experience with QuickBooks Online, including multi-entity environments, and advanced Excel skills such as PivotTables, SUMIFS, lookups, and reconciliation models.

Strong understanding of cash, accrual, and hybrid accounting methods, including timing differences, payment cycles, and internal controls.

Ability to operate independently with minimal direction.

Strong written and verbal communication skills for regular interaction with clients, client CPAs, and internal stakeholders.

Ability to exercise judgment in issue severity, escalation, and resolution.

Fully remote availability with Eastern Time working hours and a dedicated private workspace.





Preferred Qualifications:



Familiarity with Sage Intacct. CPA or equivalent certification.

Experience in professional services, healthcare, or multi-location environments.

Experience reviewing or overseeing other accountants or bookkeepers.

Proven ability to clean up inconsistent or poorly maintained books.

Comfort making judgment calls around timing, classification, and prioritization.



Responsibilities:



Post routine and non-routine accounting transactions for assigned clients\

Own end-to-end monthly close, including journal entries and reconciliations

Perform bank, credit card, loan, and balance sheet reconciliations

Ensure transactions are accurately coded, documented, and recorded at the source

Maintain audit trails and defensible balances

Ensure financials are GAAP-aligned, internally consistent, and analytically sound

Identify and correct historical errors, misclassifications, and structural issues

Maintain balance sheet integrity month over month

Own or oversee accounts payable processes, ensuring timeliness, accuracy, approval, and cash alignment

Monitor vendor balances, aging, and duplicate or erroneous payments

Improve AP workflows, documentation, and consistency

Maintain accurate cash flow visibility and support cash forecasting

Monitor timing differences, recurring versus non-recurring expenses, and liquidity risks

Flag cash flow risks, anomalies, and trends proactively

Review work produced by junior bookkeepers or analysts when applicable

Serve as final quality review before CFO review

Resolve routine issues independently and escalate material issues with context and recommendations

Enforce accounting standards, naming conventions, and close checklists

Serve as primary accounting contact for assigned clients

Communicate with clients, client CPAs, tax advisors, and internal teams

Explain accounting issues, close results, and cash movements in plain language

Coordinate with client CPAs on year-end, tax, and technical accounting matters

Improve efficiency, documentation, and repeatability across client books

Assist with clean-ups, client transitions, and onboarding

Work across QuickBooks Online, Xero, and supporting tools

Help standardize SOPs, templates, and internal workflows

Support variance explanations, trend analysis, and cash movement narratives

Ensure accounting outputs are decision-ready and presentation-ready



Successful candidates for this role are expected to possess the following attributes:??



Must have excellent English communication skills.

Has the ability to complete projects in a timely manner and quickly adjust to changing circumstances and embrace new technologies, processes, or methods.

Great logical and verbal reasoning skills.

Exceptionally detail-oriented.

Exceptional problem-solving and information-processing skills.

Ability to think outside the box.

A great work ethic and interest in learning new concepts and growing with the job.

Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.

Must have their own work device (preferably a desktop or laptop) and a stable internet connection.

Must be comfortable with using a time-tracking software for payroll purposes.

Must be willing to undergo a background verification check during the final stages of the hiring process.



Successful candidates for this role will be rewarded with the following benefits:



A total of five paid vacation days per year (additional days can be taken unpaid).

A 5% raise per year guaranteed (additional raises or bonuses may be given for outstanding performance).

A paid 15-minute break for every 4 hours of work.

Healthcare benefits after 2 months of full-time work.



* Vacation days increase by 1 vacation day per year. I.e. after one year of employment, the total paid vacation days on year 2 would be six, on year 3 seven, etc.



Our main focus is to build an energized and motivated workforce where our employees are happy and satisfied with their jobs and growth opportunities.



We are looking forward to making you a part of our team!



Thank you for your time and interest.

title: IMMEDIATE HIRE – Executive Assistant to CEO - Full Time (Long-Term)

title: Proposal Development Support Specialist – Talent Outreach & Acquisition
description:
About Us:?



AbroadWorks is a fast growing global enterprise with established operations in the United States, India, and the Philippines. We specialize in providing both service-based solutions and advanced tech to help North American organizations in finding, onboarding, and managing global talent easily.



Our Offerings:



Global Staffing Services: Currently, the majority of our revenue is generated through our comprehensive global staffing services, which cater to the diverse needs of our clients.



Technology Solutions: Looking ahead, our strategic focus is to expand our footprint in the software sector, leveraging our technology to improve global human capital and talent management processes.



Job Title: Proposal Development Support Specialist – Talent Outreach & Acquisition



Location: Fully Remote, Philippines



Salary: $5.00 - $8.00 per hour based on experience



Schedule: Monday to Friday, Eastern Standard Time



Job Type: Full-Time



Job Description:



As a Proposal Development Support Specialist focused on Talent Outreach and Acquisition, you will be responsible for talent sourcing and proposal development within consulting or professional services, focusing on identifying qualified consultants, managing CVs, and assisting proposal teams to meet client and donor requirements.



Requirements: 



Bachelor’s or MSc degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Management, International Development, or a related field.

Experience in recruitment, talent sourcing, or proposal development support within consulting or professional services.

Strong organizational skills with attention to detail. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work under tight deadlines and manage multiple concurrent proposals.



Preferred Qualifications:



Experience supporting consulting firm proposals or bids. Familiarity with donor-funded or client-driven proposal processes.

Experience working with short-term consultants and subject matter experts.

Knowledge of CV compliance standards for competitive bids.



Responsibilities:



Identify, source, and engage qualified local and international consultants aligned with proposal requirements.



Conduct proactive talent outreach to build and maintain a strong consultant pipeline.



Coordinate consultant availability, interest, and preliminary commitments for proposals.



Maintain relationships with subject matter experts across key technical areas.



Support proposal teams by providing required staffing inputs during proposal preparation.



Collect, review, and organize CVs, references, and supporting documentation.



Ensure CVs and personnel information comply with client, donor, and proposal guidelines.



Assist with CV formatting and customization to meet proposal specifications.



Work closely with proposal managers, technical leads, and HR teams.



Maintain and regularly update the firm’s consultant and talent database.



Track candidate engagement and proposal participation history.



Successful candidates for this role are expected to possess the following attributes:??



Must have excellent English communication skills.



Has the ability to complete projects in a timely manner and quickly adjust to changing circumstances and embrace new technologies, processes, or methods.



Great logical and verbal reasoning skills.



Exceptionally detail-oriented.



Exceptional problem-solving and information-processing skills.



Ability to think outside the box.



A great work ethic and interest in learning new concepts and growing with the job.



Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.



Must have their own work device (preferably a desktop or laptop) and a stable internet connection.



Must be comfortable with using a time-tracking software for payroll purposes.



Must be willing to undergo a background verification check during the final stages of the hiring process.







Successful candidates for this role will be rewarded with the following benefits:



A total of five paid vacation days per year (additional days can be taken unpaid).



A 5% raise per year guaranteed (additional raises or bonuses may be given for outstanding performance).



A paid 15-minute break for every 4 hours of work.



Healthcare benefits after 2 months of full-time work.



* Vacation days increase by 1 vacation day per year. I.e. after one year of employment, the total paid vacation days on year 2 would be six, on year 3 seven, etc.



Our main focus is to build an energized and motivated workforce where our employees are happy and satisfied with their jobs and growth opportunities.



We are looking forward to making you a part of our team!



Thank you for your time and interest.

title: AI Image Prompt Specialist
description:
Join a fast-growing platform focusing on AI chat and entertainment experiences. The platform across multiple apps collectively has over 3 million users with more joining each day



Overview



We're looking for someone with hands-on experience generating high-quality, realistic AI images using text-to-image tools. This is a prompting-focused role, not an engineering role. You'll be creating images, videos, and characters daily for our platform, so we need someone who already knows what works and what doesn't when it comes to getting great outputs from generative AI.



What You'll Do



Write and iterate on prompts to generate realistic, high-quality images across styles and use cases

Generate AI videos and character assets for our platform

Work with tools like Nano Banana Pro, z-image, and similar image generation platforms

Develop and maintain a library of proven prompts, styles, and workflows

Collaborate with the team on creative direction and visual output standards

Stay current with new models, tools, and prompting techniques as the space evolves



What We're Looking For



Demonstrated experience prompting AI image generators (share your portfolio or examples)

Strong understanding of what makes AI-generated images look realistic vs. artificial

Familiarity with prompt structure, negative prompts, style references, seed management, and parameter tuning

An eye for detail, especially around common AI artifacts (hands, faces, lighting, anatomy)

Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal oversight



Nice to Have



Experience with advanced workflows like ComfyUI, A1111, or similar node-based/local setups

Background in AI video generation tools

Understanding of LoRAs, ControlNet, in-painting, or image-to-image techniques

Photography or digital art background that informs your prompting instincts



This role is not a software engineering position, graphic design role (though design sense helps) or a theoretical role. We need someone who has actually generated thousands of images and knows the craft.



Website

nectar.ai



Send us a message through these channels:

title: Chief Financial Officer
description:
Role Title: Chief Financial Officer

Salary: $5,000/m





Job Overview:





We are seeking a strategic, results-driven Chief Financial Officer (CFO) to lead the financial operations of a high-growth, multi-entity investment and asset management firm. This executive will serve as a key member of the leadership team, responsible for driving financial strategy, ensuring compliance, optimizing performance, and enabling data-informed decision-making at the highest level.



The ideal candidate will have deep experience in financial planning and analysis, multi-entity and fund accounting, and real estate or private equity environments. Proficiency in NetSuite is required. You will be hands-on and detail-oriented while also contributing to long-term planning and financial leadership. This is an exciting opportunity to make a lasting impact in a fast-paced, innovative, and mission-driven organization.







Key Responsibilities:



Lead and oversee all financial functions, including accounting, FP&A, budgeting, reporting, audit, and compliance

Own monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reporting for leadership and stakeholders

Direct financial planning and cash flow forecasting across multiple entities and investment vehicles

Ensure timely, accurate month-end close, reconciliations, and internal controls

Partner closely with executive leadership on long-term financial strategy, fundraising, and capital planning

Oversee and continuously improve systems, processes, and automation to increase financial efficiency and insight

Coordinate with external auditors, legal, and tax professionals to maintain compliance with all regulatory requirements

Manage and mentor the finance team, fostering a high-performance and detail-oriented culture

Support due diligence, investor reporting, and fund performance analysis

Optimize the use of NetSuite and other systems to streamline reporting and decision-making





Qualifications:



- CPA or equivalent financial certification preferred

- Minimum of 5 years of experience in progressively senior finance roles, with at least 3 years in a CFO or VP of Finance capacity

- Strong experience in fund or real estate accounting, private equity, or asset management

- Proficiency in NetSuite is required

- Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Google Workspace, and CRM platforms such as HubSpot or Salesforce

- Proven track record in financial forecasting, budgeting, and strategic planning

- Exceptional analytical, organizational, and leadership skills

- Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities

- Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment with competing priorities

title: Industrial Acquisition Specialist
description:
The Industrial Acquisition Specialist is responsible for sourcing, evaluating, and executing industrial real estate acquisitions. This mid-senior level role focuses on building a strong deal pipeline through proactive broker and owner outreach while coordinating due diligence across internal teams. You will manage acquisition opportunities from initial review through closing in a fast-paced investment environment.



Success in this role requires strong organizational skills, consistent follow-through across multiple active deals, and the ability to collaborate effectively with underwriting, legal, finance, and asset management teams.



What You’ll Do:

• Source and track industrial acquisition opportunities through strategic broker and owner outreach

• Build and maintain strong relationships with brokers, sellers, and market participants to expand deal flow

• Screen deals and conduct preliminary property evaluations to identify viable investment opportunities

• Coordinate comprehensive due diligence activities across underwriting, legal, finance, and asset management

• Manage acquisition pipeline, milestones, and timelines using CRM systems

• Prepare detailed deal summaries, investment memos, and acquisition documentation

• Maintain consistent communication across all active transactions to ensure timely execution



What We’re Looking For:

• We’re seeking a proactive, persistent professional who thrives in fast-moving, evolving environments. The ideal candidate is • detail-oriented, process-driven, and accountable, with strong analytical thinking and sound judgment. You take ownership of your work and excel at relationship building and follow-through in dynamic investment settings.



Requirements:

• 3–5 years of experience in industrial real estate acquisitions

• Strong working knowledge of Bay Area industrial market dynamics

• Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution

• Clear, professional written and verbal communication skills

• Proficiency in CRM systems, Microsoft Excel, and standard business productivity tools

• Proven ability to manage multiple acquisition opportunities simultaneously with strong organization and follow-through

• Comprehensive understanding of real estate transaction processes and deal flow management

• Ability to independently coordinate cross-functional due diligence across underwriting, legal, finance, and asset management teams

title: Love Gaming? Come Dominate With Us
description:
Running operations here is a lot like dominating in Mobile Legends or Dota 2. You’ll need fast decision-making, clear team communication, and the ability to adapt when things don’t go as planned. If you love teamwork and keeping things in order, this role could be a great fit for you.

Time-zone: U.S. Central Time (CST)

Pay: $1100 USD / month



Role:

- Ensure our stores have the right amount of inventory in stock by placing the right orders

- Communicate effectively with on-the-ground teams by both phone and text to coordinate activities and facilitate operations

- Troubleshoot problems as they arise in operational processes

- Ensure accurate tracking of team hours and activities

- Hold tea
mbers accountable for their responsibilities and performance

- Contribute to the overall mission of improving the company and enhancing operational smoothness



Requirements:

- A smile on your face daily - let’s have some fun!

- Extremely high attention to detail and organizational skills

- Strong mathematical capabilities

title: Insurance Bookkeeper (Commissions & Reconciliation Focus)
description: We’re hiring a Insurance Accounting & Commission Analyst to manage the financial engine of a high-growth insurance brokerage. This leader will build and run our finance function end-to-end: carrier/IMO commission reconciliation, cash flow forecasting, budgeting, payroll/contractor payouts, reporting dashboards, and controls. The goal is simple: clean books, accurate comp, real-time visibility, and predictable cash.

title: Automotive Operations & Dispatch Coordinator
description:
Key Responsibilities

1. Fleet & Retail Ops Coordination

*Take retail calls

*Own the estimate-to-approval-to-route workflow:

**Create and submit estimates

**Follow up for approval

**Ensure parts are sourced

**Finalize tech routes for the following day

*Track all jobs in progress and flag issues proactively

*Ensure routes are realistic and efficient; confirm techs are prepped and ready

*Communicate clearly with customers and fleet managers about job timing, status, and follow-ups

*Submit and close out fleet approvals in Element, LeasePlan, and AutoIntegrate

*Ensure invoices match approvals; follow up on outstanding invoices and missing payments



2. Scheduling & Productivity Tracking

*Maintain the daily technician schedule, making updates as needed

*Monitor tech productivity; flag idle time, reschedules, or delays

*Track time logs and coordinate with bookkeeper for payroll



3. Customer Communication

*Respond to incoming calls,  texts, WhatsApp messages, and system inquiries in a timely, professional manner

*Follow up with clients as needed to resolve open issues or gather job-related info

*Escalate concerns appropriately and promptly



4. Admin & Reporting

*Submit a detailed Daily Recap covering completed work, pending tasks, blockers, and KPIs

*Keep Trello and other tools up-to-date with accurate job and task statuses

*Track inventory needs and coordinate ordering of parts, oil, and supplies

*Monitor A/R and follow up on past-due fleet invoices



5. Marketing & Content Support 

*Publish our monthly newsletter in MailChimp with content from marketing team

*Coordinate publishing of content to Instagram /
 / Google My Business

*Other light admin support as needed for the marketing team



What Success Looks Like

*All work orders, estimates, approvals, and tech routes are handled with zero dropped balls

*You identify blockers or problems before they become fires

*Communication is clear, timely, and professional — with both customers and internal team

*The business runs like a machine — nothing gets missed or delayed

*You take full ownership of your responsibilities and require very little follow-up



Who You Are

*A natural systems thinker who thrives on clarity, organization, and ownership

*Extremely proactive — you don’t wait to be told what to do

*Excellent at written and verbal English communication

*Comfortable in the automotive world and eager to learn the details

*Sharp and reliable — you retain info, spot gaps, and follow through



Experience & Skills Required

*3+ years of experience in a remote automotive: coordinator, dispatcher, operations role

*Demonstrated responsibility for keeping things moving without handholding

*Excellent written and spoken English

*Experience with dispatch, route planning, or technician scheduling

*Familiar with tools like Slack, Google Docs, Trello (or similar), CRM/invoicing platforms

*Experience working with U.S.-based field service, auto, or fleet companies

*Bonus: Familiarity with AutoIntegrate, Housecall Pro, Element, or LeasePlan platforms



Required Software Experience

*Slack

*WhatsApp

*Trello (or similar)

*Google Workspace

*CRM / invoicing tools (Housecall Pro, AutoIntegrate)

*
 (plus)



TECH REQUIREMENTS:

*Computer - at least i5 or equivalent with 8gb RAM

*Internet Speed - At least 50 MBPS Download speed

*Dual monitor setup is required to ensure efficiency in managing multiple applications simultaneously.



Location: Remote (Philippines)

Schedule: Full-time, US hours Monday to Friday (9:30 AM – 6:30 PM EST) / Tuesday to Saturday 10:30PM to 7:30 AM PHT 

Pay:  Php50K-75K monthly; we pay 13th month

title: Delivery Operations Assistant (Amazon)
description:

*Monitor active Cycle 1 routes in real time starting at 11:00 AM

*Support drivers with access issues, delivery problems, and route questions

, and returns accurately

title: Video Editor Needed - $800 TO $1200 per Month
description:
We are hiring a highly capable video editor who is experienced with both traditional editing and modern AI video tools.



This is not an entry-level position. We need someone fast, creative, and independent.



What We Need



You must have experience using AI video tools such as VEO3, Sora, Eleven Labs, and other generative AI software.



You must be able to craft strong edits from broad creative direction. We will not always give step-by-step instructions. You should be able to take an idea and turn it into a finished, engaging video.



You must be able to source footage from the internet when needed, work with footage we provide, and generate additional AI footage when necessary.



You must be experienced editing in multiple styles, including YouTube long-form videos, YouTube Shorts, UGC-style ads,
 ads, TikTok-style edits, and cinematic edits.



You must be able and willing to handle between 10 and 25 videos per week.



Compensation



Pay is $10 to $15 per completed edit depending on experience and skill level.



There will be consistent weekly workload and opportunity for long-term work if performance is strong.



Ideal Candidate



Understands pacing, retention, strong hooks, and engagement.



Can follow direction but also think creatively.



Works fast without sacrificing quality.



Understands modern internet culture and short-form trends.



Fluent in English.



How to Apply



Please include the following in your application:



Your portfolio (YouTube, TikTok, ads, etc.).



Examples of AI-generated footage you have created.



What editing software you use.



Your average turnaround time per video.



Your weekly availability.



Applications without a portfolio will not be reviewed.



We are looking for someone experienced with AI video editing who can handle high output and grow with us long-term.

title: Registered Nurse (RN) Virtual Assistant
description:
Sculpt Rx is a U.S.-based telehealth clinic specializing in GLP-1 weight management and wellness therapies. We provide concierge-level patient support with a strong focus on communication and personalized care.



We are seeking a licensed Registered Nurse to assist with administrative and patient support tasks.



Role Overview



This is a non-prescribing, non-diagnostic support role. You will assist with patient communication, documentation, and care coordination under U.S. clinical supervision.



Responsibilities



Respond to patient messages (non-clinical support & routing to U.S. based RN as needed

Track side effect reports using structured templates

Documentation in patient charts

Assist with SOP adherence and checklist workflows

Escalate urgent issues immediately



Requirements



Active Philippine RN license

Strong written English communication skills

Experience in telehealth, weight management, or virtual support a plus

Detail-oriented, highly organized, and responsive

Comfortable working with EMRs, Google Sheets, and Slack



Reliable internet

Ability to overlap with U.S. Pacific Time for at least 3–4 hours/day



 Schedule



Part-time hours (10–20 hours per week to start), possibility of moving into a full time role as the company expands

Availability during U.S. PST business hours required (preferably between 11am - 3pm PST)



Compensation



$5.50/hour USD

Paid 2x a month

Performance-based increases possible after 90 days



Ideal Candidate



Proactive communicator

Strong critical-thinking skills

Comfortable following structured clinical protocols

Understands the importance of HIPAA and patient confidentiality

title: Shopify Web Developer - CRO Specialist - Ecommerce Advertising Agency - Full Time 3b
description:
APPLY ON MY WEBSITE TO BE CONSIDERED: 





CRO Shopify Web Developer – Job Overview

I am looking for an experienced shopify web developer to help me upgrade client’s checkout processes and execute CRO tests for various ecommerce brands.

In this role you will update Shopify theme templates, develop landing pages using various page builders and html/CSS frameworks, research/install various checkout/bundle applications, and implement A/B tests using testing tools like intelligems.

You will also report on test performance, and provide suggestions for next steps.

This is a full-time opportunity. Training will be provided and you will work directly with me.



About Zack Miller

My name is Zack Miller, and I’ve been a DTC Ecommerce Growth Marketer since 2019. I’ve done everything fro
dia buying and client strategy, to agency internal operations.

I’ve contributed to the growth of over 200 ecommerce brands in my agency experience. Now, as an independent growth marketing partner, I work closely with a small number of brands on their new customer acquisition strategy.



Note: All Remote Employees Must Be Available To Work During The Following Business Hours:

Monday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Tuesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Wednesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Thursday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Friday: 9am – 5:30pm EST



Roles & Responsibilities

- Develop landing pages using Figma and various WYSYWIG editors including but not limited to Replo and Pagefly.

- Edit product, collection and other page templates using Shopify Liquid template engine, and various HTML/CSS frameworks.

- Install various checkout/tracking applications (aftersell, Zipify OCU, Upstack, etc)

- Install various applications for product bundling when needed, and create product bundles. 

- Install tracking pixels on client’s websites

- Implement A/B tests in intelligems for product price tests, shipping price tests, theme tests, landing page tests, and more. 

- Research new ideas for direct response content marketing strategies.

- Work in my project management system, ClickUp.

- Apply a process-first mentality and provide feedback to help further develop our operating systems.



Required Experience & Education

- Strong verbal and written English language skills (American Dialect)

- Strong knowledge of HTML/CSS/Javascript/Shopify Liquid required. 

- Knowledge of Python and Ruby preferred but not required.

- 1+ years of web development (Shopify) experience required

- 1+ years of backend python (flask/django) development experience preferred but not required

- 1+ years of marketing agency experience preferred but not required

- Must be highly organized and possess strong attention to detail

- All applicants are encouraged to apply, regardless of experience or education



APPLY ON MY WEBSITE TO BE CONSIDERED:

title: Cold Calling Sales Representative (Real Estate Websites + IDX)
description:
Cold Calling/
 Marketing Sales Representative (Real Estate Websites + IDX)





About Us



We are a real estate agent website and IDX (this is a real estate search system built into the websites) software company. company serving real estate agents with high-performance websites and IDX home search systems built to drive leads and grow their business. 



Please look at our site before applying or right after: Our company is 
 



We are hiring an experienced Cold Calling Sales Representative to contact licensed U.S. real estate agents and sell them our real estate website + IDX products.



Position Overview



You will be responsible for outbound calls to potential customers from a provided list. Your goal is to sell and close on the first call whenever possible. If an immediate close isn’t achievable, you will schedule and conduct a Zoom demo appointment with the prospect, demo the product, and close the sale.



This role requires strong sales skills, professionalism, persistence, and clear communication.



Key Responsibilities



Outbound Sales + Calling

• Make outbound cold calls to U.S. real estate agents from provided lists

• Present product features, benefits, and pricing clearly

• Aim to sell and complete the checkout on the first call (preferred)

• If not possible to close immediately, set and conduct Zoom demos

• Walk prospects through the checkout process during or after demo

• Overcome objections with confidence and professionalism



CRM / Lead Tracking

• Track all calls, results, and outreach activity in a spreadsheet or CRM

• Update prospect status daily

• Record follow-up tasks and next action steps

• We will use a Google Sheet or 
 as the CRM.



 Marketing Follow-Up

You are responsible for executing or triggering appropriate
 follow-up sequences for:



Never took the demo



Took demo but didn’t buy



Took demo and backed out at checkout cart



Did the checkout and then canceled right away



Routine follow-up for passive leads (no action)



You will be provided
 templates and sequences to follow or implement through 
 (preferred) or
 + spreadsheet workflow if a CRM is unavailable.



Follow-Up Best Practices

• Send follow-ups according to sequence timing

• Personalize when possible (first name, office name, key objections)

• Track opens, replies, and next steps in CRM or sheet

• Move prospects through pipeline stages accurately



Compensation



• $4/hour starting rate

• 20–40 hours per week

• $40 commission per sale (after two successful customer payments)

• Commission paid 30 days after the sale closes



High performers will benefit from consistent commission revenue. We would like you to sell at least 1.5 to 2 sites/IDX per day. 



Requirements



• Proven cold calling or outbound sales experience

• Comfortable selling to U.S. professionals (real estate agents, brokers)

• Strong spoken and written English skills

• Confident conducting Zoom demos with screen share

• Reliable internet (25 Mbps minimum recommended)

• Organized work habits and CRM discipline

• Ability to stay motivated and handle rejection



Preferred Qualifications



• Experience selling SaaS, websites, software, or digital services

• Experience selling to real estate agents

• Experience using 
 or similar CRM (HubSpot, Pipedrive, Zoho, Salesforce)

• Experience writing or executing
 follow-up sequences

 + chat required)

Schedule & Role Type

How to Apply (Required)

Please include all items below in one message:

 

 1) Short Video Intro (2-3 minutes)

 If you’re fast, thoughtful, and care about helping people through difficult skin

title: Full-Time Next.js Developer -- Full-Stack (Backend-Heavy)
description:
$600 USD / month | 40 hrs/week | Long-term



I'm hiring a full-time, long-term developer to join my web agency. Right now, the primary focus is a client project built on Next.js + Prismic, but this role will evolve into supporting multiple client projects across a wide variety of tech stacks -- from custom React apps to WordPress themes to even content management on occasion. Flexibility and a genuine curiosity for learning new tools matter more here than checking every box.



This is not a passive maintenance role. You'll be solving real problems, building real features, and thinking through architecture decisions with me.





WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING



Primary (first several months)

- Building and maintaining features on an active Next.js + Prismic client project

- Backend work: APIs, data modeling, database queries, server-side logic

- Debugging, refactoring, and improving existing code

- Communicating updates and blockers clearly and proactively



Ongoing / Expanding

- Supporting multiple client projects across varied stacks

- Picking up new tools and frameworks as client needs demand

- Contributing to internal tooling and agency workflows





YOU SHOULD KNOW YOUR WAY AROUND



- Next.js (this is the core requirement)

- Backend fundamentals: REST APIs, GraphQL

- Databases: PostgreSQL, MySQL, and/or Supabase

- Headless CMS platforms (Prismic, Contentful, Sanity, or similar)

- Git & GitHub

- Deployment (e.g. Vercel, AWS)

- Bonuses: TypeScript, Tailwind CSS



Beyond the list, what matters most is how you think. Can you read unfamiliar code and reason through it? Can you debug methodically? Do you understand what's actually happening under the hood when software runs? That's what we're hiring for.





YOU'RE A GREAT FIT IF YOU



- Have a solid grasp of how computers and software actually work -- not just syntax

- Are a strong problem-solver who can work through an issue independently before asking for help

- Communicate clearly in written English (you'll occasionally interact with clients)

- Are early in your career but hungry -- fresh grads with strong fundamentals are very welcome

- Adapt quickly to new tools, stacks, and client contexts

- Are open to using and learning AI tools to work faster and smarter (training provided)





TOOLS YOU'LL ENCOUNTER



Next.js, Prismic, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Supabase, GraphQL, REST, Git, GitHub, Vercel, Asana, Slack, Google Workspace, ChatGPT





SCHEDULE & PAY



- $600 USD / month

- 40 hours per week

- Initial schedule: 9 AM - 5 PM MST (11 PM - 7 AM PH time) for the first 12 weeks, then we'll evaluate flexibility together

- Weekly pay for the first 60 days

- 13th month pay

- Paid time off + Philippine holidays





HOW TO APPLY



Use this subject line exactly: NXTJS-HZLZ -- Your Name



Include:

1. A short paragraph explaining why you're a strong fit -- describe your experience, don't just list it

2. A screenshot from speedtest.net

3. Confirmation you can work the required hours

4. 1-2 examples of projects you've built or contributed to (GitHub links, live URLs, or descriptions)

5. Your resume

6. Use 6 Apply Points

7. Your favorite TV show as a kid



Do not contact me via direct e-mail, LinkedIn, or any other method outside of Onlinejobs.ph or you will be immediately disqualified. 



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be reviewed.

title: Operations Analyst (Due Diligence and Finance)
description:
About Us:

We are a growing U.S.-based real estate company seeking a detail-oriented Operations Analyst to support finance and due diligence across multiple properties and LLCs. This role focuses on financial analysis, data review, and operational support, including assisting with transaction due diligence, financial reporting, reconciliations, and cross-functional coordination to support informed investment and operational decisions.



Driven by the Entrepreneurial Operating System (EOS), we operate with speed, accountability, and teamwork. Our goal is bold and clear: to grow to $1 billion in assets under management while building a team of hands-on, high-integrity leaders who love turning potential into performance.



We live by principles of Extreme Ownership, Perpetual Growth, and Building the Whole Human because we believe great companies are built by great people who care about what they build and who they build it with.



The Role:

As an Operations Analyst, you will play a critical role at the intersection of operations, finance, and logistics, helping keep our growing portfolio of commercial properties running smoothly. You will actively support and enhance the Finance and Due Diligence function by identifying gaps, connecting details, and driving tasks forward.



This is an entry-level analyst role ideal for someone who is highly analytical, proactive, and comfortable taking ownership. You should be able to interpret details, anticipate next steps, and execute with minimal supervision, contributing meaningfully to operational efficiency and informed decision-making across the organization.



The position requires strong English communication skills, excellent attention to detail, and the ability to execute without constant oversight. You will focus on doing, following up, creating controls, and sourcing information to keep our operations moving fast and accurately.



Key Responsibilities:

Execute and manage recurring operational workflows across due diligence and finance operations

Follow SOPs while identifying gaps, improving processes, and driving tasks to completion

Track action items, follow up with internal teams and external stakeholders, and ensure closure

Create and maintain controls to prevent errors, missing documents, and process breakdowns

Source and validate data needed for decision-making, reporting, and due diligence

Gather hard-to-find information by contacting vendors, municipalities, tax offices, and other parties

Maintain logs, and keep systems organized and audit-ready.

Support AP and AR operations as needed, including documentation, compliance, vendor coordination, and tracking

Work USA time zone, EST



Required Qualifications:

1+ year of experience in accounting, finance, operations, or related fields (real estate preferred)

Strong understanding of real estate basics (CapEx vs OpEx, property-level tracking, multiple LLCs)

Strong Excel or Google Sheets skills

Clear written and spoken English

Highly organized, reliable, proactive, and responsive in a remote environment



Preferred Qualifications:

Real estate portfolio operations experience (commercial, multifamily, or property management)

Experience with AP and property management platforms (AppFolio, PayEm, 
, etc.)

Experience supporting documentation requests and working with CPAs



Screening Process:

Candidates must submit a short video (1 to 3 minutes) introducing themselves in English so we can evaluate communication skills. They must also complete a DISC assessment. After a brief screening, selected candidates will receive a small test project to assess execution, follow-up ability, and comfort with real estate operations and finance workflows.

description:
At Rise Up Kings, we empower men to reach their full potential in faith, family, fitness, and finance. Behind the scenes, we run world-class systems to ensure our events, digital presence, and customer experience operate at the highest level. We are seeking an experienced GHL Website Builder who thrives in a fast-paced, high-excellence environment and is passionate about building funnels that drive growth and impact.



ROLE OVERVIEW

This project-based role is ideal for a tech-savvy professional with a strong background in website design, funnel optimization, and conversion tracking. You’ll play a vital role in ensuring seamless integration across CRM platforms, websites, automations, and in-person event technology. From building GHL funnels and workflows to setting up product launches and automations, your work will directly support our mission and help deliver a flawless experience for our clients.



The right candidate is both strategic and detail-oriented—someone who embraces diverse technical responsibilities with excellence and precision. Every task, big or small, contributes to the success of our mission, and we’re looking for someone who takes ownership of that responsibility.



This is a part-time, project based role requiring availability from 9 AM to 5 PM CDT, including participation in video calls for team collaboration. For the right individual, there is opportunity to expand to full-time work.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

- Design on-brand, eye-catching websites, landing pages and funnels optimized for conversion.

- Provide guidance and strategy around layout and structure to increase conversions.

- Troubleshoot and resolve CRM, website, and hosting challenges quickly and effectively.

- Maintain the accuracy, integrity, and organization of CRM data.

- Streamline, optimize, and maintain CRM workflows, funnels, and web pages.

- Build and test opt-in pages,
 sequences, tagging, backend CRM tasks, and pixel placements.

- Manage tasks and communication clearly through Asana and team collaboration tools.

title: Human Resources
description:
Description of Services

The Contractor will provide HR operational support with a primary focus on managing and coordinating the employee onboarding process. The role ensures that new hires are effectively integrated into the organization through structured preparation, documentation management, system setup, and cross-functional coordination.



The Contractor will work collaboratively with Talent Acquisition and relevant department stakeholders to ensure onboarding processes are executed smoothly, professionally, and in alignment with company standards.



The Contractor will be responsible for the coordination and execution of employee onboarding and related HR operational tasks. Responsibilities include:



- Managing the end-to-end onboarding process for new hires

- Coordinating start dates, documentation, and internal communications

- Preparing and distributing onboarding materials and welcome documentation

- Ensuring all required contracts, forms, and compliance documents are completed and properly stored

- Setting up internal systems, tools, and access for new tea
mbers

- Creating and organizing communication channels (e.g., chat platforms, shared folders, documentation hubs)

- Updating and maintaining accurate employee records in internal systems

- Coordinating with Talent Acquisition and department leads to ensure onboarding readiness

- Addressing onboarding-related questions from new hires in a timely and professional manner

- Supporting continuous improvement of onboarding processes and documentation

- Maintaining confidentiality and handling sensitive employee information with discretion

- Being available during CET business hours for onboarding coordination

title: Graphic designer cum Video Editor
description:
Application Instructions:

Read carefully and apply only if you meet the criteria. This position is for candidates aged 26-35 willing to work a Night Shift to align with the US Eastern Time Zone. Attach a detailed CV and relevant work. Previous experience with E-Commerce brands is preferred.



Company Overview:

Decozen, a leading US E-Commerce company, specializes in high-quality Home Decorative Accessories. Our website, 
, provides exceptional products and enhances customer experience. Join our dynamic team in online retail and multimedia content.



Position Summary:

We seek a skilled and creative Amazon E-commerce Graphic Designer cum Video Editor with expertise in designing, producing, and editing multimedia content for Amazon and other e-commerce platforms.



Key Qualifications:

- Bachelor’s degree in Multimedia and Graphic Design.

etings, WhatsApp, Dropbox, and Hub staff.

- Study competitors’ media strategies to outperform them.

- Upload final creatives to e-commerce platforms and ensure they meet specifications.

- Positive, proactive personality.

- Organized with sharp attention to detail.

- Excellent time management and deadline-meeting skills.

Other Requirements:

- Professional, quiet work environment with backup solutions.

- Reliable desktop/laptop with Windows or iOS OS.

Working Conditions:

- Night shift required to match US Eastern Standard Time.



This role suits a dynamic professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment and wants to significantly contribute to a growing e-commerce business. We look forward to your skills and expertise driving our Amazon presence.

title: Do you love making people feel cared for? Support our CEOs as an Executive Personal Assistant!
description:
Do you love making people feel cared for? Are you the one who remembers everyone’s birthdays, plans amazing gatherings, makes fun plans, and brings warmth into the lives of those around you?



This is NOT your typical assistant job. It’s deeply personal. You’ll work with a kind but intense U.S.-based pair of brothers (proven entrepreneurs working as Co-CEOs of the same business) to support their lives, not the company they are building. From keeping friendships alive and planning meaningful experiences to sending thoughtful gifts and helping them stay on track with personal goals, you’ll be part organizer, part cheerleader, part coach. If you’ve ever been called the “mom” of your group and you’re looking for a decades-long position, this might be your dream job.



Your Role

- Build trust by executing on tasks and communicating clearly, which will lead to taking on more responsibility, which will then lead to increases in pay.

- Keep relationships thriving by managing a personal CRM and helping stay in touch with friends and family.

- Use technology to help automate certain tasks that are repetitive.

- Track habits, support routines, and act as an accountability partner for personal goals.

- Pick out thoughtful, creative gifts for birthdays and other special 
nts.

- Research products, tools, and ideas to make life easier, better, or more fun.

- Plan and book unforgettable travel, great hotels, and the perfect dinner spots.

- Jump in on special personal projects wherever a helping hand is needed.



What’s In It for You

- A Long-Term Role: This is meant to last. The entrepreneurs who you'd be an assistant to are looking for a lifetime assistant.

- Great Place to Work: These entrepreneurs are known to have a super high retention rate of employees and create a great work environment.

- Creative Work: From planning memorable trips to picking out the perfect gift, this role lets you flex your creative muscles and thoughtful side every day.

- Variety: No two days will feel the same. You’ll get to research, plan, coach, organize, and more.

- Paid Leave: You'll get at least 10 days of paid leave plus major holidays.

- Remote Flexibility: Work from the comfort of your home and gain flexibility with hours once trust is built.



Desired Attributes

- Extremely caring, social people-person who will excel in personal tasks

- High attention to detail and organizational skills

- Very strong written and oral English skills

- Minimum 50 Mbps Internet Speed

- Designated office space in your home



To apply and ensure your application is considered, do all of the following two steps:

1. DM with a quick introduction to yourself if you're interested. Include the word "cupcake" *in your subject line*, and Include your resume. ++Bonus points for a video introduction, though it's not strictly required

2. Fill out this form:

3. Add the Letters "PA" in the "What's your full name" field [E.g. PA - John Doe], so we know what role you are applying for.

title: Remote Medical Billing Specialist
description:
About Us:?



AbroadWorks is a fast growing global enterprise with established operations in the United States, India, and the Philippines. We specialize in providing both service-based solutions and advanced tech to help North American organizations in finding, onboarding, and managing global talent easily.



Our Offerings:



Global Staffing Services: Currently, the majority of our revenue is generated through our comprehensive global staffing services, which cater to the diverse needs of our clients.



Technology Solutions: Looking ahead, our strategic focus is to expand our footprint in the software sector, leveraging our technology to improve global human capital and talent management processes.



Job Title: Medical Billing Specialist



Location: Fully Remote, Philippines



Salary: $3.00 - $4.00 per hour based on experience



Schedule: Monday to Friday, Eastern Standard Time



Job Type: Full-Time



Job Description:



As a Medical Billing Specialist, you will be focusing on optimizing billing, claims, and payment processes for home care agencies using the client's software.







Requirements: 



1 – 3 years of experience in medical billing, preferably with Medicare, Medicaid, and HMOs.

Proficiency in EHR/EMR platforms and Microsoft Excel.

Strong analytical abilities.

Attention to detail, ability to work independently, and strong organizational skills.

Preference:



A Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Accounting, or Healthcare Management is preferred.



Responsibilities:



Manage weekly Medicaid claim submissions to required portals.

Resolve rejected or denied claims and conduct follow-ups.

Analyze cash postings, reconcile credit balances, and manage aging reports.

Utilize software to automate and streamline billing and payroll tasks.

Act as a liaison between the agency and payers and ensure compliance with regulations.

Successful candidates for this role are expected to possess the following attributes:??



Must have excellent English communication skills.



Has the ability to complete projects in a timely manner and quickly adjust to changing circumstances and embrace new technologies, processes, or methods.



Great logical and verbal reasoning skills.



Exceptionally detail-oriented.



Exceptional problem-solving and information-processing skills.



Ability to think outside the box.



A great work ethic and interest in learning new concepts and growing with the job.



Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.



Must have their own work device (preferably a desktop or laptop) and a stable internet connection.



Must be comfortable with using a time-tracking software for payroll purposes.



Must be willing to undergo a background verification check during the final stages of the hiring process.



Successful candidates for this role will be rewarded with the following benefits:



A total of five paid vacation days per year (additional days can be taken unpaid).



A 5% raise per year guaranteed (additional raises or bonuses may be given for outstanding performance).



A paid 15-minute break for every 4 hours of work.



Healthcare benefits after 2 months of full-time work.







* Vacation days increase by 1 vacation day per year. I.e. after one year of employment, the total paid vacation days on year 2 would be six, on year 3 seven, etc.



Our main focus is to build an energized and motivated workforce where our employees are happy and satisfied with their jobs and growth opportunities.



We are looking forward to making you a part of our team!



Thank you for your time and interest.

Dreambound Inc. is a platform dedicated to facilitating upward mobility in America. Our mission is to help prospective students find the right educational programs across Healthcare, Technology, Business, and Trade and Industry so they can achieve their career goals. We connect students with 300+ schools, offer personalized coaching, and provide the support needed to take charge of their future. We are a fast-paced, mission-driven team committed to making education accessible and impactful.





The Opportunity

We are seeking a highly organized, experienced, and versatile General Virtual Assistant (VA) to join our team.

This role is best suited for a seasoned professional who thrives in dynamic environments, can manage multiple priorities independently, and brings a strong track record of administrative and operational support. You should be a proactive self-starter with excellent organizational skills, high accuracy, and the ability to quickly learn and adapt to new tools and systems.





This is a full-time, long-term role (40 hours per week).

Please use the code DreamTeam when applying through the link below.





Key Responsibilities

- Provide administrative and organizational support across multiple teams and stakeholders.

- Handle evolving assignments and projects with minimal supervision.

- Anticipate needs, take initiative, and contribute to process improvement and problem-solving.

- Conduct internet research and data collection to support strategic initiatives.

- Maintain accurate and organized records in internal databases and spreadsheets.

- Support tasks related to lead generation, demand generation, and basic SEO maintenance.





Requirements

- Full-time availability (40 hours per week) with no other work commitments.

- Ability to work during Philippine day shift hours.

- Exceptional attention to detail and ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment.

- High level of autonomy, accountability, and problem-solving skills.

- Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.

- Comfortable working with spreadsheets, databases, and productivity tools.





Highly Valued



- Experience with Demand Generation or Marketing Operations workflows.

- Familiarity with SaaS tools, technical workflows, or basic troubleshooting.

- Experience using CRM platforms and automation tools

- Advanced spreadsheet skills (VLOOKUP, QUERY, INDEX/MATCH, automation workflows).

- SEO experience, including basic on-page optimization, keyword research, content updates, and maintaining SEO best practices across pages or databases.

- AI-forward mindset and experience, including working with AI tools to improve efficiency, research quality, documentation, automation, or operational workflows. Comfort experimenting with new AI tools and integrating them into day-to-day work is a strong plus.





Apply

title: Project Manager/Executive Assistant
description:
## About VoarVue



VoarVue is a premiu
dia company producing cinematic, results-driven video and photo content for brands in real estate, marine, construction, and lifestyle industries. We don’t just create visuals — we run a full creative system, including strategy, direction, post-production, and distribution.



Our projects are structured, supported, and intentional. Clients know what to expect. Teams know what to deliver. Nothing moves forward without clarity.



If you value quality, consistency, and professional execution, you’ll fit right in.



## The Opportunity: Project Manager / Client Success Manager



We’re seeking a Project Manager / Client Success Manager who can confidently own delivery, timelines, and client communication across all active projects.



This role is for someone who is highly organized, calm under pressure, and naturally proactive. You enjoy keeping moving parts aligned, clients informed, and teams focused. You don’t wait for problems to appear — you anticipate them and handle them early.



You’ll be the primary point of contact for clients, managing expectations, organizing feedback, and protecting scope. You understand that great client experience isn’t about over-promising — it’s about clarity, consistency, and follow-through.



This is an ownership role, not an assistant role. You are trusted to run day-to-day operations so leadership can stay focused on vision, quality, and growth.



This position begins as a contract role, with a clear path to a long-term, full-time position for the right person.



## What You’ll Be Doing



### Project Management & Delivery



- Own all project timelines from kickoff through final delivery

- Schedule shoots and coordinate logistics

- Assign editors and track progress

- Track deliverables across all active clients

- Ensure deadlines are met without leadership intervention

- Send deliverables and manage approvals

- Manage revision rounds and keep feedback clean and actionable



### Client Communication & Success



- Serve as the primary point of contact for assigned clients

- Respond to client messages same day

- Set expectations around timelines, scope, and revisions

- Filter and translate client feedback for the creative team

- Push back professionally on scope creep once trust is established

- Maintain strong, long-term client relationships



### Onboarding & Account Setup



- Lead client onboarding

- Set up client portals and project spaces

- Collect assets, brand references, and required information

- Ensure projects are fully prepared before production begins



### Systems, Tracking & Reporting



- Maintain organized project documentation

- Track project status and flag risks early

- Send analytics and performance updates when required

- Ensure workflows and standards are followed consistently



## What This Role Is *Not*



To be very clear, this role does not include:



- Video or photo editing

- Content creation

- Social media posting

- Creative ideation or concept development

- Final creative approval (initially)

- Sales or lead generation



We handle all of that.



## What We’re Looking For



- Proven experience in project management, account management, or client success

- Strong written and verbal communication skills

- An operational mindset — you’re comfortable with systems, workflows, and deadlines

- Experience working with creative or media teams is a strong plus

- Confidence guiding client conversations and setting expectations

- High attention to detail and follow-through

- Reliable, accountable, and organized



## What You’ll Gain at VoarVue



- Clear Ownership: You’re empowered to run delivery and communication

Freelance Illustrator/Artist

You must be able to work on a team because several illustrators will be drawing the same characters in different settings therefore our illustrators must be able to duplicate the style and look for our characters. title: Meta & Google Paid Marketing Assistant
description:
Looking for a FT Meta & Google Paid Marketing Assistant.



You should have:



3–5+ years hands-on managing Meta + Google ads for DTC/ecommerce brands (Shopify preferred) across the US, Australia, Canada, and/or UK markets



Proven track record owning full-funnel performance.



Strong operational chops: builds and maintains clean account structure, naming conventions, reporting dashboards, and weekly insights with clear actions (not just data)



Deep platform fluency: Meta (ASC, CAPI, pixel hygiene, A/B testing) + Google (Search, Shopping/PMax, brand vs non-brand, feed basics, query sculpting)



Must be able to work EST hours (NY based team)

title: Meta Media Buyer
description:
We are looking for a Media Buyer & Creative Strategist who truly understands how to scale DTC brands profitably. You’ve either worked in-house at a startup or at an agency managing DTC client accounts—and you know how to build campaigns from the ground up.



This role blends performance and creativity. You’ll be setting up campaigns, testing hypotheses, and also mocking up ad concepts in Canva or CapCut to show how you’d bring ideas to life. You’ll help shape what “profitable growth” looks like across early-stage DTC brands by pairing data with insight and creativity.



What You’ll Do

* Set up, manage, and optimize paid campaigns across Meta, Google, TikTok, and other key platforms.

* Create and test new ad concepts—using Canva, CapCut, or similar tools to mock up static and short-form video ads.

* Monitor creative performance, extract insights, and refine messaging, hooks, and formats to improve ROAS, CAC, and MER.

* Build clean account structures, tracking (pixel/CAPI), and reporting dashboards.



Who You Are

* You’ve managed paid media for DTC brands (in-house or agency side) and understand how to scale efficiently.

* You can start from zero—creating the ad account, structuring the campaigns, and iterating to scale profitably.

* You have hands-on creative skills and an eye for what converts—comfortable editing short-form content, mocking up ads, and testing ideas fast.

* You balance analytical thinking with creative intuition. You can read the numbers but also understand the story behind them.

* You’re proactive, independent, and thrive in flexible, fast-moving environments.



Role Details

* Part-time (flexible hours)

* $5-7 USD per hour

* Must have DTC experience, do not apply if you do not have applicable media buying experience with Meta and Google.
