title: Telemarketer for Medical Practice
description:
About This Job:  

OptiMindHealth is a mental health and wellness counseling company. We are a group of doctors, psychologists, and clinical social workers committed to improving the psychological health and wellbeing of our patients. We are supported by a hard-working and devoted staff who help us in all aspects of practice operations. We are looking for an energetic, articulate, and highly driven telemarketer who can represent our company to current and potential clients and referral partners. This role blends high?volume outbound calling, virtual community outreach, and service promotion, all done from a remote environment. 



This position is an excellent opportunity for candidates with experience in BPO, outbound calling, sales, appointment setting, practice liaison/healthcare B2B engagement, or executive recruitment who are looking to advance their career in a meaningful and mission?driven environment. We are seeking individuals with excellent English communication skills with a clear, professional, and confident speaking voice, who can represent our practice with warmth and credibility. A Bachelor’s degree in Communications or a related field is preferred and will help you excel in this role. 



Healthcare experience is a plus, but not required. We invest in our team by providing comprehensive training, ongoing support, and the tools needed to succeed. If you are proactive, motivated, and passionate about educating and connecting with people, this role offers a rewarding opportunity to grow professionally while making a positive impact on our patients and community referral partners. 



Key Responsibilities:  

- Promote the company’s services to prospective and established clients.  

- Develop relationships to promote our services to referral sources.  

- Engage and qualify prospects through insightful, sales-focused conversations.  

- Maintain strong relationships with organizations, schools, healthcare providers, and other established referral sources.  

- Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of sales activities and make recommendations for improvement.  

- Act as a liaison between the practice and the community by being a practice service line knowledge bearer.  

- Maintain practice CRM, tracking contacts and incoming referral activity. 

- Collaborate with our Management Team to ensure consistent messaging and branding in outbound sales efforts. 



 Salary and Work Setup: 

The position is a permanent work from home arrangement, with additional details below. 

 

1. Base Salary: 45,000 PHP Monthly 

2. Commission-Based: No 

3. Payment Method: Twice Per Month 

4. Work Schedule: US Business Hours; Full-Time; 40 hours per week (No part-time) 

 

Benefits Package: 

Working at OptiMindHealth provides a stable work environment for staff members who excel and grow in their careers. Our benefits package includes: 

 

1. Government-mandated benefits (SSS, Pag-Ibig, PHIC) 

2. 13th Month Pay 

3. HMO Coverage 

4. Ten days of vacation per year 

5. Five days of sick leave allowed per year 

6. Philippine holidays observed



Include the following 2 items in your application to be considered for interview: An up-to-date CV, and a link to your sample voice recording. Your recording should be in your natural speaking voice and be at least 30 seconds in length. We require our staff to have an upbeat, positive, clear communication style and to have the ability to work closely and respectfully with a culturally diverse team.

title: Video Editor
description:
Company: VOARVUE



Location: Remote (Global)



Type: Per-Project ? Long-Term / Full-Time Path



Pay: $10-20/hour (based on experience)



Who We Are



VoarVue is a premiu
dia company producing high-end video content for brands that value quality, consistency, and professional execution. Our work spans luxury real estate, yacht sales, construction, and brand-driven businesses that expect their visuals to perform — not just look good.



We operate with clear systems, defined roles, and strong creative leadership, so our editors can focus on what they do best: delivering clean, polished work without chaos, scope creep, or client micromanagement.



Who We’re Looking For



We’re hiring a Video Editor who can confidently take projects from start to finish and takes pride in delivering refined, professional edits. This role is ideal for someone who understands structure, pacing, and visual consistency — and knows how to balance speed with quality.



You’ll work internally with a Project Manager and Creative Director. There is no direct client communication. You’ll receive organized footage, clear direction, and defined timelines. Your responsibility is execution at a high level.



This role starts per-project, with a clear intention to grow into a long-term, full-time position for the right person.



Role Overview



- Employment Type: Per-project (long-term path to full-time)

- Location: Remote / Global

- Schedule: Project-based, consistent workload

- Client Interaction: Internal only

- Focus: Editing execution and delivery



Responsibilities



- Edit long-form listing videos, short-form social reels, and talking-head content from raw footage

- Clean and balance dialogue, music, and sound design

- Perform color correction and basic grading for consistent, professional results

- Add titles, lower thirds, and simple motion elements when required

- Execute both template-based and custom edits depending on project needs

- Implement 1–2 internal revision rounds and client feedback accurately

- Meet defined turnaround times (typically 48–96 hours per deliverable)

- Maintain organized project files and export deliverables correctly



Experience & Skill Set



- Proven experience as a Video Editor with a portfolio showing both long-form and short-form work

- Strong proficiency in Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or Final Cut Pro

- Solid understanding of pacing, audio clarity, and visual flow

- Comfortable interpreting creative feedback and executing precise revisions

- Reliable time management and consistent delivery

- Professional communication and attention to detail



How We Set You Up to Win



- Clear creative direction and defined expectations

- Structured workflows and scoped revisions

- Consistent project flow (no feast-or-famine chaos)

- A team that values quality, professionalism, and craft

- Opportunity to grow into senior and full-time roles

- Direct communication and constructive feedback



Important Notes



This role begins per-project and is intended to grow into a long-term, full-time position.



We are not looking for agencies.



How to Apply



To be considered please fill out this intake form(If you don't fill this out you wont be considered);

title: Administrative Researcher - Housing Development
description:
Job Title

Administrative Researcher – Section 8 & HUD Housing Development

Position Summary

The Administrative Researcher will support the identification, research, and development of Section 8–eligible residential properties across the United States. This role is responsible for researching real estate properties, analyzing HUD subsidy rates, and executing required applications and documentation to support landlords and investors in making properties eligible for Housing Choice Voucher (Section 8) programs at the state and local level. The ideal candidate is highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to communicate clearly and professionally in English.

Key Responsibilities

Property & Market Research

Research residential real estate properties across U.S. markets suitable for Section 8 or HUD-assisted housing





Identify multi-unit development opportunities aligned with affordable housing and subsidy programs





Analyze local housing authority (PHA) requirements by state, county, and city





HUD & Section 8 Subsidy Analysis

Research HUD Fair Market Rents (FMRs), Small Area FMRs, and payment standards by jurisdiction





Compare subsidy limits with market rents to determine feasibility





Track changes in HUD policies, funding levels, and eligibility requirements





Application & Compliance Support

Prepare, complete, and submit Section 8–related applications and documentation on behalf of landlords and investors





Coordinate with Public Housing Authorities (PHAs), housing departments, and local agencies





Support inspection readiness (HQS/NSPIRE standards) through documentation and compliance tracking





Administrative & Planning Support

Maintain organized records, research files, applications, and correspondence





Develop clear research summaries, action plans, and timelines for property eligibility





Support strategic planning for the development and scaling of multi-unit Section 8 properties





Communication & Coordination

Communicate clearly and professionally with landlords, investors, housing authorities, and internal tea
mbers





Provide updates and status reports on research findings and application progress





Required Qualifications

Strong ability to speak, read, and write clear professional English





Demonstrated research skills, including online, regulatory, and data-based research





Strong administrative and organizational skills with high attention to detail





Ability to follow multi-step processes and execute plans independently





Proficiency with basic office tools 
, spreadsheets, document management) MUST know Microsoft Excel Spreadsheets 





Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Section 8, HUD programs, affordable housing, or housing authorities





Knowledge of Fair Market Rent (FMR) and Housing Choice Voucher programs





Experience supporting real estate investors, developers, or property managers





Familiarity with multi-unit housing development or compliance processes





Core Competencies

Research & analysis





Administrative execution





Compliance awareness





Strategic planning support





Professional communication





Time management and follow-through





Work Environment

Remote or hybrid (U.S.-based research focus)





Collaboration with real estate investors, landlords, and housing development teams

 directly after applying;

title: Senior Bookkeeper / CPA-Equivalent Accountant
description:
Organization Overview

Working for a private property investment firm. 

Position Summary

The Senior Bookkeeper / CPA-Equivalent will oversee and manage the day-to-day financial operations of the organization. This role requires advanced bookkeeping and accounting expertise, strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel, and experience supporting nonprofit financial compliance. The ideal candidate will function at a CPA-equivalent level, ensuring accurate financial reporting, reconciliations, payroll processing, and support for audits, grants, and regulatory requirements.

This position works closely with leadership and department heads to ensure financial systems support program delivery and organizational sustainability.



Key Responsibilities

Accounting & Financial Management

Record, document, and monitor all financial transactions across three departments





Maintain accurate general ledger entries and chart of accounts





Prepare and maintain monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports





Reconcile bank accounts, credit cards, and internal accounts





Fact-check accounting data to ensure accuracy and compliance





Accounts Payable & Receivable

Process accounts payable and ensure timely vendor payments





Manage accounts receivable, invoicing, and payment tracking





Monitor outstanding balances and follow up as needed





Payroll & Tax Support

Process payroll and maintain payroll records





Track payroll data, benefits, and withholdings





Assist with payroll tax filings, annual returns, and required reporting





Support preparation for IRS filings, including Form 990 (as applicable)





Compliance & Documentation

Prepare, organize, and file financial documents for audits, grants, and funders





Ensure compliance with nonprofit accounting standards and funding requirements





Support internal controls and financial policies





Systems & Reporting

Maintain financial records using QuickBooks or similar accounting software





Develop and maintain Excel spreadsheets for budgeting, forecasting, and reporting





Support leadership with financial analysis, cash flow tracking, and planning





Cross-Department Support

Work with program and administrative staff to track budgets and expenditures





Provide financial data to support program reporting and funding compliance





Collaborate with external accountants, auditors, or consultants as needed







Required Qualifications

CPA, CPA-Equivalent, or Senior Bookkeeper with comparable experience





Proven experience in nonprofit accounting and bookkeeping





Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel (formulas, reconciliations, reports)





Experience with QuickBooks (or similar accounting software)





Solid understanding of accounts payable, accounts receivable, payroll, and reconciliations





High attention to detail and strong organizational skills





Ability to manage multiple priorities across departments





Preferred Qualifications

Experience supporting audits, grants, or government-funded programs





Familiarity with nonprofit compliance and reporting requirements





Experience preparing financial reports for boards or leadership teams





Knowledge of Google Sheets and cloud-based financial systems





Core Competencies

Financial accuracy and integrity





Advanced bookkeeping and accounting





Excel-based analysis and reporting





Compliance and documentation





Time management and confidentiality





Clear written and verbal communication





Work Environment

Nonprofit organizational setting

title: Remote IT Assistant
description:
About Us:?



AbroadWorks is a fast growing global enterprise with established operations in the United States, India, and the Philippines. We specialize in providing both service-based solutions and advanced tech to help North American organizations in finding, onboarding, and managing global talent easily.



Our Offerings:



Global Staffing Services: Currently, the majority of our revenue is generated through our comprehensive global staffing services, which cater to the diverse needs of our clients.



Technology Solutions: Looking ahead, our strategic focus is to expand our footprint in the software sector, leveraging our technology to improve global human capital and talent management processes.



Job Title: IT Assistant



Location: Fully Remote, Philippines



Salary: $2.00 - $4.00 per hour based on experience



Schedule: Monday to Friday, Eastern Standard Time



Job Type: Full-Time



Job Description:



As an IT Assistant, you will be responsible for providing support through our IT Service Desk / Helpdesk to resolve technical issues promptly and efficiently.







Requirements: 



Must have a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or Electronics Engineering.



Preferably has 2 years or more relevant experience in IT and service desk support.



Preferably is familiar with performing information security audits and vulnerability assessments.







Responsibilities:



Provide support through the IT Service Desk / Helpdesk to resolve technical issues promptly and efficiently.



Help create and/or update procedures and documentations relevant to IT procedures. 



Facilitate regular internal security audits.



Assist in user training and guidance on best practices for IT usage and security.







Successful candidates for this role are expected to possess the following attributes:??



Must have excellent English communication skills.



Has the ability to complete projects in a timely manner and quickly adjust to changing circumstances and embrace new technologies, processes, or methods.



Great logical and verbal reasoning skills.



Exceptionally detail-oriented.



Exceptional problem-solving and information-processing skills.



Ability to think outside the box.



A great work ethic and interest in learning new concepts and growing with the job.



Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.



Must have their own work device (preferably a desktop or laptop) and a stable internet connection.



Must be comfortable with using a time-tracking software for payroll purposes.



Must be willing to undergo a background verification check during the final stages of the hiring process.







Successful candidates for this role will be rewarded with the following benefits:



A total of five paid vacation days per year (additional days can be taken unpaid).



A 5% raise per year guaranteed (additional raises or bonuses may be given for outstanding performance).



A paid 15-minute break for every 4 hours of work.



Healthcare benefits after 2 months of full-time work.



* Vacation days increase by 1 vacation day per year. I.e. after one year of employment, the total paid vacation days on year 2 would be six, on year 3 seven, etc.



Our main focus is to build an energized and motivated workforce where our employees are happy and satisfied with their jobs and growth opportunities.



We are looking forward to making you a part of our team!



Thank you for your time and interest.

title: Sales & Marketing Specialist
description:
Core Responsibilities:

We are seeking a highly driven sales-focused professional with native-level English fluency to lead client acquisition for our property management services. This role’s primary focus is sales — turning prospects into signed clients. You will be the front line of communication with property owners, identifying their needs, presenting our services, and closing deals.



The ideal candidate is a natural-born closer — confident, persuasive, and strategic — who thrives on results. While marketing and outreach will support your efforts, your main responsibility is to generate new business through direct outreach, online interaction, and effective relationship-building with property owners throughout Philadelphia.



Key Responsibilities:

Aggressive Client Acquisition & Conversion: Utilize strong sales acumen and communication skills to successfully convert inquiries into active property management clients, primarily through phone calls and direct engagement.



Strategic Lead Generation: Develop and execute targeted marketing and outreach strategies specifically designed to generate new, qualified leads (property owners) in the Philadelphia market.



Targeted Digital Outreach: Actively manage and promote services across key social platforms 
, Instagram, TikTok) and engage directly within local Philadelphia owner groups to identify and connect with potential clients.



Performance & Sales Reporting: Rigorously track performance metrics, focusing on lead quality, conversion rates, and overall client acquisition success.



Market Expertise: Develop a deep understanding of Philadelphia's neighborhoods and the competitive property management landscape to tailor effective sales pitches and offers.



Ideal Candidate Profile Highlights:

Proven track record in high-stakes sales and negotiation.



Exceptional verbal communication and interpersonal skills.



Ability to sell both the company's services and their own value proposition persuasively.

title: Property Manager
description:
We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Property Manager to oversee daily operations, tenant relations, and financial performance of our properties. This role is ideal for someone with hands-on experience using Rent Manager and managing Section 8 (Housing Choice Voucher) properties.



Key Responsibilities

Tenant Relations & Leasing

• Manage the full tenant lifecycle, including marketing vacancies, screening applicants, lease negotiations, move-ins, and move-outs

• Coordinate Section 8 tenant onboarding, renewals, and communications

• Serve as the primary point of contact for tenant concerns



Financial Management

• Oversee rent collection, Section 8 payments, and security deposits using Rent Manager

Maintenance & Repairs

Compliance & Risk Management

Owner Reporting

Proven experience in property management

• Excellent organizational and communication skills

• Ability to manage multiple properties and priorities



Interested? Send us your CV with a short intro video highlighting the experience you have for the role and your whatsapp number.

title: D2C Senior Video Editor
description:
### **Role Overview**



Something New is a performance marketing agency that helps E-commerce (D2C) brands grow. We are looking for a **Senior Video Editor** to join our production team.



In this role, you will be responsible for editing high-quality video ads for our clients (distributed through Meta, TikTok) and internal content for the agency (distributed through YouTube, Social Media). You will work within our **CreativeOS** system to receive briefs and deliver assets.



This is a 100% execution role, but you must be resourceful. While we provide the scripts and strategy, you will often need to **source B-roll (Stock or AI)** and **generate Voiceovers (AI), Generate Ai B-roll** to bring the script to life. Your job is to take the concept and build a professional, high-converting video quickly.



---



### **Core Responsibilities**



- **Edit Performance Ads:** Create Direct Response video ads (UGC, VSLs, Founder Stories) based on provided storyboards and scripts.

- **Source & Generate Assets:** When raw footage is not provided, you must find high-quality Stock B-roll or generate AI visuals to match the script.

- **AI Voiceover Production:** You will use tools like **ElevenLabs** to generate, pace, and mix realistic voiceovers when a human voice is not provided.

- **Edit Internal Content:** Produce long-form videos for the agency’s YouTube channel and short clips for organic social media.

- **Motion Graphics:** Create "Pattern Interrupts" (kinetic typography, visual overlays, and animations) to keep viewers engaged and stop the scroll.

- **Create Variations:** Rapidly produce 5–10 versions of a single video by changing the "Hook" (first 3 seconds), music, or background/b-roll footage.

- **Audio & Colour:** Clean up background noise (using AI tools), sync voiceovers, and colour grade raw footage to look professional.

- **Asset Management:** Organise all project files and exports inside our **CreativeOS (Notion)**. You must ensure files are easy for the team to find.



---



### **Required Skills & Tools**



You must be fluent in the following software and workflows:



1. **Professional Editing Software:** You must be fast and proficient in **Premiere Pro**, **CapCut Pro**, **DaVinci Resolve**, or **Final Cut Pro**. *Note: The final result must look polished and professional, not "cheap."*

2. **Motion & Visual Effects:** You must be able to create custom text animations and visual overlays. (You can use After Effects, CapCut Motion, or other compositing tools).

3. **AI Workflow:** You must be experienced in using **ElevenLabs** (for Voiceovers) and AI tools for sourcing/generating B-roll.

4. **CreativeOS / Notion:** You will use this daily to manage tasks and find assets.

5. **Stock Footage Sourcing:** Ability to quickly find "on-brand" B-roll from stock libraries that doesn't look like generic stock footage.



---



### **Expected Deliverables**



- **Volume:** You will be expected to deliver **10 to 20 unique video assets per week** once fully onboarded.

- **Accuracy:** Videos must be exported in the correct format for each platform (9:16 for TikTok/Reels, 16:9 for YouTube) with correct "Safe Zones" for text.

- **Speed:** You must be able to turn around revisions within 24 hours.



---



### **Hardware & Internet Requirements**



- **Computer:** A powerful PC or Mac capable of rendering 4K footage and running After Effects without lagging (Recommended: 32GB RAM minimum).

- **Internet:** High-speed connection (Fiber recommended) with a backup solution in case of outages.

- **Power:** Access to a generator or power station (e.g., EcoFlow) to handle power interruptions.



---



### **How to Apply**



Please submit your application with the following:



1. **Portfolio:** A link to your showreel or portfolio. **Specifically highlight Short-Form Ads (TikTok/Reels) and Motion Graphics work.**

2. **Experience:** A brief summary of your experience editing for D2C or E-commerce brands.

3. **Speed:** Tell us your average turnaround time for a 60-second video with motion graphics.

title: US Tax Preparer & Coordinator
description:
Tax Preparer / U.S. Business Tax Coordinator



Employment Type: Full-Time (Independent Contract)



Location: Remote - WFH



Job Summary



We are seeking an experienced Tax Preparer / Business Tax Specialist with strong practical knowledge of U.S. business taxes. This role focuses on preparing and supporting federal, state, and local tax filings for our business clients.



This position does not require a PTIN, EFIN, CPA, or EA, but does require demonstrated hands-on experience preparing business tax filings, payroll-related tax forms, and compliance reports. The ideal candidate understands how business operations connect to tax reporting and can work accurately under deadlines.



Key Responsibilities



Business Income Tax Preparation



    Prepare and review federal business tax returns, including:

    Schedule C (Sole Proprietors)

    Form 1065 (Partnerships)

    Form 1120-S (S Corporations)

    Form 1120 (C Corporations)

    Assist with state business income and franchise tax filings

    Support preparation of quarterly estimated tax calculations



Payroll & Employment Tax Support



    Prepare and review payroll-related tax filings, including:

    Form 941 (Quarterly Payroll Tax Returns)

    Form 940 (FUTA)

    W-2 and W-3 forms

    State payroll and unemployment filings

    Assist with payroll tax reconciliations

    Respond to IRS and state payroll notices



Sales Tax & State Compliance



    Prepare state and local sales tax returns (monthly or quarterly)

    Assist with sales tax reconciliations

    Support multi-state sales tax compliance when applicable

    Identify basic sales tax nexus considerations



Year-End & Compliance Filings



    Prepare information returns, including:

    Form 1099-NEC

    Form 1099-MISC

    Assist with amended returns and corrections

    Support compliance tracking and filing deadlines

    Maintain organized workpapers and supporting documentation



Required Knowledge & Experience



    Demonstrated experience preparing U.S. business tax filings

    Strong understanding of:

    Business income taxation

    Payroll and employment taxes

    Sales tax reporting

    Quarterly estimated taxes

    Ability to read and interpret IRS and state tax notices

    Experience working with accounting records and financial statements

    High attention to detail and deadline management



Preferred (But Not Required)



    Experience working in a tax firm or accounting practice

    Familiarity with (QuickBooks Online)

    Basic bookkeeping or accounting knowledge

    Experience supporting small to mid-sized businesses



Remote Setup Requirements



    Stable, high-speed internet connection

    Quiet and dedicated work-from-home environment

    Dual monitors strongly preferred



Schedule



    US Arizona business hours (11:00pm to 8:00am Philippines time)



Please share a link of your resume or send to

title: PRODUCTION ENGINEER
description:
Production Engineer (Remote)

Supporting Voltech Operations

We are seeking a technically strong Production Engineer (Remote) to support operations related to Voltech test systems and custom test fixtures.

This role will focus on improving production efficiency, supporting fixture development, assisting with engineering documentation, and coordinating with suppliers to ensure high-quality manufacturing standards. The engineer will work closely with internal teams and Voltech-related operations to ensure smooth production, product reliability, and continuous improvement.

This is a hands-on engineering role requiring strong analytical ability and practical problem-solving skills. \

We value engineers who proactively identify weaknesses in processes and propose structured improvements rather than simply executing assigned tasks.

Role Overview

The Remote Production Engineer will:

Support production and fixture-related engineering activities

Improve manufacturing processes and efficiency

Investigate design and production issues related to Voltech test systems and fixtures

Maintain technical drawings and documentation

Coordinate with international suppliers 

Support 3D-printed fixture components and rapid prototyping

Opportunity to influence global production standards

Direct exposure to product development and custom engineering

Work on technically demanding electrical measurement systems

Ability to shape long-term fixture architecture

The role requires someone comfortable working independently while collaborating remotely with sales, applications, service, and supplier teams.

Key Responsibilities

Production & Fixture Support

Provide remote engineering support for production of Voltech-related test fixtures and accessories

Troubleshoot mechanical or electrical fixture issues affecting customer testing

Assist in improving fixture durability, usability, and reliability

Analyze recurring production issues and recommend corrective actions

Design and refine precision contact systems (Kelvin probes, spring contacts, alignment plates) to ensure repeatable electrical measurement accuracy

Manage tolerance stack-ups in multi-component fixture assemblies

Improve durability of contact surfaces under high cycle counts





Kindly send your CV LINK. No link, application will be skipped.

 campaigns that support the growth of The Harmoni Table.



This role combines content execution + backend systems + marketing strategy.

Social Media Management



Plan and schedule Instagram content



Write captions aligned with brand voice (educational, calm, clinical)



Repurpose long-form content into short-form posts



Track engagement and basic analytics

Build landing pages and funnels



Set up
 automations and sequences

 Marketing

s

 campaigns

Kajabi (funnel building,
 automation, product uploads)



 marketing strategy and execution



Instagram content management



Basic funnel analytics understanding



Canva design skills

We work in a fast-paced but grounded environment. It’s important that you are:

title: Expert Video Editor // Short Form and Long Form
description:
Expert Video Editor (CapCut + AI) | Music Marketing Agency (US)



Overview



We’re hiring an expert video editor to join a fast-growing music marketing agency in the United States. This is a long-term, high-paying role for someone who wants stable work, a healthy team environment, and high output expectations. We run multiple client campaigns at once and move fast, so we need an editor who is both creative and operationally sharp.



This role is not for beginners. We will not interview candidates who cannot demonstrate advanced proficiency in the skill areas listed below.



What You’ll Be Working On



Short-form content for music artists (primary)



- Edit short-form content for multiple clients in the music marketing realm

- Consistent output cadence: content posted 5 days per week per client

- Optimize edits for retention, clarity, pacing, hooks, and trend alignment

- Deliver platform-ready versions for Instagram Reels, TikTok,
 Reels, and YouTube Shorts



Long-form YouTube (secondary but important)



- Produce high-quality long-form YouTube videos

- Include modern YouTube editing patterns: graphics, pop-ups, captions, b-roll, overlays, zooms, pattern interrupts, and clean pacing

- Use AI tools to enhance production (scene generation, b-roll alternatives, concept visuals, etc.) when appropriate



Agency creative ads (ongoing)



- Build high-level ad creatives for our agency’s client acquisition campaigns

- We run 24/7 creative testing and rotate new creatives constantly

- You must be able to produce multiple angles and variations quickly without sacrificing quality



Required Expertise (Non-Negotiable)



- CapCut mastery

- Advanced CapCut editing workflow

- Speed, structure, pacing, captions, effects, sound design, and export best practices

- AI fluency for editing and creative support

- Strong working knowledge of AI video tools and AI-assisted workflows

- Confident using AI for prompts, scripts, hooks, headlines, and content angles

- Able to use AI responsibly to improve speed and output while keeping edits feeling human and culturally current

- Social media trends and short-form culture

- Must be up-to-date on short-form trends, pacing norms, hook styles, platform patterns, and what currently performs

- You understand retention-based editing and modern attention mechanics

- Multi-client workload management

- Comfortable handling multiple clients simultaneously

- Strong communication, file naming discipline, and version control

- Able to follow SOPs closely and hit deadlines consistently



Preferred Qualifications (Strong Advantages)



- Adobe + Premiere experience

- Premiere Pro proficiency strongly preferred

- Bonus if you have working knowledge of After Effects, Photoshop, Illustrator, or Audition

- Meta /
 ads experience

- Experience editing direct-response ads or performance creatives

- Understanding of ad fatigue, creative testing, and variation strategies

- Ability to build multiple ad variants from the same source footage efficiently

- Music content editing experience

- Preferred experience editing artists, music promo, studio content, performance clips, storytelling content, or music lifestyle content

- You understand how to make music content feel premium and emotionally resonant while still optimized for performance



Deliverables and Standards



You will be expected to:



- Produce consistent high-quality short-form edits at scale

- Create long-form YouTube edits that feel modern, clean, and dynamic

- Generate ad creatives and variations that are designed to test and win

- Use AI tools to accelerate output and improve creative range

- Follow instructions exactly and maintain a high standard of execution



Who This Role Is For



This role fits someone who is:



- Fast, consistent, and detail-oriented

- Comfortable with feedback and iterations

- Trend-aware without chasing cringe

- Strong at storytelling, pacing, hooks, and retention

- Process-driven and reliable with deadlines

- Comfortable working inside a structured agency environment

- Screening and Interview Policy



We will not schedule an interview unless your work clearly demonstrates expertise in:

- CapCut (expert level)

- AI workflows for video + creative ideation

- Short-form trends and retention-based editing

- Long-form YouTube editing capability

- Ability to follow instructions precisely



Priority interviews and faster scheduling will be given to candidates who show clear, verifiable proficiency in:



- Premiere Pro and Adobe workflows

- Meta ads creative strategy and rapid iteration ability

- Music industry content editing experience



Application Instructions



To apply, submit:



- A portfolio link (HIGH LEVEL short-form examples required)

title: Credit Repair Disputer
description:
MUST SEND A 60 SECOND LOOM WITH YOUR EXPERIENCE TO BE CONSIDERED FOR POSITION!



Virtual Assistant for Credit Repair and Financial Literacy



Location: Remote



Are you passionate about helping others achieve financial freedom and literacy? We are seeking a skilled Virtual Assistant to join our team and assist clients in disputing inaccurate credit reports and navigating the complex world of credit repair and financial literacy.



YOU MUST RECORD A 2 MIN OR 60 SECOND VIDEO EXPLAINING YOUR KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE ALONG WITH PROVEN RESULTS OF YOUR WORK OR YOU WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED.



Responsibilities:

- Dispute inaccurate credit reports on behalf of clients, adhering to the laws outlined in the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA).

- File complaints with consumer protection agencies such as the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), Better Business Bureau (BBB), and Attorney General's office when necessary.

- Utilize extensive knowledge of the credit repair process in America to provide expert guidance and support to clients.

- Communicate effectively with clients to address their concerns, answer inquiries, and provide updates on the dispute process.

- Demonstrate true determination and heart in advocating for clients' rights and financial well-being.



Qualifications:

- Previous experience working with a credit repair company, with a strong understanding of the credit repair process.

- Extensive knowledge of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA) and other relevant laws governing credit reporting and repair.

- Proven ability to file complaints with consumer protection agencies, such as the CFPB, BBB, and Attorney General's office.

- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to empathize and connect with clients.

- True determination and heart to help clients overcome financial challenges and achieve their goals.



Benefits:

- Flexible remote work environment.

- Opportunity to make a meaningful impact in the lives of others.

- Competitive compensation package.



If you have a passion for helping others and possess the skills and qualifications listed above, we want to hear from you! Apply now to join our team and make a difference in the world of credit repair and financial literacy.



3 Commas Solutions is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in the workplace. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, or other protected status.

title: Creative Operations Lead (AI & High-Volume Ads)
description:
Schedule: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM Mountain Time (US)

(This is approx. 1:00 AM – 9:00 AM Philippines Time. Strict attendance required.)

Type: Full-Time (40 Hours/Week) – Exclusive (No other clients allowed)



?? STOP. READ THIS BEFORE APPLYING:



Do not apply if you need a boss to tell you exactly what to do every morning.



Do not apply if you are just looking for a "chill" graphic design job.



Do not apply if you have zero experience with Direct Response Marketing or AI Tools (Midjourney, ElevenLabs, etc.).



IMPORTANT: You must include a Loom video to be considered. Instructions are at the bottom of this post.



Who We Are:

We are a specialized marketing agency in the US servicing 40+ Home Service Contractors (Roofers, Painters, Flooring, Landscaping, Concrete). We are growing fast, and we are tired of the old way of doing things.



The Problem You Will Solve:

Currently, our ad production is too slow because we wait for clients to send us photos and videos. This ends now.



We are hiring YOU to build a Creative Engine. You will be responsible for sourcing stock footage, generating AI images/voiceovers, building "Master Templates," and deploying them across 40 accounts without waiting for anyone.



Your Mission (The "System Builder" Role):



Be The Source: You will use tools like Midjourney, ElevenLabs, and Pexels to create high-converting video and image assets from scratch. You never blame the client for "lack of assets."



Build The Factory: You don't just edit one video. You build a Master Template in Canva/CapCut and use Bulk Create/Variables to generate 15 versions (different cities/logos) in minutes.



Own The Performance: Your metric is Beating The Control. You must look at the current Cost Per Lead (CPL) for a client, and build ads that beat it. If an ad isn't outperforming the account average, YOU d
 to kill it and launch a new hook.



Requirements (Must Have):



System Architecture: You know how to organize folders, name files correctly (e.g., Client_Offer_Hook_Date), and keep a clean workspace.



AI Fluency: You are comfortable using AI for Voiceovers, Scripting, and Image Generation.



Direct Response Eyes: You understand that "Ugly" ads often work better. You know what a "Hook" is. You know how to stop the scroll.



Perfect English: You can write your own headlines and hooks on the creatives without grammar errors.



The "30-Day Sprint" (How We Start):

We do not hire permanently on Day 1. We start with a Paid 30-Day Evaluation Period at full salary.

To get the permanent offer, you must:



Launch fresh creative sets for 5 stuck clients.



Demonstrate you can produce 20+ variations per week.



Beat the Benchmarks: Your new creatives must lower the CPL (Cost Per Lead) compared to the client's previous 30-day average.



HOW TO APPLY (Strict Instructions):

Note: I will delete any application that does not follow these instructions exactly.



Record a Short Video (Loom/Vimeo):



Show me your screen. Open a complex design project (Canva or Video Editor) from your past work.



Walk me through your organization. How do you structure your files? How do you set up templates?



I want to see your PROCESS, not just the final image.



Subject Line: "I am the Creative Ops Lead - [Your Name]"



Send the Link: Paste the Loom link and your Portfolio link in the message body.

title: Shopify Storefront UX/UI Specialist
description:
Title:  Shopify Storefront UX/UI Specialist

Location: Philippines (Remote)

Employment Type: Full-Time (Virtual Assistant / Contract)



Role Overview

Own the daily performance of the Shopify storefront as a revenue-producing environment. Treat the site like a live retail floor that requires constant monitoring, adjustment, testing, and reporting based on real customer behavior. Software Development maintains platform stability; this role ensures the storefront stays fast, accurate, and converting through disciplined execution tied directly to revenue outcomes.



Key Responsibilities



Daily Operations

• Audit homepage, collections, product pages, and cart flow for errors or friction

• Validate mobile experience across devices

• Confirm navigation, search, filtering, and add-to-cart functionality

• Verify promotions, pricing, bundles, and messaging accuracy

• Update homepage features, merchandising, and campaign landing pages

• Optimize product placement based on inventory and demand

• Improve product page clarity, hierarchy, and usability

• Optimize images and assets for speed

• Execute changes safely, test, publish, and maintain rollback readiness



Optimization & Reporting

• Analyze funnel metrics, conversion rate, AOV, and abandonment points

• Prioritize UX improvements that increase revenue per session

• Plan and execute controlled experiments

• Review page speed and Core Web Vitals

• Refresh homepage aligned to marketing calendar

• Maintain change logs with impact analysis



Testing & Monitoring

• Validate navigation, cart, and checkout entry

• Confirm promotions, tracking, and pixels function correctly

• Use heatmaps and session recordings to identify friction

• Monitor broken links, errors, crawl issues, and site health

• Analyze behavior by device, traffic source, and segment



Required Qualifications

• Hands-on Shopify storefront management experience

• Strong conversion-focused UX/UI instincts

• Familiarity with analytics and behavior tools

• Mobile-first ecommerce understanding

• Ability to implement changes without degrading performance

• Detail-oriented with disciplined testing habits



Software & Utilities Familiarity:



Storefront & Page Building: Shopify Admin, PageFly, Shogun, Gempages

Subscriptions: Recharge, Skio, Loop

Analytics & Behavior: GA4, Shopify Analytics, Microsoft Clarity, Hotjar

Testing & Optimization: Intelligems, Shoplift

Performance: PageSpeed Insights, GTmetrix, Lighthouse

Site Audit & SEO Health: Screaming Frog, Ahrefs, SEMrush, Google Search Console

Cross-Device Testing: BrowserStack, LambdaTest



The ideal candidate is someone who treats the storefront as a live revenue environment, moves quickly but tests thoroughly, focuses on removing customer friction, anticipates issues before they impact shoppers, and understands eCommerce metrics beyond surface-level design.

title: Program Assistant
description:
MASTERMIND PROGRAM ASSISTANT

Full-Time | Philippines | $800/month | Must work US Time Zone hours



We aren’t looking for a basic virtual assistant. We’re looking for a Client Accountability Operator who protects retention, enforces standards, and ensures no client slips through the cracks.



At Speak Your Way To Cash®, we’ve grown from zero to an Inc. 5000 company — and we’re just getting started. Our mission is to empower experts and entrepreneurs to turn their voices into revenue.



This role is not about “helping.”

It is about protecting revenue, enforcing follow-through, and keeping our 400+ clients moving.



You will be the operational heartbeat behind our Mastermind and Academy programs. If someone misses a payment, you call. If someone misses a call, you follow up. If engagement drops, you flag it. If a client wins, you capture it.



This is a performance role. Not a passive one.





WHAT YOU’LL DO



You will support the Director of Client Success, Mastermind Coach, and Academy Coach.



Daily Responsibilities

• Monitor missed payments and immediately call clients who fall behind.

• Send payment follow-up
s and document all communication in CRM.

• Track revenue submission forms and flag missing reports.

• Monitor engagement dashboards (Green/Yellow/Red).

• Flag 30+ day inactivity.

• Follow clients on social media and track major life or business updates.

• Alert leadership to major milestones, crises, or contract wins.

• Track missed Q&A or hot seat calls and reach out when clients miss both.

• Update CRM notes and automations.

• Track birthdays and personal milestones.



Weekly Responsibilities

• Update retention dashboards.

• Prepare Red/Yellow/Green client reports for Director review.

• Monitor WhatsApp inactivity and missed submissions.

• Follow up on testimonial opportunities (3–5 month mark).

• Support testimonial collection and coordination.

• Audit onboarding completion (forms, activation milestones).

• Track challenge participation and engagement levels.



Monthly Responsibilities

• Assist in renewal pipeline tracking.

• Compile client wins for internal Wins Report.

• Monitor onboarding completion rates.

• Prepare milestone tracking summaries.

• Support white-glove gift coordination (birthdays, bereavement, celebrations).





CRITICAL FUNCTION: PAYMENT & ACCOUNTABILITY CALLS



If a client misses payment:

• You call within 24 hours.

• You speak clearly, confidently, and professionally.

• You follow a structured script while remaining human.

• You document the outcome immediately.



You must have a strong, confident, polished phone voice. This is mandatory.





WHO THIS ROLE IS FOR



? You are confident on the phone and not afraid of difficult conversations.

? You speak clear, professional English with strong verbal communication skills.

? You have experience in client success, collections, or account management.

? You are organized and love dashboards, trackers, and systems.

? You follow up until something is resolved.

? You understand urgency and move fast.

? You are comfortable enforcing standards politely but firmly.

? You can work US time zone hours consistently.





WHO THIS ROLE ISN’T FOR



? You avoid confrontation.

? You dislike making phone calls.

? You need constant supervision.

? You struggle with follow-through.

? You get uncomfortable asking clients about payments.

? You are looking for a low-pressure job.



This role protects revenue. It requires backbone.





WHAT YOU BRING



• Proven experience in virtual assistance, client support, collections, or CRM management.

• Demonstrated track record of managing multiple clients or accounts simultaneously.

• Experience using CRMs and tracking systems.

• Strong written and spoken English.

• Bachelor’s degree preferred.

• Strategic + tactical thinking with clean execution.

• Strong phone presence with professional tone and confidence.





COMPENSATION & BENEFITS



• $800/month (Full-time).

• Performance-based bonuses possible based on retention and payment recovery.

• Direct impact at a high-growth Inc. 5000 company.

• Visibility, ownership, and growth opportunities into higher client success roles.





HOW TO APPLY



: 

Subject line: Program Assistant – Your Name



Include the following:

1. A written sample
 to a client who is 14 days behind on payment.

2. A Loom video (3–5 minutes) explaining:

   • Why you want this role

   • Why you are confident making payment collection calls

   • Why you are a strong fit for a high-performance environment



Applications without both requirements will not be reviewed.





This is not a content company.

This is a results company.



We show up on our clients’ worst day and their biggest contract day.



Apply now. Show us how you’ve done this before, what you’ve built, and how you’ll take this role to the next level.

title: Operations and Bookkeeping Virtual Assistant (Rentals + Family Admin)
description:
We are a small family-run business operating short-term rentals and professional services. We are looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to help manage recurring financial tasks, vendor payments, rental administration, and light personal/family scheduling.



This role is focused on organization, follow-through, and accuracy (not marketing or social media at this time).



We value calm, structured thinkers who enjoy building systems and working with checklists.



Core Responsibilities:

• Pay recurring vendors (e.g., cleaner) accurately and on time

• Reconcile payments and confirm accuracy

• Create and follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)

• Order recurring supplies (e.g., Costco items)

• Schedule appointments (e.g., doctor visits for children)

• General admin and organization tasks



What We’re Looking For:



• Strong bookkeeping or accounting experience

• High attention to detail

• Comfortable working with Excel/Google Sheets

• Organized and process-oriented

• Reliable and consistent

• Clear written English communication

• Comfortable handling structured financial tasks

• Long-term mindset



This role may grow over time depending on performance.  10 hours per week to start (2 hours per weekday).



We are looking for someone steady, dependable, and comfortable working with recurring systems.

title: Cybersecurity Analyst
description:
About the Role

We’re hiring a Junior–Mid Cybersecurity Analyst to support managed security operations across multiple client environments. This is a hands-on role that balances security alert response, proactive security improvement, and security program maturity.

This is not a helpdesk role and not a Tier 1 alert factory. We’re looking for someone who wants to grow as a security practitioner, reduce risk over time, and help build a mature, standards-aligned security program.



Alert response is intentionally capped at 50% of the role. When alerts are quiet, time is spent proactively hardening environments, improving configurations, supporting assessments, and refining security processes.



What You’ll Do

Security Monitoring & Response (Up to 50% of your time)

- Monitor and triage security alerts from EDR,
 security, and Microsoft 365 / Entra ID

- Validate alerts using user, device, and environment context

- Execute approved containment actions (account disablement, endpoint isolation, blocking indicators)

- Escalate confirmed or high-risk i
 with clear documentation



Proactive Security Improvement

- Tune alerts and reduce false positives

- Improve security tool integrations and telemetry coverage

- Assist with Conditional Access, MFA enforcement, identity protection, and risk-based access controls

- Identify configuration drift and security gaps



Assessments & Standards Alignment

- Support vCIO and vCISO efforts during:

      - Security gap assessments

      - Risk assessments for new and existing clients

- Help align client environments to the National Institute of Standards and Technology Cybersecurity Framework (NIST CSF)

- Collect and document technical evidence and findings



Runbooks & Documentation

- Follow existing runbooks where available

- Help create and refine runbooks when gaps are identified

- Document lessons learned from i
 and investigations



Client & User Interaction

- Communicate directly with clients and end users during investigations and remediation

- Explain security issues clearly, calmly, and in plain English

- Maintain professional conduct in high-pressure situations



What We’re Looking For

Required

- 1–3 years of experience in cybersecurity operations, SOC, MSP security, or IT security

- Understanding of endpoint security, identity security, and
-based threats

- Familiarity with Microsoft 365 / Entra ID security concepts

- Strong written and verbal communication skills

- Ability to document clearly and think critically

- Comfort working in environments where processes are evolving



Preferred

- Experience in an MSP or multi-tenant environment

- Experience with Kaseya security tools:

   - Datto EDR

   - SaaS Alerts

   - RocketCyber

   - VulScan

- Exposure to alert tuning, automation, or security tooling optimization

- Interest in automation, security engineering, or program maturity

- Security certifications (nice to have, not required)



When applying, please send your resume and answer the following questions:

1. What are the specs of your local machine (CPU, RAM, and OS)?

2. Are you able to work on a wired Ethernet connection, and do you have a quiet, dedicated workspace for client calls?

3. Do you have any CompTIA certifications? If yes, can you please provide which certification you have and when it will expire?

4. Please briefly summarize your MSP or SOC experience.

5. Which ticketing (PSA) and remote (RMM) tools are you most proficient in?

6. This is a full-time, dedicated position within our organization. Can you confirm you are available for a 40-hour weekly commitment during our core operating hours (US hours)?

title: Fleet Operations Virtual Assistant
description:
Key Responsibilities

1. Fleet & Retail Ops Coordination

*Take retail calls

*Own the estimate-to-approval-to-route workflow:

**Create and submit estimates

**Follow up for approval

**Ensure parts are sourced

**Finalize tech routes for the following day

*Track all jobs in progress and flag issues proactively

*Ensure routes are realistic and efficient; confirm techs are prepped and ready

*Communicate clearly with customers and fleet managers about job timing, status, and follow-ups

*Submit and close out fleet approvals in Element, LeasePlan, and AutoIntegrate

*Ensure invoices match approvals; follow up on outstanding invoices and missing payments



2. Scheduling & Productivity Tracking

*Maintain the daily technician schedule, making updates as needed

*Monitor tech productivity; flag idle time, reschedules, or delays

*Track time logs and coordinate with bookkeeper for payroll



3. Customer Communication

*Respond to incoming calls, texts, WhatsApp messages, and system inquiries in a timely, professional manner

*Follow up with clients as needed to resolve open issues or gather job-related info

*Escalate concerns appropriately and promptly



4. Admin & Reporting

*Submit a detailed Daily Recap covering completed work, pending tasks, blockers, and KPIs

*Keep Trello and other tools up-to-date with accurate job and task statuses

*Track inventory needs and coordinate ordering of parts, oil, and supplies

*Monitor A/R and follow up on past-due fleet invoices



5. Marketing & Content Support

*Publish our monthly newsletter in MailChimp with content from marketing team

*Coordinate publishing of content to Instagram /
 / Google My Business

*Other light admin support as needed for the marketing team



What Success Looks Like

*All work orders, estimates, approvals, and tech routes are handled with zero dropped balls

*You identify blockers or problems before they become fires

*Communication is clear, timely, and professional — with both customers and internal team

*The business runs like a machine — nothing gets missed or delayed

*You take full ownership of your responsibilities and require very little follow-up



Who You Are

*A natural systems thinker who thrives on clarity, organization, and ownership

*Extremely proactive — you don’t wait to be told what to do

*Excellent at written and verbal English communication

*Comfortable in the automotive world and eager to learn the details

*Sharp and reliable — you retain info, spot gaps, and follow through



Experience & Skills Required

*3+ years of experience in a remote automotive: coordinator, dispatcher, operations role

*Demonstrated responsibility for keeping things moving without handholding

*Excellent written and spoken English

*Experience with dispatch, route planning, or technician scheduling

*Familiar with tools like Slack, Google Docs, Trello (or similar), CRM/invoicing platforms

*Experience working with U.S.-based field service, auto, or fleet companies

*Bonus: Familiarity with AutoIntegrate, Housecall Pro, Element, or LeasePlan platforms



Required Software Experience

*Slack

*WhatsApp

*Trello (or similar)

*Google Workspace

*CRM / invoicing tools (Housecall Pro, AutoIntegrate)

*
 (plus)



TECH REQUIREMENTS:

*Computer - at least i5 or equivalent with 8gb RAM

*Internet Speed - At least 50 MBPS Download speed

*Dual monitor setup is required to ensure efficiency in managing multiple applications simultaneously.



Location: Remote (Philippines)

Schedule: Full-time, US hours Monday to Friday (9:30 AM – 6:30 PM EST) / Tuesday to Saturday 10:30PM to 7:30 AM PHT

Pay: Php50K-75K monthly; we pay 13th month



We are offering bonuses for full-time members:

*Internet

*Generator

*Paid time off

*13th month pay

*HMO

Fill out this form: 
/appqNAvkEQ10YFlc3/pagrX4PvZe0xsKHWT/form

After submitting the form, click the apply button and send us a short message on why you would be a good fit for the role.

title: Python Developer – GNSS & Survey Data Processing Automation
description:
Overview



We are a professional land surveying firm seeking a technically strong geospatial engineer to design and implement an automated workflow for processing, organizing, and archiving survey field data.



This is backend automation for survey-grade data systems — not web mapping, not cartography.



Our crews collect GNSS and total station data, including proprietary formats and static observations. We are building a scalable Python-based pipeline to eliminate repetitive manual data handling and standardize our internal processing.



What You’ll Build



You will design and implement a Python-based automation system that:



Monitors and backs up raw field data



Parses structured and semi-structured survey files



Extracts coordinate and observation data



Separates geographic and projected coordinate systems



Processes static GNSS datasets



Generates automated survey quality and residual reports



Organizes processed outputs into a scalable job-based structure



Supports long-term archival and retrieval



This role focuses on survey data engineering and automation architecture.



Required Skills



Strong Python scripting experience



Experience parsing structured or semi-structured data (CSV, database exports, binary formats)



Solid understanding of coordinate systems:



Geographic (WGS84)



Projected systems (State Plane or similar)



Localized coordinate systems



Familiarity with GNSS workflows:



Static observations



Base/Rover concepts



Residual analysis



Experience with:



pandas



pyproj



geospatial data libraries



Experience building automated workflows or ETL pipelines



Strongly Preferred



Background in:



Geodetic Engineering



Land Surveying



Geomatics



Geodesy



GNSS data processing



RINEX or survey instrument data



Experience with Topcon, Trimble, Leica, or similar survey data formats is a major plus.



What This Is Not



This is NOT:



A web map developer role



A cartography or visualization job



A CAD drafting position



General IT support



We are looking for someone comfortable with:



Coordinate transformations



Data parsing logic



Survey error analysis



Automation system design



Initial Scope



The first phase will focus on building a robust automation core for survey data ingestion and processing.



There is potential for long-term collaboration as we refine internal data architecture and reporting tools.



To Apply



Please include:



Examples of automation scripts or data pipelines you’ve built



Any experience with survey or GNSS datasets



A short explanation of how you would approach parsing a proprietary data format



Your experience with coordinate transformations



Your availability and expected hourly rate



Bonus: Briefly explain the difference between geographic (WGS84) coordinates and projected coordinate systems, and how you would transform between them programmatically.

title: Account Manager
description:
Benefits:

Work From Home

Guaranteed $500 USD per week

Additional available if you perform well

Unlimited potential through residual because you earn as long as your customers say with Fleetsmarts





What we do as a company:

We give a fuel card away for free to truckers in the US that have discounts on diesel fuel. We have add-on products that make the sale more attractive to the customer. Customers can get weekly credit lines for their fuel card if they use our factoring service, which is akin to a pay-day loan service for businesses, but we provide this service for free. We also have a service to help reduce the down payment on their insurance. We market to new trucking companies that are just starting out and all our products are designed to help them get going faster than they would be able to on their own.





What you do:

You call warm appointments for truckers who have already expressed interest

You explain how we can help them

95% of people say yes

The key is following up until they actually start using our services





We set up 4 interviews per day in between the hours of 4:00 and 6:00pm

We will choose one new Cat 3 Re-Engager per week.

After one week, if they don’t hit 60% patch rate, they are out.

For 5 weeks, if they hit high patch rate, we rotate them between Hannah and Cat 1s

We promote one each week to Cat 3 leads and replace our worst AM.





Key Responsibilities:

Proactively follow up on abandoned or inactive leads assigned to account managers.

Present and promote fuel card programs, factoring services, and insurance solutions to potential clients.

Assist customers with the activation of fuel cards and ensure a preferred payment method is added.

Offer factoring services and guide customers through the contract signing process to ensure completion and compliance



Qualifications:

Proven experience in sales, customer retention, or outbound calling (required)

Strong communication and negotiation skills

Confident handling high-volume outbound calls

Goal-oriented, persistent, and able to work independently

Organized and comfortable using CRM tools and office software

Positive attitude and ability to build rapport quickly

title: WFH US Senior Accountant
description:
About Us:

Our mission is to deliver specialized bookkeeping for real estate investors, property managers, and senior living businesses. Using proven systems and a diagnostic-first approach, we bring clarity, accuracy, and confidence to messy books so our clients can focus on growth and strategic decisions.



We live by our values:

Excellence

We prioritize accuracy, proactive communication, and thorough preparation in everything we do.

Discipline

We operate with consistency, accountability, and respect for boundaries (no weekend work unless approved).

Alignment

We follow clear SOPs and shared goals to ensure consistency across clients and our team.

Ambition

We support our clients’ growth while building freedom and profitability within our own team.

Impact

We help businesses thrive by giving them clarity and confidence in their numbers.



What we do:

We go beyond balancing numbers. We empower our clients with reliable, actionable financial insight so they can confidently expand their portfolios, open new facilities, and scale operations in a sustainable and strategic way. Our goal is to turn financial data into clarity, giving business owners the visibility they need to make smart, forward-thinking decisions.



Job Summary:

Accounting professional specializing in full-cycle accounting for real estate portfolios, including property acquisitions and multi-entity operations. Experienced in accrual-basis accounting, financial reporting, reconciliations, intercompany transactions, and tax tracking. Skilled in managing day-to-day bookkeeping, accounts payable/receivable, payroll support, and sales tax compliance. Proficient in QuickBooks Online and related systems, with a strong focus on accurate reporting, organized chart of accounts management, client onboarding, and cross-functional collaboration to ensure timely and compliant financial operations.



What You’ll Do:



Manage full-cycle accounting for multiple real estate properties, including newly purchased assets.

Review and reconcile closing statements related to property acquisitions and transactions.

Maintain and oversee accrual-basis accounting, including monthly and year-end accruals.

Accrue and track tax payments and other property-related obligations.

Handle intercompany transactions and transfers across entities and properties.

Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports, reconciliations, and variance analysis.

Collaborate closely with property managers to gather financial data and ensure timely reporting.

Manage day-to-day bookkeeping for real estate investors, property managers, and senior living facilities.

Reconcile bank and credit card accounts regularly and accurately.

Handle accounts payable/receivable, payroll support, and sales tax filings as assigned.

Build and maintain a clean and organized chart of accounts.

Produce accurate monthly financial reports and ensure on-time delivery.

Support client onboarding, including connecting and setting up accounts in QuickBooks Online (QBO), Keeper, and related systems.



Collaborate with the account manager and team through Slack, Asana, and Notion.

Ensure compliance with deadlines and bookkeeping best practices.

Participate in financial cleanups and diagnostics when needed.



What We’re Looking For:

Has over 5 years of accounting work history.

At least 3 years of U.S.-based professional bookkeeping experience.

Experience working with real estate, property management, or service-based businesses (preferred).

Proficiency in QuickBooks Online and Google Workspace.

Background in using Double (formerly Keeper) is required.

Experience with Asana, and Slack is nice to have.

Strong knowledge of GAAP and best bookkeeping practices.

Preferred: QBO ProAdvisor certification.

Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.

Strong communication and client-facing ability.

Traits we value: proactive, solutions-oriented, team player, systems thinker.



Teck Stack:

QuickBooks Online (QBO) – Primary accounting and reporting platform

Asana – Task and workflow management

Slack – Internal and client communication

Notion – SOPs, documentation, and knowledge base

Double (formerly Keeper) – Month-end close and transaction review, receipt management and report package and client communication tool.

Google Drive – File storage and collaboration

Gusto – Payroll and payroll-related reporting

Hostaway & Hospitable – Short-term rental/property management platforms

Stripe – Payment processing and reconciliation

Airbnb, VRBO, 
 – OTA integrations and revenue tracking

AppFolio, Escapia, RentVine – Property management systems



Why You’ll Love Working Here:

Supportive Team: Join a team that values collaboration and celebrates achievements.

Career Growth: Opportunities for professional development and advancement.

Loyalty: Tea
mbers who worked with the founder in a prior company have followed.  Two have over 10 years with the founder.  Generous opportunities for personal and professional development without the corporate garbage that steals your soul. 

Health & Wellness Benefits: We care about your well-being and provide resources to keep you at your best.

Flexible Work Environment: Enjoy a balanced work-life with options for remote work.



Perks:

80-120 Hours of PTO

7- Paid Holidays

13th Month Payroll

Paid Philippine HMO plan

Paid Social Security System

Paid Philippine Health 

Maternity/ Paternity Benefits

Advancement after Proof of Mastery

Performance Goals with advancement compensation



We can’t wait to meet you and discover the value you’ll bring to our team! If this sounds like a role you’re excited about, apply now and help us continue building a workplace we all love

title: Data entry
description:
**Please make sure you have ID proof of 80 or higher or your application will be deleted**



We are seeking an employee to help with our daily bookkeeping. We are a high volume e-commerce business. You will be responsible for data entry transposing of cost of goods into sales and calculating out the profit each shift. This is time sensitive data which we will double checked daily by our on site manager. Accurate bookkeeping and double checking your work to ensure mistake-free data entry is highly important. Pay raise possible with effective work presence and time with the company. Pay starts at $1.50/hour set for the first month, there is a raise to $2/hour the second month when you will have additional tasks and opportunities for raises each month.. We will require active mouse use for the duration of your shift to ensure maximum time efficiency. We have set SOP's for exactly the expected work. Punctuality is a priority for our company, you may not work on another job during your shift and no mouse movement pauses can happen during your shift or it will result in immediate termination. We are seeking employees who start at $1.50/hour but get promoted and pay raises each month and move onto covering more advanced roles within the company. Both part time and full-time positions are available.

title: Accounts Payable Specialist
description:
Omega Holdings is a private equity-owned leading distributor of air conditioning and other high demand aftermarket components to a broad range of light-duty and heavy-duty vehicle end markets. Omega has created a unique, market leading platform in the automotive aftermarket with numerous opportunities to apply its repeatable playbook to grow both organically and through acquisition. With our product portfolio, dedication to quality, entrepreneurial setting, and competitive strength, we are a great place to build a lasting career.



Omega Holdings is the largest independent after-marketer of heavy-duty air conditioning and heating components in the United States. Omega Holdings is searching for a skilled Accounts Payable Specialist to join our accounting team to help process, track, and record payments in an accurate, efficient, and timely manner. The AP specialist will have a daily, ongoing impact on financial transactions, keeping us on track, on time, and on good terms with our valued partners.



Job Summary:

The Accounts Payable Specialist will perform a wide range of accounting tasks in general accounting, which are routine in nature. The Accounts Payable Specialist will be responsible for reconciling accounts, processing expense invoices, verifying information, performing daily balancing including researching and solving outages, files and preparing accounting reports.



Duties/Responsibilities:

• Manages all aspects of Accounts Payable, ensuring timely and accurate reporting and payments.

• Receives and verifies expense reports; reconciles expense and other financial reports with account balances and other

office records.

• Assists with accounting records and ledgers by reconciling monthly statements and transactions.

• Processes weekly bill payments and records cash entries as needed.

• Facilitates payment of vendors, which may include verification of federal ID numbers, review purchase orders, and

resolving discrepancies.

• Maintains Vendor files and other clerical work.

• Handles administrative tasks as needed.

• Provides customer service to internal business partners.

• Ensures invoices, checks, and other documents are properly sorted, logged, scanned, and filed.

• Other related duties as assigned.



Required Skills/Abilities:

• Must possess a fundamental understanding of the standard concepts, practices, and procedures of

accounting/bookkeeping.

• Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Suite or related programs.

• Must be able to learn other accounting software systems.

• Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

• Ability to maintain confidential and meticulous records.

• Ability to multitask, follow up on pending items, work independently, and meet deadlines.



Preferred Skills/Abilities:

• Distribution, Manufacturing, or retail Industry experience is preferred.

• Experience with Continia, Microsoft Business Central or Microsoft Navision a plus.

• 3-way match to purchase order, packing list, to invoice processing experience

• Bi-lingual Spanish speaker a plus.



Education and Experience Requirements:

• High school diploma required, Business or Accounting degree preferred.

• Previous accounts payable experience preferred.



Omega Holdings is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Virtual Assistant (Part-Time) – Document & Compliance Focus
description:
We are looking for a meticulous and proactive Virtual Assistant to support a growing consulting practice. This role is best suited for someone who thrives in detail-driven environments, enjoys working extensively with documentation, and can confidently manage structured, form-based submissions.



A substantial portion of this position involves preparing, reviewing, and organizing official paperwork. Candidates with experience drafting, reviewing, or assembling government forms, regulatory filings, or compliance-related documents will be especially well positioned to succeed. The ideal applicant is process-oriented, highly accurate, and comfortable juggling multiple deadlines at once.



Core Responsibilities



- Prepare, review, and maintain a high volume of structured documents, applications, and form-based submissions.

- Track active matters, manage timelines, and proactively follow up on pending items.

- Compile and organize supporting documentation required for regulatory or compliance submissions.

- Maintain accurate internal logs, databases, and project trackers.

- Develop and refine internal workflows, checklists, and procedural guides.

- Conduct focused research on regulatory requirements, licensing procedures, and industry updates.

- Provide administrative and operational support to ensure projects move forward efficiently.



Qualifications



- Previous experience as a Virtual Assistant, Legal Assistant, Administrative Assistant, or in a comparable support role.

- Direct experience drafting, reviewing, or preparing government forms, regulatory filings, or other structured documentation.

- Exceptional attention to detail and strong written communication skills.

- Demonstrated ability to manage multiple assignments while meeting strict deadlines.

- Proficiency in Microsoft Office (including Excel), Google Workspace, and common remote collaboration platforms.

- Self-motivated, resourceful, and capable of working independently with minimal supervision.



Schedule



This is a part-time role. Hours will fluctuate based on project demands but will generally range from 15–20 hours per week. Please apply only if you are seeking part-time work and are available to work during U.S. business hours.



To be considered, please submit:



- Your resume

- A brief cover letter describing your relevant experience (especially any experience drafting or reviewing government forms)

- A short video introduction

- A sample of your work demonstrating drafting or document management skills

- To confirm that you have carefully reviewed this job posting, please include the word BLUEPRINT in the heading of your cover letter.



Please use at least 5 apply points.
