title: UGC job offer
description:
The job would consist of creating videos exactly like the ones I’ll send you as references here: 













 As you see, the concept is very simple: 



Film your reaction for 3–4 seconds (Snapchat-style, selfie mode).

Look surprised / shocked / excited.

Then show my website directly on screen, including the URL.

 

That’s it.

 

The website promotes my concerts community to helps fans secure their concert tickets more easily. The goal of these videos is to bring people into my concert community and help promote the platform.

 

You don’t need to speak.

You don’t need advanced editing skills.

Just film a natural reaction and follow the format.

 

 

The posting structure would be:

 

Post 2/3 times per day on Instagram and TikTok

Occasionally reply to comments

Potentially manage 2–3 accounts yourself

 

The idea is to scale multiple accounts using this format, which is why I’m looking for 3–4 creators to build this system.



The goal is to grow a community of concert fans and help promote a platform that helps them get tickets without stress.



Let me know if this interests you, and we can discuss details and compensation.

 



Looking forward to hearing from you.

title: Real Estate & Mortgage ISA – 2 Positions – $850 Base + Performance
description:
We are hiring 2 disciplined ISA operators to build a structured 2-shift lead handling system for a Washington State real estate & mortgage brokerage.



This is a long-term role. Not freelance. Not part-time. Not a side job.



To be considered, start your application with this exact phrase:



Speed to Lead is my priority



Applications without this exact phrase will be automatically rejected.



CURRENT LEAD STRUCTURE



Inbound volume currently averages 2–3 leads per day.



Phase 1 – CRM Stabilization



Clean and organize CRM



Fix pipeline stages



Reactivate existing leads



Build strict follow-up discipline



Phase 2 – High-Volume Calling



Outbound follow-up



Reactivation campaigns



Aged lead calling



Cold calling



Over time, this becomes a call-heavy role.



If you are not comfortable being on the phone most of your shift, do not apply.



SPEED TO LEAD RULE



Every new inbound lead must be called within 1–3 minutes during your shift.



Inbound volume will scale as performance improves.



SCHEDULE



36–40 hours per week



Fixed schedule



Two-shift coverage system



8–10 hour engagement days



No overlapping employment



COMPENSATION



$850/month base



Performance bonuses (discussed during interview)



RESPONSIVENESS TEST (CRITICAL)



Interviews may be scheduled with as little as 5 minutes notice between 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM Pacific Time.



If you are considered for interview and:



Do not respond within 5 minutes



Cannot join immediately



Fail to appear



Your application will be automatically disqualified.



This is a speed-based role. Responsiveness is mandatory.



TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS



Minimum 100 Mbps stable internet



Backup internet access



Quiet workspace



Professional headset



TO APPLY (Answer ALL in numbered format)



Can you guarantee 1–3 minute response time during your entire shift? Explain your exact system.



Are you comfortable making 50–100+ calls per day?



What is the highest number of calls you’ve completed in one day?



How many calls per hour can you sustain consistently?



How do you handle rejection during heavy cold calling days?



Which CRM systems have you used? Describe your exact tasks inside them.



If given a new CRM, how long until you are fully operational?



What is your internet speed (download/upload)?



Describe your backup internet setup.



Describe your power backup system.



Interviews may be scheduled with 5–10 minutes notice to test responsiveness. Are you comfortable with this?



Can you commit to a fixed 36–40 hour schedule with no overlapping employment?



Incomplete or non-numbered answers will not be reviewed.

title: Virtual Assistant
description:
About Us:

We are a fast-paced whiskey company based in the United States of America. We are passionate about what we do and are looking for a dedicated team player who wants to grow with us for the long haul. If you thrive in a dynamic environment and take pride in keeping things running smoothly behind the scenes, we want to hear from you.



Role Overview:

As our Virtual Assistant, you will be an essential part of our operations — keeping communications organized, orders moving, and our team on track. s

title: Senior Account Manager for Carter Business Consultants
description:
Job Description for a Senior Account Manager 

Position: Sr. Account Manager

Company: Carter Business Consultants 

Location: Remote (Overseas – Full-Time)

Hours: Part-time to start and then quickly ramp up into 35-40 hours per week (expect to go fulltime)

Compensation: $15-$20/hour (based on experience) + performance-based bonus opportunities

Reports To: Founder / CFO (Christopher Carter)



Please Apply Here: 

About Carter Business Consultants

Carter Business Consultants serves independent auto repair shop owners ($1M–$5M revenue per location) by providing:

Accrual-based bookkeeping

Financial clarity

Industry-specific KPI reporting

CFO advisory support

Our mission is to give shop owners accurate, actionable financials so they can make confident decisions and build profitable, sustainable businesses.

Our long-term vision is to build a scalable, systems-driven firm where the Founder focuses on sales and CFO advisory, not day-to-day bookkeeping execution.

We operate on these values:

Accuracy above all — the numbers must tell the truth

Ownership — problems are solved, not passed upward

Continuous improvement — systems evolve and get stronger

Integrity & faith-led leadership

This role is foundational to operational excellence at CBC.

Role Overview

The Automotive Bookkeeper Account Manager is the operational owner of assigned client accounts.

This is a Senior Execution Seat, not an entry-level bookkeeping role.

You are responsible for:

Accurate month-end closes

Workflow compliance

Quality control

Client-level bookkeeping execution

Cleanup projects

Escalation discipline

Time efficiency

The Founder should not be fixing reconciliations, correcting basic errors, or rescuing files at the last minute.

If that is happening, this seat is not functioning properly.

Core Responsibilities

Client Account Ownership

Manage 8–15 automotive bookkeeping clients

Own full month-end close process

Ensure reconciliations are complete and accurate

Deliver files ready for Founder review

Maintain clean, accurate balance sheets

Proactively flag anomalies or concerns

You are accountable for file quality before it reaches the Founder.

Automotive-Specific Accounting

This niche requires strong reconciliation skills and comfort with manual processes.

You must become proficient in:

Working with third-party shop management systems

Reconciling summary journal entries into QuickBooks Online

Managing high-volume vendor payables (O’Reilly, AutoZone, Advance, etc.)

Reconciling clearing accounts

Customer deposit & AR reconciliation

Accrual-based bookkeeping standards

Manual journal entry accuracy

This role requires advanced problem-solving, not task-following.

Month-End Close Deadlines (Critical KPI)

Files must be ready for Founder review by the 10th business day of each month

Client financial delivery deadline is the 15th business day

Escalations must occur before Day 8

No last-minute emergency fixes due to avoidable delays

Failure to meet delivery timelines is a performance issue.

Workflow & Double Compliance (Non-Negotiable)

Double is CBC’s system of record.

You are required to:

Complete and check off every task in Double

Mark tasks complete or cancelled — no silent omissions

Avoid parallel spreadsheets outside approved workflows

Use Double as the single source of truth

Failure to use Double correctly prevents operational visibility and is considered a performance issue.

Escalation Protocol (Required Behavior)

You must follow the documented escalation framework:

Follow defined timelines for client follow-up

Use approved
/templates for missing documents

Document escalation steps inside Double

Escalate only after required steps are completed

Founder is the last point of escalation

Do not escalate basic bookkeeping questions.

“Ask Three Before Me” Standard

Before escalating a question, you must:

Check the SOP

Check Double documentation

Propose a solution

Do not bring problems without suggested next steps.

This is a professional expectation at CBC.

Quality Control

Review your work before submission

Zero unreconciled accounts

Zero uncleared transactions

Follow structured close checklist

Deliver clean files, not 85% files

Accuracy is the baseline expectation.

Cleanup & Catch-Up Projects

Execute year-end cleanup projects within estimated budgets

Target: ~30 hours per year cleanup unless complexity requires otherwise

Protect company margin

Document recurring errors for prevention

Cleanups must not balloon due to inefficiency.

Time Tracking & Efficiency

All time must be tracked daily in Clockify (or approved system)

Time is reviewed weekly

Efficiency per client is measured

Excessive hours without explanation will be addressed

Maintain profitability per client

This is a business, not a hobby.

Limited Client Communication

Respond to bookkeeping-related client inquiries

Request documentation

Follow escalation framework

Escalate strategic decisions to Founder

Clients should feel supported — not chaotic.

Performance Standards

This role operates under a structured 90-day performance framework.

The following are considered performance issues:

Missed deadlines

Failure to follow workflow

Repeated basic errors

Not using Double properly

Excessive escalations

Lack of ownership

May result in:

Formal Performance Improvement Plan

Reduced client load

Termination

Expectations are clear and documented.

KPIs

30 Days:

Understand automotive workflow

Manage 3–5 accounts independently

Demonstrate Double compliance

60 Days:

Manage 8+ accounts

Deliver files by Day 10 consistently

Maintain clean reconciliations

Demonstrate independent problem-solving

90 Days:

Founder no longer performing QC

Month-end runs smoothly

Escalations significantly reduced

Clients consistently delivered on time

Required Qualifications

4+ years professional bookkeeping experience

Advanced QuickBooks Online proficiency

Strong accrual accounting knowledge

Experience reconciling high-volume payables

Experience working with U.S. clients

Excellent written English

Preferred:

Automotive accounting experience

CPA or accounting credential

Experience in niche bookkeeping firm

Required Traits

We are specifically hiring for:

Ownership mentality

High accountability

Strong reconciliation confidence

Problem-solving initiative

Comfort with complexity

Process discipline

Calm under pressure

We are not hiring someone who:

Avoids difficult reconciliations

Requires constant direction

Escalates simple issues

Resists systems

Cultural Fit

Comfortable working in a faith-led company

Values operational clarity

Communicates professionally

Growth-oriented

Future Growth

This role may grow into:

Senior Account Lead

Oversight of junior bookkeepers

Expanded operational authority

CBC is building a scalable structure — not replacing chaos with chaos.

What Success Looks Like

Founder focuses on sales and CFO advisory

Month-end stress decreases

Financials are delivered predictably

Clients feel confident

Systems run cleanly

Please Apply Here:

title: Paralegal (Fertility & Surrogacy Law)
description:
About Us:?



AbroadWorks is a fast growing global enterprise with established operations in the United States, India, and the Philippines. We specialize in providing both service-based solutions and advanced tech to help North American organizations in finding, onboarding, and managing global talent easily.



Our Offerings:



Global Staffing Services: Currently, the majority of our revenue is generated through our comprehensive global staffing services, which cater to the diverse needs of our clients.



Technology Solutions: Looking ahead, our strategic focus is to expand our footprint in the software sector, leveraging our technology to improve global human capital and talent management processes.



Job Title: Paralegal (Fertility & Surrogacy Law)



Location: Fully Remote, Philippines



Salary: $6.00 - $10.00 per hour based on experience



Schedule: Monday to Friday, Eastern Standard Time



Job Type: Full-Time



Job Description:



As a Paralegal specializing in Fertility and Surrogacy law, you will support the busiest fertility law practice in Canada, assisting with drafting, client coordination, and preliminary contract review to reduce the lawyer’s workload. The role requires responsiveness, professionalism, and compassion, including some availability on evenings and weekends as needed.



Requirements: 



Prior experience as a paralegal or legal assistant (experience in family law, fertility law, or contracts is a major plus).

Strong drafting skills and exceptional attention to detail.

Excellent English communication skills (written and spoken).

Highly responsive and reliable, including comfort answering urgent questions outside standard business hours.

Empathy and professionalism when dealing with clients in sensitive situations.

Ability to work in high-volume, fast-moving environments.

Experience with FileVine (preferred but not required).



Responsibilities:



Draft legal agreements involving donors, surrogates, and intended parents, including declarations and statutory documentation.

Conduct initial review of contracts to ensure financial terms are correct, key protections are included, and client-specific needs are documented.

Prepare contracts for final lawyer review, reducing review time.

Assist with statutory declarations of parentage and other reproductive law documents.

Conduct initial intake calls with surrogates, donors, and intended parents.

Gather financial needs and relevant details during intake conversations.

Answer routine and time-sensitive client questions with same-day responsiveness.

Maintain client relationships with empathy, professionalism, and regular communication.

Ensure all case files are accurate and up to date within FileVine.

Coordinate with internal tea
mbers and external partners, including agencies and clinics.

Organize documents, track deadlines, and support the lawyer in managing a high-volume practice.



Successful candidates for this role are expected to possess the following attributes:??



Must have excellent English communication skills.



Has the ability to complete projects in a timely manner and quickly adjust to changing circumstances and embrace new technologies, processes, or methods.



Great logical and verbal reasoning skills.



Exceptionally detail-oriented.



Exceptional problem-solving and information-processing skills.



Ability to think outside the box.



A great work ethic and interest in learning new concepts and growing with the job.



Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.



Must have their own work device (preferably a desktop or laptop) and a stable internet connection.



Must be comfortable with using a time-tracking software for payroll purposes.



Must be willing to undergo a background verification check during the final stages of the hiring process.



Successful candidates for this role will be rewarded with the following benefits:



A total of five paid vacation days per year (additional days can be taken unpaid).



A 5% raise per year guaranteed (additional raises or bonuses may be given for outstanding performance).



A paid 15-minute break for every 4 hours of work.



Healthcare benefits after 2 months of full-time work.



* Vacation days increase by 1 vacation day per year. I.e. after one year of employment, the total paid vacation days on year 2 would be six, on year 3 seven, etc.



Our main focus is to build an energized and motivated workforce where our employees are happy and satisfied with their jobs and growth opportunities.



We are looking forward to making you a part of our team!



Thank you for your time and interest.

title: Assistant Property Manager
description:
INTRODUCTION: Hello! 
 (on IG). I'm an entrepreneur that started by buying rentals and is now developing houses by building and renovating in Nashville, TN. Now with ~35 units, I established a property management company (
) to manage them. My goal is 100 rental units, but to get there I need your help! I rely heavily on my team in place to keep things running smoothly so I can grow the company.



Location: Remote

Time Schedule: Business hours M - F in the U.S.A. (Overnight hours in the Philippines)

Compensation: $6-8/hr USD, paid bi-weekly via Onlinejobs.ph

Benefits: Paid USA bank holidays (~13 days) after trial period.



Job Summary:

Flywheel needs an APM to run the day to day business operations. You will report to me, Allan, for confirming outcome metrics and overcoming obstacles. You are the singular employee of Flywheel and play a critical role in its success!



The Perks:

    • Play a direct role in a growing local company and enjoy a distinct sense of satisfaction from seeing results that YOU made happen.

    • Enjoy autonomy of identifying and handling tasks using your own judgment, without micromanagement of a supervisor. 

    • Plenty of training provided to build on your existing experience and ensure your success!   



A Typical Week:

    • Receive notice of a tenant not renewing lease. Schedule contractor to begin turnover repairs.

    • Receive a maintenance request from a unit in the software, and forward to the appropriate vendor.

    • Follow up on certain tenants if rent not received on the 1st.

    • Run month-end reports and distribute to rental property owners.



Qualifications:

    • Read sections “Outcomes” & “Core Competencies” down below.

    • This job is not for a “first timer”. Only those with Property Management experience need apply.

    • Level of Completed Education: N/A

    • English Fluency: 4+ out of 5. Some accent is fine but must be easy to understand.



===============================================



Mission: To manage a rental property portfolio for maximum profitability, especially by turning vacancies quickly and handling repairs and maintenance requests quickly and cost-effectively.



Outcomes: Property Management 

    • Rent collections are at 100% by the end of each month (excluding detainer warrants).

    • Vacant units are filled in less than 3 weeks by getting units rent-ready, listing them, and screening tenants.

    • Global Vacancy stays at or below 5% on a trailing 30 day basis (different from the above in that low global vacancy means tenants are staying and renewing leases likely due to effective management)

    • All valid maintenance requests are completed within 7 days by quickly scheduling vendors and following up.

    • Recurring tasks are performed on time by completing each item in the SOP’s checklists (Ex: Interim inspections, monthly owner statements and distributions).

    •

title: CSR Team Lead
description:
CSR Team Lead (Remote)

Rate: $5 up to $7/hour 

Schedule: US Time Zone (PST) | Full-time Role



Are you a results-driven leader who loves motivating people, building strong teams, and delivering excellent customer experiences? Are you highly organized, quick on your feet, and persistent when it comes to achieving goals? If yes, this role is for you!



We’re looking for a CSR Team Lead who can guide and support our Customer Service team, improve workflows, and help build long-term relationships with our customers. This is a great opportunity to grow your leadership skills while making a real impact.



Key Responsibilities

- Develop and improve operational processes to enhance customer service efficiency

- Provide clear and consistent direction to tea
mbers to ensure timely and high-quality customer support

- Monitor team performance, identify strengths and areas for improvement, and provide coaching when needed

- Deliver detailed performance feedback and reports to management for evaluation and recognition purposes

- Address escalated or complex customer concerns and resolve complaints effectively

- Delegate tasks strategically to ensure smooth and efficient daily operations

- Implement changes to workflows when current processes are not producing optimal results

- Take disciplinary action when necessary, following company guidelines



Requirements & Qualifications

- At least 5 years of customer service experience

- Proven leadership or team management experience

- Fast learner and self-starter

- Strong communication, listening, and interpersonal skills

- Highly organized and detail-oriented

- Patient, adaptable, and able to work in a fast-paced environment

- Tech-savvy and comfortable using customer service tools and systems

- Demonstrates professionalism, reliability, and efficiency

- Able to stay calm and composed under pressure

- Has a reliable internet connection and the ability to work with a dual-monitor setup



Why Join Us?

Our Customer Service team is the face of the company. You’ll play a vital role in shaping customer experiences, strengthening team performance, and building lasting customer relationships. If you’re passionate about leadership, customer satisfaction, and teamwork, we’d love to have you on board.



How to Apply:

description:

Schedule: Must be available to work during the US (PST) time zone. 30 to 40 hours per week



We are seeking a Customer Experience Representative to join our dynamic team! This role is ideal for someone who excels at communication, learns quickly, and thrives in a fast-paced, customer-focused environment.

title: Outbound Sales / Appointment Setter (A-Players Only)
description:
Your Role

- You will be the first point of contact for men actively looking for help. Your job is to engage leads through calls, chat, and follow-ups, qualify them properly, and book high-quality appointments for our Sales Team.

- This is high-volume outbound work, not passive inbound setting.



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

- 1.5–2+ years experience in outbound sales or appointment setting

- Comfortable making 200+ calls per day

- Strong spoken and written English

- Calm, emotionally stable, and confident under pressure

- Able to handle conversations about porn, addiction, and sexual behavior

- Coachable and precise with scripts and frameworks

- Self-motivated and accountable

- Reliable internet and power with backup

- Experience in health, wellness, fitness, or coaching sales is a plus.



What You’ll Do Daily

- Make high-volume outbound calls to warm and cold leads

- Hold real conversations and book qualified appointments

- Follow call and chat frameworks

- Maintain clean CRM notes and activity tracking

- Hit KPIs consistently without reminders



Who You’ll Be Speaking With

- High-functioning and ambitious men

- Private, guarded, and serious once engaged

- Looking for real help, not motivation



What We Offer

- Fully remote role

- Clear scripts, KPIs, and expectations

- Training and ongoing coaching

- Consistent lead flow

- Long-term growth for top performers



About Us

- Elevated Recovery® helps high-functioning men overcome porn addiction and rebuild discipline, relationships, and sexual health. We have helped 15,000+ men over the last 14 years.



Do NOT Apply If



- You avoid volume or pressure

- You need constant motivation

- You dislike structure or accountability



How to Apply

- Send your resume and a short note explaining why this role fits you. 



Secret Code: 21



Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Jr. Workflow Automation & Integration Specialist
description:
About Us

At ProfitWorks, our people are the core of everything we do. We’re committed to building a supportive, growth-focused environment where everyone feels valued. We’re hiring a Jr. Workflow Automation & Integration Specialist to support one of our long-term U.S. clients, a highly respected company in the painting industry known for its award-winning culture.



We’re a recruitment and solutions firm serving the home services and trades industry. Our growth is entirely referral-based, we maintain a client waiting list, and we’ve kept every client since day one. We do things differently: we prioritize relationships, excellence, and building solutions that truly help our clients succeed.



What We’re Looking For



Interest or experience in software systems, automation, or process improvement

Experience with Zapier, Make, 
, other automation and integration tools

Comfortable working with data and basic reporting

Organized, detail-oriented, and tech-curious

Strong English communication skills

Self-motivated and able to work independently in a remote setup

Experience working with U.S. clients is a plus

Bonus: experience experimenting with automation or APIs (not required)

What You’ll Do



Process & Workflow Support



Help create and improve simple workflows.

Assist in automating tasks using tools like Zapier and Make.

Data & Reporting



Keep data clean, accurate, and updated.

Help prepare basic reports and dashboards.

Software Integration



Support connecting tools so they work seamlessly together (e.g., PaintScounts, Acuity, RingCentral, 
).

Learn how APIs and automation tools work.

Tech Research & Improvement



Explore new tools and suggest improvements.

Help the team use technology more efficiently.

Collaboration & Culture



Work closely with both U.S. and Philippine teams.

Be a supportive, proactive team player.

Take ownership of your work and stay open to learning and feedback.

Benefits (90 days Probation):



$700-$800 per month

80-120 Hours of PTO

7- Paid Holidays (US or PH)

13th Month Payroll 

Paid Philippine HMO plan

Paid Social Security System

Paid Philippine Health

Performance Goals with advancement compensation (Annual Salary Review/Appraisal

Job Type: Full-time



Benefits:





Health insurance

Work from home

Describe your experience creating or improving workflows and using automation tools like Zapier or Make.

Have you previously connected multiple software tools (e.g., CRMs, scheduling apps, VoIP tools) to work together? What platforms or APIs have you worked with?

title: Integration QA Tester (Manual & Automation Testing) - WFH
description:
About Us:



At ProfitWorks, we believe that our people are the heart of our success. We are passionate about creating an environment where everyone feels valued, supported, and excited to grow. Our team has two tea
mbers that have been with the founder for over ten years. Multiple others are nearing the five-year mark. This client is highly respected in the painting industry with national accolades and known for an incredible culture.



What we do:



We are a recruitment firm serving the home service and trades industry. Our referrals are all word of mouth, we have a client waiting list for onboarding. This is our fifth-year, and we still have every client we started the business with. We do things differently. It’s all about relationships and serving with excellence. We build and create solutions for our clients to be assisted with critical functions in their business.



About this role:



We are seeking a highly detail-oriented QA Tester with experience in both manual and automation testing to ensure the reliability, accuracy, and performance of our tools and workflow systems. You will work directly with cross-functional teams to test integrations across platforms like PaintScouts, Acuity, RingCentral, and 
, helping ensure they function seamlessly as one ecosystem.



What You'll Do:



Manual Testing



Perform functional, regression, integration, and user-acceptance testing across multiple systems

Validate workflows, data accuracy, and system behavior

Identify, document, and track system defects using established QA processes

Review requirements to ensure full understanding and test coverage

Automation Testing



Support the creation and execution of automated test scripts for repetitive or workflow-based processes

Maintain and update automation test cases as systems evolve

Collaborate with developers to improve test frameworks

Use automation tools to test system-to-system integrations

System Integration Testing



Test and troubleshoot integrations between:

PaintScouts

Acuity

RingCentral



Validate data flow between systems to ensure accuracy and consistency

Work with team leads to optimize and improve system connectivity

Data & Reporting Validation



Verify data cleanliness and accuracy across platforms

Test dashboards and reporting tools for correct calculations, filtering, and logic

Flag inconsistencies and recommend improvements

Collaboration & Continuous Improvement



Collaborate with the cross functional team on test planning, issue resolution, and

release cycles

Communicate test results clearly and effectively

Suggest enhancements to workflows, automations, and QA processes

Stay curious and updated on new tools, technologies, and best practices in testing



What We're Looking For:



2+ years of experience in manual testing, with exposure to automation testing

Experience with automation tools

Strong understanding of QA methodologies, testing processes, and defect tracking

Comfortable working with data, spreadsheets, and basic reporting tools

Excellent attention to detail and strong organizational skills

Good communication skills (English – written & spoken)

Ability to work independently in a remote environment

Experience collaborating with US-based clients

Your Tech Stack.



Automation tools for testing

Preferred but not required:



PaintScouts

Acuity

RingCentral

Zapier, Make

100% Remote — Work from anywhere

Supportive Team — We value collaboration, curiosity, and improvement

Career Path — Opportunity to grow into more senior roles

Make an Impact — Help improve systems that power a growing business

What We Value:



Curiosity and hunger to improve

Integrity and accountability

Clear communication and teamwork

Being resourceful and solutions-oriented





Why You’ll Love Working Here:





Supportive Team: Join a team that values collaboration and celebrates achievements.

Loyalty: Tea
mbers who worked with the founder in a prior company have followed. Two have over 11 years with the founder. Generous opportunities for personal and professional development without the corporate garbage that steals your soul.

title: US Estimator - WFH
description:
About PW USA:



At ProfitWorks, we believe that our people are the heart of our success. We are passionate about creating an environment where everyone feels valued, supported, and excited to grow. We’re looking for an Estimator Administrator to join our team to work directly with our client in the USA. Our team has two tea
mbers that have been with the founder for over ten years. Multiple others are nearing the five-year mark. This client is highly respected in the painting industry with national accolades and known for an incredible culture.



What we do:



We are a recruitment firm serving the home service and trades industry. Our referrals are all word of mouth, we have a client waiting list for onboarding. This is our fifth-year, and we still have every client we started the business with. We do things differently. It’s all about relationships and serving with excellence. We build and create solutions for our clients to be assisted with critical functions in their business.



Job Overview



Position: US Estimator



Salary: $1,200 - $1,300USD/month



Schedule: Philippines Graveyard Shift (8AM - 5PM EST Monday - Friday)



Location: Remote (100% Permanent WFH)



Job role:



As an Estimator, you will play a crucial role in accurately estimating costs and ensuring the success and profitability of our clients' projects. You're responsible for preparing accurate and competitive cost estimates for thermal and moisture protection scopes, including roofing, waterproofing, insulation, fireproofing, and building envelope systems. This role involves analyzing project plans, specifications, and related documents to determine material, labor, and equipment costs, and working closely with project managers, subcontractors, and suppliers. Your expertise in quantity takeoffs, cost estimation, vendor coordination, and meticulous documentation will contribute to the overall efficiency and excellence of our projects.



Key Qualifications:



Organization and Time Management: Strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously, meet deadlines, and prioritize tasks effectively.



Experience: A minimum of 2 years of US experience as an Estimator or in a similar role within the construction industry.



Construction Knowledge: Strong understanding of commercial construction processes, materials, and methods..

Blueprint Reading: Proficiency in reading and interpreting construction plans, specifications, and related documents.



Takeoff Software: Experience with construction takeoff software tools, such as Bluebeam, On-Screen Takeoff, Procore Estimating, or similar applications.



Attention to Detail: Strong attention to detail to perform accurate quantity takeoffs and cost estimates, leaving no room for errors.



Cost Estimation Skills: Proficiency in cost estimation techniques, including knowledge of material and labor costs, as well as an understanding of market trends.



Organization and Time Management: Strong organizational skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously, meet deadlines, and prioritize tasks effectively.



Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to collaborate with project teams, vendors, and suppliers.



Analytical Thinking: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to identify and resolve issues during the takeoff process.

Ai: The industry is moving quickly – we want to embrace all the technology that will make us more efficient.

Why You’ll Love Working Here:



Supportive Team: Join a team that values collaboration and celebrates achievements.

Career Growth: Opportunities for professional development and advancement.

Loyalty: Tea
mbers who worked with the founder in a prior company have followed. Two have over 11 years with the founder. Generous opportunities for personal and professional development without the corporate garbage that steals your soul.



Health & Wellness Benefits: We care about your well-being and provide resources to keep you at your best.

Flexible Work Environment: Enjoy a balanced work-life with options for remote work.



Benefits:



80-120 Hours of PTO

7- Paid Holidays

13th Month Payroll

Paid Philippine HMO plan

Paid Social Security System

Paid Philippine Health

Paid training

Advancement after Proof of Mastery

Performance Goals with advancement compensation

Job Type: Full-time



Benefits:





Paid training

Work from home

Application Question(s):





Willing to work US hours (PH night shift)?

Willing to use a time tracking tool (Time Doctor) once hired?

Do you have a backup computer, backup Internet and dual monitors? (or willing to purchase missing requirements once hired)

Experience:





Remote/WFH: 2 years (Required)

US Construction Industry: 2 years (Required)

On-Screen Takeoff (OST) tool: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote
